loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase her stock of blankets and bedsheets

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: BilA., a 41-year-old married father of three children from Marka, Jordan, has a garage where he repairs vehicles. BilA. is requesting a loan of 1200JD to improve his garage. He is looking forward to increasing his income and improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his garage.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina, who is 47 years old, has eight children ranging in age from 13-27 years old, all in school except for the youngest. Her husband sells spare parts. Amina has been selling shoes since 2009, and her business is doing well, enabling her to feed her family and buy her children clothes. Amina is requesting a loan to buy more shoes to sell and hopes to use the additional profits to better feed her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Triphonie

texts.en:
Triphonie, who is 37 years old, has four children ranging in age from 4-16 years old. With her husband, Triphonie owns a business selling a variety of items commonly used at home including salt, matches, sugar, etc. Operating this business since 1998 has enabled her to educate her children and feed her family.

She is now requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle which will enable her to transport her goods from the shop where she buys items to her own shop. She plans to save all the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help her in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reopen a grocery shop that has closed down.

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Redemia is in her early thirties and is married with a small child who is in school.

For the past four years Redemia has been selling fruit, other small food items and tea. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. each day and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Redemia’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will share this loan with her loan group. The group is called “Ebeneza” and has 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Redemia used her previous loans to buy more small food items to sell along with her tea and has successfully paid back all of her loans. She hopes for a loan to sell more fruit. Her dream is to own her own restaurant where she can sell drinks, chips, meat and other food items.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben comes from the village of Siktarva, Imereti region, in the western part of the country. He is 49 years old, married and lives with his wife Nana, ten-year-old daughter and eight-year-old son. Ruben is a farmer and agricultural activities are the main source of income for the family. Their average monthly income is 370 Laris, including a 70 Laris pension for Ruben’s daughter given to her by the government because of her health problems.
Ruben’s family has two cows, and their milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold to local dairy product retailers. Also Ruben has 1 ha vineyard with 600 vines. Half of the harvested grapes are sold and the rest are used for wine production. The produced wine is sold locally.
With his requested loan, Ruben plans to build a small greenhouse. He will grow vegetables all year round and sell them on the local market. This venture will be positively reflected in the family income. More income will allow the family to improve its everyday life.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Iguguno Group

texts.en:
Leonard is in his early thirties and divorced with one child. His son is too young to go to school.

For the past year Leonard has worked as a brick maker. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. each day and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Leonard's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will share this loan with his loan group. The group is called “Iguguno” and has sixteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Leonard wants to use his loan to make more bricks to sell. His dream is to buy a plot of land upon which to begin farming vegetables.

loans.use: to make more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Sabougnima Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Il est composé de 06 femmes habitant le même quartier et partagent les même ambitions.

Madame Mariama qui est à droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée 38 ans. elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en charge un enfant confié par un parent.

Elle s'active dans la vente de lait. Activité qu'elle pratique depuis très longtemps.

Avec ce prêt elle compte augmenter sa marchandises afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle va gagner, elle participera à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants en charge.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on October 19, 2001. It is composed of 6 women who live in the same neighborhood and share the same ambitions.

Mrs Mariama, standing at the right on the picture and raising her hand, is responsible for the group. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of four children. She cares also for the child of a parent of hers.

Mariama sells milk. She has been in this business for a very long time. She intends to use her loan to increase her inventory and better meet her customers' demand.

She will use her future profit to participate in school fees for the children in her care.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en:
Wilfrida is 43 years old and married with six children. The family lives in Huruma Estate (suburb) in Nairobi, Kenya. 

Wilfrida sells chips and vegetables in the family’s estate where most of her customers come from. She is very dedicated to her work.

Wilfrida is a hardworking lady who intends to take care of her children through a loan which will help her increase her stock. Her plan is to become a supplier of farm products in the estate.

loans.use: to increase her stock of chips and vegetables.

loans.name: Afisa

texts.en:
Afisa is 52 years old, married and has nine children aged twelve to 32 years old. Apart from the eldest two children, her children are in school. Her husband sells soft drinks such as sodas while Afisa sells food stuffs such as small fish, and sunflower oil she gets from neighboring Burundi.

Afisa is in need of a loan to buy more fish and sunflower oil in order to make more of a profit. With her profits she plans to continue paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish and sunflower oil to sell.

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Christina is in her late twenties and married with two children. The eldest child attends school, while the other is still too young to do so.

For the past three years Christina has sold second-hand clothing, sarongs and fabric. She works from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. each day and is able to earn a small monthly profit.

This will be Christina's first “motisha” loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group. The group is called “Mungu Tubariki” and has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Christina hopes to buy and sell more second-hand clothing, sarongs and fabric. With her profits she will pay for her children's school fees, and one day, she hopes to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy and sell more second-hand clothing, sarongs and fabric.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 33 years old. She has 8 children who are ages 3-28 years old. Four of Chantal's children are adopted, and the other four are her own.Four are in school, two completed high school,joining the university soon and the the other two didn’t go to school at all. Her husband works in a bank. 

Chantal owns a shop in which she sells rental bridal dresses, traditional clothes and shoes. She has been doing this business since 2009 and her business is going well. She is requesting a loan to buy more traditional clothes because what she has is out-of-fashion. She plans to save her profits and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell

loans.name: Joba Ysabel

texts.es:
Joba de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, contando con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece a la provincia de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Joba es a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas en su domicilio desde hace algunos años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora y así pueda obtener más ingresos para su casa.  También cría aves de corral que una vez alcancen su desarrollo ideal los vende y es otro ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

El crédito solicitado por a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten, podrá pagar su préstamo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.   El deseo de Joba es tener más adelante una tienda grande y surtida que le genere mayores ingresos para brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Joba, 29, lives with her husband and two children in her own house, which only has electricity.  It is located in the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the province of Piura.  This area is mainly involved in agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For a few years, Joba has been selling groceries and beverages out of her home, which means she can attend to customers at any hour of the day. This provides her with another income to help cover household expenses.

With the loan of 500 PEN requested through Edpyme Alternativa, she plans to buy more merchandise and expand her business with other products.  Once sales increase she can pay back the loan and give her family a better lifestyle.  In the future she would like to have a larger store with a wider array of products.  This would increase her income so she can give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Carlos de 51 años  de edad, vive junto con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz , ubicada en el distrito de Ferreñafe que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola (siembran arroz y algodón), ganadera y turismo (zona arqueológica).

Carlos  se dedica  a la agricultura por más de 18 años, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra arroz, producto que se consume mucho en los alimentos diarios de todos los pobladores, con el dinero que obtendrá en la venta de su arroz podrá mejorar la calidad de vida  para toda su familia.

Ha  solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de arroz para poder pagar el crédito brindado como incrmentar sus ingresos y darles lo que necesita su esposa e hijos.  Carlos es conocido  por ser un hombre responsable y trabajador en la zona donde vive, todo el esfuerzo que demanda su trabajo es con la meta de sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos, 51, lives with his wife in his hown house, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the district of Ferreñafe which is a few minutes from the provicne of Chiclayo.  The inhabitants here are mainly involved in agriculture (growing rice and cotton), livestock farming and toursim (archeological sites).

For over 18 years Carlos has been farming his own land where he grows rice, which is a product consumed daily by many people.  With the income obtained from the sale of rice he can improve his family's lifestyle.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer for his crop land to make sure he has a good rice harvest in order to pay back the loan and to have more income to give his wife and children what they need.  Carlos is known as a responsable, hard-working man where he lives.  His goal is to work as hard as necessary to help his family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve crop field and crops.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana, es  comerciante, con más de nueve años en la venta de ropa y cosmético, gracias  a sus ventas a ayudado a su familia, a tener mejores condiciones económicas. Su esposo labora como conductor. Y su hijo menor cursa la primaria.
Ana inicio este negocio, con iniciativa propia y con poco capital, lo que vino a mejorar y aumentar con financiamiento que Afodenic, ha otorgado en cuatro ciclos. Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de ropa variada y cosmético, siendo de mucha demanda, el cual tiene pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is a merchant with more than nine years experience selling clothes and cosmetics.  Thanks to her sales she’s helped her family have better economic conditions.  Her husband works as a driver.  Her young son is in elementary school.

Ana started this business on her own initiative and with little capital that she improved with loans from Afodenic that she’s gotten in four cycles.  She will use this new loan to buy assorted clothes and cosmetics which are in high demand and for which she has pending customer orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mrarangrangi Group

texts.en:
Alfred is in his earlier 30s. He is married with 2 children. His oldest child is in school and he has another child who was just recently born. For the past 7 years, Alfred has been selling fruits and vegetables. He works from 5 am to 10 pm each day and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Alfred's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has used his previous loans to buy a plot of land, for household expenses and school fees, and to purchase additional fruit. He has successfully paid back all of his loans. Alfred will use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and to begin selling rice, as well. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Alfred will share this loan with his loan group. The group is called “Mrarangrangi” and has 20 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, as well as rice to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita es una madre de familia de 20 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con una  con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Ferreñafe que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Ferreñafe se caracteriza por ser una zona netamente agricola, ganadera y turística (zona arqueológica).

Anita se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y es conocida por su vecinos porque ofrece sus productos de casa en casa,  estos productos es para que las personas mejoren su imagen perosnal, en especial las mujeres y con esos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a su hijo y ayudar a su esposo económicamente.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para adquirir más productos de belleza y pueda seguir ofreciendoles a sus clientes, al incrementar sus ventas podrá pagar su préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Anita es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Anita is a 20 year old mother who lives with her husband and son in their own house that only has electricity.  They live in the Ferreñafe district in the department of Lambayeque.  Ferreñafe is characterized as being a distinctly agricultural, ranching and tourist (archaeological) zone.  

Anita sells beauty products and is known by her neighbors because she sells her products house to house.  These products are for people who want to improve their personal image, especially women.  The income helps provide for her son and helps her husband financially.  

She has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more beauty products to offer her customers.  As her sales increase she will be able to pay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  Anita is well-known for being a hard-working, responsible woman and a good mother that wants to give her children a better future.

loans.use: purchase beauty products so that she can increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María madre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo y  sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con 
sólo servicio de luz, ubicado  en el distrito de Monsefú que peretenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

María se dedica  a la crianza de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas son apropiados y espaciosos están a unos minutos de su casa, a sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en los
diferentes mercados de Chiclayo, con el dinero que ahorrado por la venta de sus ovjeas a comprado una mototaxi de segunda para que le facilite en movilizarse a los sitios que tiene que ir y de paso también la trabaja y puede tener otro ingreso para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y cambiarle algunos repuestos que le hacen falta para su buen funcionamiento, además desea realizar algunos  arreglos en su casa.   María es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, dispuesta ayudar a otros, pero quiere que su familia se supere en especial sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a mother and she is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and  three children. They live in their own house with electricity as the only utility. The house is located in the Monsefú district which is in the Chiclayo province. This area is known for having lots agricultural activity.

María has been raising sheep for several years. The farmyard where the sheep are kept is suitable and spacious. It is only a few minutes from her house. She raises the animals with a balanced diet of natural fodder. Once they are the optimal weight and size, they are taken to the different markets in Chiclayo. With the money she has earned from selling her sheep, she has bought a second-hand moto-taxi. The vehicle helps her reach the places she needs to go and also, it gives her another source of income to pay her household expenses.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 Nuevos Soles for maintenance of her moto-taxi and to change some of the spare parts that are not working well.  In addition, she wants to make a few renovations in her house. María is known in her neighborhood for being a hard-working woman, willing to help others but she wants her family to better itself, especially her children.

loans.use: to maintain her taxi in order to continue working

loans.name: Fifa De Hlazounto Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFA DE HLAZOUNTO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Amélée Brigitte, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Amélée Brigitte est mariée à Donatien, un entrepreneur. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble dans la même maison. Amélée Brigitte et son mari subviennent ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Amélée Brigitte vend du maïs et des chaussures dans son quartier. Amélée Brigitte s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur  clientèle, Amélée Brigitte et les autres membres du groupe FIFA DE HLAZOUNTO sollicitent pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Fifa de Hlazounto Group is composed of three women living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group is Amélée Brigitte, who raises her hand on the photo.

Amélée Brigitte is married to Donatien, an entrepreneur. They have four children, all attending school. Three of the children are in their care. The family lives together in the same house. Amélée Brigitte and her husband share household expenses. To be able to do so, Amélée Brigitte sells corn and shoes in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in a city in Benin. 

In order to raise their activity level and better meet their customers' demand, Amélée Brigitte and her fellow members from Fifa de Hlazounto Group came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for the second time for financial assistance. The loan will enable them to strengthen their activity and better serve their customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes and corn.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. QOYLLORITY D. LUCRE”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Lucre en la provincia D. Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Ubaldina tiene 68 años D. edad y La socia es casada, la socia tiene 8 hijos D. los cuales  solo está con ella uno D. sus hijos D. 30 años; la socia tiene un stand en el mercado ella compra al por mayor carne D. vacuno y lo venD. al por menor en el mercado, la socia también venD. verduras, la socia requiere el crédito para poder hacer D. el un capital D. negocio esto significa ella con el crédito comprara 2 vacas enteras muertas, la socia ya se encargara D. trozarlas para la venta, ella también desea comprar carne D. cordero y aumentar verduras para su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. carne D. vacuno y verduras para implementar su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Ubaldina, 68, is a member of the “SEÑOR D. QOYLLORITY D. LUCRE” communal bank.  She lives in Lucre District in Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has 8 children of which only a 30-year-old son still lives with her.  She has a stand in the market.  She buys beef at wholesale and sells it at retail in the market.  She also sells vegetables.  She needs the loan to use as business capital, which means she’ll buy two whole slaughtered cows that she, herself, will butcher to sell.  She also plans to buy lamb and increase the vegetables for her business.  She is asking for the loan to buy beef and vegetables.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan which makes it possible for her business to grow and her quality of life to improve.  At the same time she commits to pay her installments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es un padre de familia de 53 años  de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia y no cuenta con  servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

Rogelio se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón y mango; una vez que se da la cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona, tambien cría ganadoovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, sus corrales están en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con pastos y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo óptimo los comercializa a sus clientes.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón y para el pago de mano de obra para el deshierbo y poda de sus plantas, con la idea de mejorar la producción .  Rogelio es una persona  responsable y trabajadora que lo único que quiere es darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a 53 year old father who lives with his wife and son in their own house that doesn't have basic services.  They live in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  The residents in this district work in agriculture, ranching and crafts.  

Rogelio has worked in agriculture for some time.  He has his own land where he grows lemons and mangoes.  After harvesting he sells his products in the markets in his area.  He also raises sheep and poultry.  The pens are located in the back part of his house.  He feeds them natural grains and grasses and when they reach the optimal size he sells them to his customers.  

He has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternative to purchase fertilizers to amend the soil and ensure that he will have a good lemon production.  It will also pay for the labor to weed and prune his trees with the intent of improving production.  Rogelio is a responsible and hard-working person and the only thing that he wants is to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer to amend the soil and to pay for labor to weed and prune his trees.

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Group

texts.es: El grupo lleva por nombre "MUJERES DE VALOR" ya que siempre se han caracterizado por no temerle a nada, el grupo se encuentra ubicado en Estado de Mexico. es la septima vez que solicitan un prestamo ya que es un grupo que se consolidado de maravilla apoyandose siempre. En este grupo se encuntra la señora CARMEN quien es una de las integrantes con mayor experincia en los negocios, ella tiene 63 años, es madre de 5 hijos, la señora nos platica que su vida siempre fue muy linda pero un poco complicada en cuestion de los ingresos economicos ya que su esposo trabajó siempre en el campo y dependian solo de las cosechas, y en ocasiones apenas les alcanzaba para comer y así decidio apoyar a su esposo para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y comtribuir en la economia de su hogar. Quiere este prestamo para en más mercacia para su tienda de abarrotes y así poderles ofrecer a sus clientes los productos que necesiten, la señora Carmen tiene ya 20 años con su negocio y se siente satisfecha, Tambien su negocio y su esfuerzo poder sustentarles los estudios de sus hijos para que logren sus sueños. Observaciones, la señora que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Leticia.
texts.en:
The group is named “Mujeres de Valor” (Women of Valor) because the members have always been known for not fearing anything. They live in the State of Mexico and this is the seventh time they have requested a loan. This is a marvelous group since the members have always supported one another.

Sra. Carmen is one of the members who has a great deal of business experience. She is 63 years old and the mother of five children. Carmen says that she has always lived a nice life, but things get a little more complicated when it comes to the finances. Her husband has always worked on a farm, so they depend solely on the crops he produces. On a few occasions, they have had barely enough to eat so she decided to help her husband with supporting their children by contributing toward the household income.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store so that she can offer her customers more of the products that they need. She has been in business for 20 years and is very pleased. In addition to managing her business, she strives to provide for the education of her children so that they can achieve their dreams.

The woman in the photo who cannot be seen clearly is Sra. Leticia.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers to improve her land and crops

loans.name: Bienvenue

texts.fr:
Femme âgée de 43ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant âgé de 21ans, elle a un niveau terminal e, en 2004, par manque de soutient elle avait préféré de se lancer dans la vente de foufou en gros et détail avec un capital de 400.000Frs. 

Ses recettes sont 150.000F à 425.000F après 2 jours et elle vend non loin de son domicile ce qui lui permet de commencer très tôt son activité. 

Avec le prêt de HOPE, elle veut renforcer le stock de son aliment en achetant des sacs de foufou Très gentille, son souhait est toujours de satisfaire ses clients en leur offrant des meilleurs prix. 

Pour le bien de sa famille, elle compte construire une maison et voyager pour l’achat des marchandises
texts.en:
A woman of 43, married and the mother of one child of 21, she finished high school. In 2004, lacking support, she decided to get into selling "foufou" wholesale and retail with a working capital of 400.000 francs. 

She makes between 150.000F and 425.000F in two days and she sells not far from her home which allows her to open her business very early. 

With the loan from HOPE, she wants to expand the quantity of foodstuff that she stocks by buying sacks of "foufou". Very pleasant, her wish is to satisfy her customers by offering them the best prices. 

for the well-being of her family, she intends to build a house and travel to buy her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy sacks of "foufou" (processed manioc).

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND 2 est formé de trois personnes appartenant à la même famille. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Hermane Mireille est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Hermane Mireille ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a deux enfants, tous scolarisés qui sont à sa charge. Hermane Mireille a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'elle mène passionnément et qui lui permet d'assurer sans grande difficulté les diverses charges des enfants. De façon secondaire, Hermane Mireille vend des tissus et des ustensiles de cuisine (bols, glacières, etc.) par le système de distribution. Hermane Mireille s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Hermane Mireille désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND 2.
texts.en:
The group DIEU EST GRAND 2 is made up of three people who are from the same family. The representative of the group, Hermane Mireille, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. It's the third time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their activity. 

 Hermane Mireille doesn't live with her husband but has two children, both enrolled in school, whom she is raising. She stopped going to school at the secondary level and then learned to do hairdressing, a job she is passionate about and which allows her, with great difficulty, to support her children. Secondarily, she sells cloth and kitchen utensils (bowls, ice chests, etc.) on the distribution system. 

Hermane Mireille buys her supplies in a town in Bénin. Wishing to grow her stock of products and better respond to the demand of her clientele, she wishes to receive a loan, together with the other members of the  DIEU EST GRAND 2 group.

loans.use: to buy hair products, cloth, bowls, and stackable ice chests.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, la cual distribuye en su vivienda y algunas veces de manera ambulante, pues inicio hace 3 años ya siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos de su familia ella atiende a sus  clientes muy amable es así que sus clientes se sienten a gusto. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de ropa, bolsos, calzado y cosméticos.  Su meta siempre ha sido poder establecer su negocio, de tal manera que pueda vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Maria José has a business selling general merchandise. She sells her products from her home, but occasionally she offers her merchandise as a traveling merchant. Maria José started her business three years ago and has always been concerned about improving her family’s income. She is very friendly when attending to her customers, thereby making them feel at ease.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of clothes, bags, shoes, and cosmetics. Her goal has always been to establish her business so that could sell in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, bags, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson tiene su negocio que es una pulpería y cyber. Tiene más de 6 años de tener este negocio, con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante. Wilson inicio el cyber por medio de ciertas ganancias de su pulpería, fue así que poco a poco fue estableciendo esta actividad. El negocio está ubicado en su vivienda en donde asisten varios clientes. El crédito es para la compra computadoras, impresoras, tintas, papel, mouse, teclado y otros.
texts.en:
Wilson has a business that consists of a store and a cybercafé. He has been in business for more than six years and was able to get ahead through much effort and sacrifice.

Wilson started the cybercafé using the profits generated from his store. Over time he was able to get it established. His business is located in his home, where he is able to attend to different customers. This loan will be used to buy computers, printers, ink, paper, a mouse, keyboard, and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase computers, printers, ink, paper, a mouse, keyboard, and other supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE LUCRE”; La socia vive en el distrito de Lucre en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Veronica tiene 26 años de edad y La socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 3 meses de edad; la socia es ama de casa ella hasta ahora está en casa cuidando de sus dos menores hijos y desea poder hacer su propio negocio en casa, ella quiere vender leña, para lo cual requiere de este crédito para poder comprar al por mayor leña de los proveedores y en casa en su patio colocara los leños para poner un en la puerta principal de su casa se vende leña con un letrero grande, la socia ya tiene todo planeado y solo requiere l préstamo para hacer realidad su negocio y con esto ayudar en casa con los alimentos y víveres. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de leña.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre”. She lives in the District of Lucre, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Veronica is 26 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children (ages 6 and 3 months). She is a homemaker and currently takes care of her two young children. Veronica plans to start her own home-based business. She wants to sell firewood, but she needs this loan so that she can purchase wood in bulk from the distributors. Veronica will sell the wood from her yard and plans to put a large sign on the door of her house to indicate that she is in business. Through all that she has planned, Veronica hopes to provide food and supplies for her home. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of firewood.

Veronica values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. In addition, she promises to complete her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, perfumes, and towels.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants, seed, and small equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants, seed, and small equipment.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE LUCRE”; La socia vive en el distrito de Lucre en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Julia tiene 48 años de edad y La socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 19, 15, 12 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, la socia compra a la por mayor pasto, maíz y los vende en forma de chicha de maíz; y venta de pasto en la esquina de sus avenida, la socia  también se dedica a la chacra ella siembra y cosecha  hortalizas;  la socia trabaja según la temporada, la socia durante todo el año vende por las tardes a partir de las 6 p.m.  pasto en la esquina de la avenida en su barrio;  cuando es época de siembra ella siembra hortalizas y espera a los 3 meses dependiendo y cosecha, también esto lo vende; la socia durante el día prepara la chicha para la venta en su propio domicilio, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y apoya en los estudios y alimentación de sus hijos. La socia requiere el crédito para poder  mejorar su negocio de venta de chicha y comprar maíz amarillo al por mayor.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre”. She lives in the District of Lucre, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Julia is 48 years old, married, and has three children (ages 19, 15, and 12). She divides her time between her regular activities and her small business. Julia buys grasses in bulk as well as corn for selling “chicha” (a fermented beverage). She also has a farm where she plants and grows vegetables. Julia works based on the season. She works year-round in the evenings starting at 6pm from a street corner in her neighborhood. During the planting season, she must wait three months until she is able to harvest her vegetables. Julia spends her days preparing “chicha” which she sells from home. She is a hardworking woman who strives to educate and feed her children. Therefore, she is requesting this loan so that she can improve her “chicha” business and buy yellow corn in bulk.

Julia values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. In addition, she promises to complete her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk for preparing "chicha".

loans.name: Rosa Olivia

texts.es: Rosa Olivia tiene su pulpería, tiene más de 22 años de tener este medio de vida. Ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos diarios de su hogar, tiene 6 hijos y solamente 3 están bajo su cargo. Con iniciativa propia es que ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio, Su meta es apoyar su crecimiento para cada día ganar más rentabilidad y muy seguramente lo logrará, porque es una madre de familia, muy organizada y trabajadora. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, pan y sopas.
texts.en:
Rosa Olivia owns a store and has earned her living in this manner for more than 22 years. She started this business because she needed to cover the daily expenses of her household. Rosa has six children, but only three are still under her care. Through her own initiative, she has been able to succeed in her business. Her goal is to grow each day so that her business is more profitable and more secure in its operation. Rosa is a mother who is very organized and hardworking.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, detergents, candy, soft drinks, bread, and soups.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, detergents, candy, soft drinks, bread, and soups.

loans.name: Saint Antoine De Padoue Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe St Antoine de Padoue est créé le 01 juin 2011. Il est composé de 30 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et elles ont le commerce de poissons comme activité principale.

Madame Véronique, située à droite de la photo avec la main gauche levée, est responsable du groupe. Elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant en charge.

Elle a comme activité le commerce, avec une épicerie au Cap Skiring où elle vend beaucoup d'articles divers. Elle pratique cette activité de commerce depuis plus de 5 ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son épicerie en diversifiant ses articles.

Avec les revenus, Mme Véronique veut renforcer son épargner afin d'acheter un terrain à titre d'habitation.
texts.en:
The St. Antoine de Padoue group was set up on 1st June 2011. It is made up of 30 women who live in the same district and their main activity is selling fish.

Véronique, who is on the right of the photo and raising her left hand, is in charge of the group. She is single and mother to one child for whom she is responsible.

She has a trading activity with a grocery store in Cap Skiring where she sells a large number of different products. She has been carrying out this trading business for more than five years.

This loan will enable her to build up her grocery store by diversifying the products she sells. With her income, Véronque wants to boost her savings in order to buy a piece of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy products in order to build up her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants, seed, and small equipment.

loans.name: Niassya Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 17 mai 2011. Il est composé de 42 femmes qui habitent ensemble et se sont regroupées par des liens d'affinité. Leurs activités portent sur le petit commerce, le maraichage et la riziculture.

Madame Marie Noëlle Victoire qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est célibataire mère de deux enfants en sa charge. 

Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de balaie et de jus de citron depuis plus de deux ans. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité qui est en plein extension.

Les bénéfices qu'elle va gagner lui permettront d'assurer la scolarité et la nourriture de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" (loan group) was created on May 17, 2011. The group is composed of 42 women who live together and came together in the group because of similar tastes.  Their businesses involve buying and selling small items, growing vegetables for sale, and growing rice. 

Madame Marie Noëlle Victoire who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 38, single, and the mother of two children for whom she is responsible. 

She has had a small-scale business selling brooms and lemon juice for two years. This loan will allow her to better develop her business which is currently expanding. The profit she will make will allow her to pay school fees and food expenditures for her children.

loans.use: to buy brooms and lemon juice.

loans.name: Kary

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE LUCRE”; La socia vive en el distrito de Lucre en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Kary tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia se dedica a la atención de sus negocio minorista de compra y venta verduras y productos secos,  los cuales lleva a  Huancarani un poblado alejado para poder abastecer de estos productos en la época de sequias; La socia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar su negocio, ella comprara habas, granos secos como maíz, papa deshidratada, cereales, productos molidos como ajo, comino, pimienta, sal, al por mayor y los llevara la poblado mencionado, ella también desea pagar a sus proveedores para que le den otra carga de verduras al por menor ya que estas no se pueden guardar.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Kary is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre”. She lives in the District of Lucre, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Kary is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a five-year-old child. She divides her time between her household activities and her small business. Kary buys and sells vegetables and dried products. She brings these goods from Huancarani, a distant village that produces these items during the drying season. Kary wants to obtain a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise to keep her business in operation. She buys beans, dry goods such as corn and dehydrated potatoes, grains, and ground condiments such as garlic, pepper, and salt. Kary plans to buy these products in bulk and bring them back from Huancarani. She also wants to pay her distributors for another shipment of vegetables at retail prices since these items are perishable.

Kary values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. In addition, she promises to complete her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, dry goods, and condiments.

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est crée le 25 juillet 2003. les 15 femmes qui le composent s'activent dans le maraichage, la vente de l'huile de palme et le petit commerce

Madame Sounkar qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est Mariée et mère de deux enfants en sa charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et de l'huile de palme. Elle pratique ces activités depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer ses activités.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes(nourriture, santé et scolarité)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on July 25, 2003. The 15 women who make up this group work in market gardening, sell palm oil, or buy and sell various small items. 

Madame Sounkar, who is on the left in the photo raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 49, married, and the mother of two children for whom she is responsible. 

She buys and sells vegetables and palm oil on a small scale. She has been doing this work for several years. This loan will permit her to bolster her working capital and better develop her business.  

The profit will allow her to help her husband with the daily expenditures (food, health-related expenses, and school fees).

loans.use: to buy vegetables and palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy planting supplies, seed, and small equipment.

loans.name: Tessito Faraya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 juin 2002. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont pratiquement la même ambition (le développement de leur terroir). Le petit commerce et la culture de patate douce est leur activité principale.

Madame Mouskéba qui est à la gauche de la photo levant la main est le responsable du groupe. elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants.

Elle s'active dans la vente de poisson frais et de nettétou. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine qu'elle pratique depuis plus d'une décennie.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et de mieux développer ses activités.

les profits lui permettront d'aider sa famille et ses enfants dans l'amélioration des conditions de vie(santé, nourriture etc...).
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created 18 June 2002. It consists of seven women living in the same neighborhood with virtually the same goal (to develop their land). Their main activities are small retail businesses and cultivating sweet potatoes.

Ms. Mouskéba - who is raising her hand on the left of the photo - is the group leader. She is 39 years old, married with three children.

She is active in the sale of fresh fish and nettétou (traditional West-African condiment). She has good experience in this field where she has been practicing for over a decade.

This loan will enable her to increase her capital and to further develop her activities.

The profits will enable her to help her family and her children by improving their living conditions (health, food, etc...).

loans.use: to buy fish and nettétou (traditional West-African condiment)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Sainte Marie Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sainte Marie est créé le jour de l'inauguration du BV, le 01 juin 2011. Le 30 femmes qui composent ce groupe habitent le même quartier et font toutes du petit commerce.

Madame Anne Marie, à droite de la photo avec la main gauche levée, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de trois enfants et elle a six autres personnes sous sa charge.

Elle est commerçante depuis plus de dix ans et elle possède une boutique où elle vend divers produits (riz, sucre, huile végétale etc). Elle fait comme seconde activité la restauration.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises afin de mieux fidéliser sa clientèle.

Avec les bénéfices escomptés, Mme Anne Marie compte faire un agrandissement de sa boutique et dans le but de la transformer en épicerie.
texts.en:
The Sainte Marie group was set up on the day the Banc Villageois was inaugurated, that is 1st June 2011. The 30 women who make up this group live in the same district and all have small trading activities.

Anne-Marie, who is on the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 46 years old, married and mother to three children; she has six other people in her care.

She has been a trader for more than ten years and has a store where she sells various products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil etc.) She has a second activity which is restauration.

This loan will allow her to build up the stock of goods in her shop in order to gain her customers' loyalty. With the income she makes, Anne Marie is planning to extend her shop with the aim of converting into a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to build up her general grocery store

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. QOYLLORITY D. LUCRE”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Lucre en la provincia D. Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Fortunata tiene 60 años D. edad y La socia es viuda, la socia ya tiene a todos sus hijos independientes y a ella ellos ahora le dan para su alimentación y para sus gastos personales. La socia se dedica en la actualidad a atender su tienda D. abarrotes, la socia tiene desD. hace 26 años sus tienda y aún hoy ella esta a cargo D. la atención, limpieza y cuidado D. la misma, la socia desea implementar su tienda D. abarrotes y comprar mercadería, la socia comprara ala por mayor los productos que salen rápido y D. manera diaria como son, leche, arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, aceites, huevos entre otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. Qoyllority D. Lucre”. She lives in the District of Lucre, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Fortunata is a 60-year-old widow. All of her children are independent, so she must now proviD. for her own food and personal expenses. Fortunata currently manages a grocery store that she established 26 years ago. Today she is in charge of managing, cleaning, and taking care of her business. Fortunata wants to keep her grocery store in operation and to buy merchandise. She plans to buy products in bulk that sell rapidly on a daily basis such as milk, rice, sugar, noodles, flour, oil, eggs, and other items. Therefore, she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of these products for her business.

Fortunata values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. In addition, she promises to complete her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria Del Rosario tiene 48 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 5 hijos y solamente 3 están bajo su cargo. La actividad económica de Maria es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con muy pocos productos pero ha salido adelante por la buena administración de su negocio y el apoyo de su familia. Con el dinero que solicita será invertido en capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa nueva como camisas para niños, faldas, shorts, pantalones entre otras cosas. Su deseo es tener un negocio estable para proporcionarles estabilidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Del Rosario is a married woman who is 48 years of age. She has five children, but only three are still under her care. Maria sells clothes and has been in this business for more than 18 years. She started out with very few products, but she has been able to get ahead as a result of good management of her business and the support of her family.

The loan she requested will be invested as operating capital toward the purchase of new clothing such as children’s shirts, skirts, shorts, trousers, and other items. Her wish is to have a stable business so that she can provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase children’s shirts, skirts, shorts, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: Nina

texts.fr:
Cliente de agee de 35 ans, mariee avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 3 et 8 ans. A la fin des ses etudes en classe de troisieme elle se lance dans le commerce.
En 1997 elle loue une table dans le marche et dans le commerce des produits divers, comme la vente de filets d'oignons, de l'ail des cartons de tomates,dacs d'haricots , sachets de sel fin et le gros sel et des cubes.

Avec le pret qu'il va recevoir elle compte acheter des 2 cartons de tomates,3 filets d'oignons rouges , 2 filets d'oignons blancs, un sac d'haricots jaune de 50kg, 1 sacs d'haricots blancs de 50 kg, des differents qualites de cubes.
Commercante tres entreprenante , elle sait attirer les clients par son accueil et les prix qu'elle propose.
A l'avenir elle tient a devenir une grossiste et avoir une grande boutique pour vendre la marchandise en gros.
texts.en:
This client, aged 35, is married and raising three children who are between three and eight years old. At the end of middle school, she got into sales. 

In 1997 she rented a table in the market and began selling various products such as nets of onions, garlic, tins of tomato paste, sacks of dried beans, bags of ground salt and rock salt, and Maggi cubes. 

With the loan that she is going to receive, she intends to buy two cartons of tomato paste, three nets of red onions, a 50 kg sack of dried yellow beans, one 50 kg sack of white beans and various sorts of flavoring cubes. 

A very enterprising saleswoman, she knows how to attract customers with her welcome and the prices she sets on her goods. In future, she intends to become a wholesaler and have a big shop where she can sell merchandise wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cartons of tomato paste, nets of onions, sacks of dried beans, bags of salt and Maggi cubes.

loans.name: Natacha Estelle

texts.fr:
Commercante de 35 ans celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 2 et 14 ans.Ayant arrete ses etudes en classe de troisieme, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille elle se lance dans le commerce des legumes.Ses ventes sont de 10.000 a 50.000 frs par jour.
Avec le pret qu'elle va recevoir elle veut rnforcer son activite en achetant des legumes comme des gros paniers de choux, courgettes, carottes, filets d'oignos et d'ails, l'aubergine violette et differents legumes que l'on trouve sur le marche.

Cliente dynamique , elle s'arrange toujours a faire le bon chois des legumes fraiches pour sastifaire les besoins de ses clients.

Pour aller de l'avant , elle pense a  epargner pour payer les etudes de ses enfants, et ouvrir un autre etalage de vente des legumes  et elargir son activite
texts.en:
She is a 35 years old single merchant, with two dependent children aged two and fourteen. She left school in in ninth grade. To provide for her family, she started retailing vegetables. Her sales amount to 10,000 to 50,000 CFA daily.

With the loan she will receive, she wants to strengthen her business by purchasing vegetables such as large baskets of cabbage, zucchini, carrots, nets of onions and garlic, purple eggplants and various vegetables available on the market.

She is a dynamic customer and always manages to choose the right fresh vegetables to meet her customers' needs.

Moving forward, she is planning on saving for her children's education, and on opening another vegetable stall to broaden her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of potatoes, eggplants net bags, cabbage, zucchini, onions and garlic in nets, scallions

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 29 a 36 ans.Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec les difficultés  durant la guerre de 1997, elle se lance dans dans la vente des sandales hommes,dames et enfants.
Ses ventes sont énormes, elle a environ 30.000 a 55.000 frs par jour, et avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer son commerce en ajoutant les différents modèles de sandales hommes , des sandales pour femmes et enfants.
Elle est très dynamique parce que avec ce commerce elle a supporte la scolarité de ses enfants.
 Pour l'avenir maintenant qu'elle a une opportunité a travers les prêts de Hope , elle veut faire aussi la vente en gros et faire des commandes aux  commerçantes qui importent a l'étranger comme Cotonou, Kinshasa et a la longue être elle même grossiste et aller a l'étranger.
texts.en:
This client is 56 years old, married, and the mother of four children between the ages of 29 and 36. Having to cope with the war in 1997, she started to sell sandals for men, women and children in order to provide for her family.

Her sales are spectacular, averaging 30,000 to 55,000 francs per day. With this new loan, she plans to strengthen her business by adding different styles of sandals.

She is very dynamic person whose business has allowed her to pay for her children’s tuition. 

In the future, given the opportunities made possible through Hope financing, she plans to engage in wholesale trade and supply merchants importing to foreign areas such as Cotonou and Kinshasa. In the long run, she wants to travel abroad as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy sandals for men, women and children for resale

loans.name: Irma Eudoxie

texts.fr:
B. est une cliente de Hope Congo âgée de 45ans célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont varie de 14ans à 22ans. par manque de soutien financier elle laisse ses études en classe de 5e et se lance dans la vente des sandales en gros comme en détail en 1992 avec un capital de 100.000frs CFA.

avec ce prêt elle aimerait renforcer son stock en achetant des sandale hommes, femmes et enfant.

elle a pour stratégie d'offrir des prix hors taxes à ses client afin de mieux attirer la clientèle. son souhait est de pouvoir être grossiste.

son ambition est d'acheter une parcelle et construire pour le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
B. is a client of Hope Congo. She is 45 years old, single and the mother of two children, 14 and 22 years of age. Due to lack of financial support, she was not able to finish high school. In 1992, she started selling sandals, wholesale and retail, with a starting capital of 100,000 West African francs.
With this loan she would like to replenish her stock by buying more sandals for men, women, and children.

Her strategy is to offer tax-free prices   in order to attract more customers. She would like to be able to work as a wholesaler. Her goal is to buy a land plot and have a home built, for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted sandals

loans.name: Valentín Antonio

texts.es:
A L. vivienda del señor Valentín le está haciendo falta L. barda alrededor D. L. casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilL., arena y para pagarle a L. persona  que se encargara D. realizar L. mejora.
   Don Valentín trabaja en una estación D. radio D. L. ciudad  como locutor, con el ingreso que recibe D. su empleo pagara el crédito, ya que su esposa L. señora Norma se encargara D. los gastos familiares y escolares D. sus dos hijos que tiene con el sueldo D. su trabajo.
texts.en:
The house in which Valentín lives is lacking a wall around it. 
 
He is requesting the loan so that he can buy the materials for it -- blocks, cement, metal bars, and sand -- and he will also pay the person whom he will hire to carry out the work. 

Valentín works in a radio station in the city as an announcer. With the income he receives from his job, he will pay off the loan, since his wife, Norma, will take charge of the family's expenses and the school fees for their two children with the salary she receives for her work.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Guillermo Alberto

texts.es:
Don Guillermo labora como cadete de taxi, el comenzo hace seis años, trabajando, durante ese periodo, ahorro,  lo que más después logro comprar un taxi, y que hasta hoy ha venido mejorando al darle mantenimiento al motor, y que gracias Afodenic, ha hecho posible la mejora por medio del financiamiento.
Guillermo cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposa, la cual trabaja en comercio de artesanía, y junto logran la educación de sus tres hijos.
Con este nuevo crédito comprara, llantas, reparación de puerta y pagara el seguro. Lo que podrá seguir trabajando en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Don Guillermo has worked as a taxi driver for six years. While working throughout this time, he saved up enough money to buy his own taxi. Today needs he needs to maintain the motor of his vehicle. Thanks to a loan provided by AFODENIC, he will be able to pay for repairs to his taxi.

Guillermo has the financial support of his wife, who works as a craft merchant. Together, they have been able to provide for the education of their three children.

With the new loan, Guillermo will buy tires, have a door repaired, and pay for insurance. As a result, he will have better conditions in which he can continue working.

loans.use: to purchase tires and pay for vehicle maintenance, repairs, and insurance.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario La Esperanza está compuesto por Josefa Catalina, Martha Lorena, Martha Elena, Martha y Rosa. Josefa tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad inicio con esfuerzos propios a pesar de que no ha sido fácil ha logrado ya que hay mucha competencia pero no brindan el buen servicio y la amabilidad que Josefa. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de polvos, lápiz labial, cremas, tratamientos, shampoo y otros.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “La Esperanza” (The Hope) consists of Josefa Catalina, Martha Lorena, Martha Elena, Martha, and Rosa.

For more than five years, Josefa has been managing a business in which she sells cosmetics. She was able to start her business through her own efforts even though things were not easy at first. Josefa had to face many competitors, but they were not able to provide an excellent level of friendly service like she does. Her loan will be used to purchase powders, lip liners, crèmes, treatments, shampoos, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase powders, lip liners, crèmes, treatments, shampoos, and other products.

loans.name: Angela Juana

texts.es: Ángela Juana se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 que tiene este medio de vida. Ella siempre esta ofreciéndoles a sus clientes un buen servicio a sus clientes, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, la mayoría de sus vecinos son sus clientes que siempre están solicitándole diferentes productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes.
texts.en:
Ángela Juana manages a store. She has earned her living in this manner for more than seven years. Ángela always provides her customers with good service. Her business is located in her home. Most of her neighbors are her customers and they always request different products.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

loans.name: Ana Pastora

texts.es:
Ana Pastora tiene 48 años de edad,  es comerciante, vende una variedad de bisutería, el cual comenzo con la venta de zapatos usados, en un mercado de la capital, lo que cambio por que había mucha demanda de zapato.  Teniendo una gran responsabilidad de seis hijos. Que tenía que dar alimentación y educación. Así como el abono ya que comenzo con dinero prestado, en otra institución
Hoy en día, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo mayor, teniendo como meta la reparación de su vivienda, que comenzara con el cambio de techo. Comprara láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, y hará la mejora.
Como planes es poder aumentar sus ventas, introducir nuevos productos, para captar clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Ana Pastora is 48 years old and works a merchant, selling a variety of trinkets. She started out selling used shoes at a market in Managua. Ana moved to that area because there was a greater demand for shoes.

She has the tremendous responsibility of supporting, feeding, and providing an education for six children. Ana worked with another institution where she took out a loan to buy fertilizer.

Today she has the support of her oldest child. Her goal is to repair her home, so she plans to start by replacing the roof. She will buy sheets of zinc, crossbeams, and screws in order to make this improvement.

Her plans are to increase her sales, introduce new products, and attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials for replacing her roof.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime Antonio tiene su negocio que es la venta de CD y anteojos. Siempre ha sido un hombre trabajador y que ha salido adelante con mucho empeño y sacrificio. Pues inicio con esfuerzos propios y muy pocos productos comenzó la venta de Cd y ahora que también ofrece anteojos, a pesar de que tiene que recorrer ciertas distancias ha logrado mantener su actividad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de limpia Cd, películas, videos y comprar una gran variedad de anteojos.
texts.en:
Jaime Antonio has a business selling CDs and sunglasses. He has always been known as a hardworking man who is able to get ahead through great effort and sacrifice. Jaime took the initiative to start his business, but he had very few products at the beginning. He sold CDs and now he also offers sunglasses. Despite having to travel great distances, he has been able to maintain his business.

The reason for this loan is so that he can buy clean CDs, movies, videos, and a wide variety of sunglasses.

loans.use: to purchase music discs, movies, videos, and a wide variety of sunglasses.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: La Señora Sandra Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa en sus 4 años, siempre ha sabido trabajar y mantenerse muy independiente, el negocio fue iniciativa propia ella con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, pues su Madre le ha enseñado a ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, bolsos, y trajes. Sueña con ampliar su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra Maria has been selling clothes for four years. She has always kept working in order to maintain her independence. Sandra took the initiative to start her business and has invested much effort and sacrifice in order to get ahead. Her mother taught her how to be humble while earning a living.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and outfits. Her dream is to expand her establishment.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and outfits.

loans.name: Elfego

texts.es:
El señor Elfego tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva, usada  afuera de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía que es ropa para hombre, juguetes, aparatos electrónicos y muebles, no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y desea para su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Elfego has been selling new and used clothing outside of his home for more than two years. He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in his business since he lacks a wide variety of merchandise such as men’s clothing, toys, electronics, and furniture. Elfego does not have the necessary capital to make the investment he desires for his business.

He plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings that is generated from his business, which is the source of income that supports his family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and other merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, and a variety of household appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand and complete the exterior of her business.

loans.name: Aminta Elena

texts.es: Aminta Elena su negocio es la venta  de granos básicos. Inicio este medio de vida con el apoyo de su compañero de vida, pues anteriormente eral él quien se hacía cargo de este negocio. Ella es muy famosa por ofrecer sus productos a un precio accesible, sus clientes se sienten muy satisfechos por el buen servicio y la buena calidad de sus productos. A pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa como es la competencia que existe, no se da por vencida y siempre está ofreciendo  el mejor servicio. El crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, maíz, concentrado por quintales.
texts.en: Aminta Elena sells basic grains. She started this activity with her lifer partner’s help, as he was previously in charge of the activity. She is very well known because she offers her products at a fair price and her customers feel very satisfied with the good service and the good quality of her products. Notwithstanding the challenges she has to face, such as the constant competition, she does not give up and she always offers the best service. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, beans, maize and several “quintales” (1 quintal = 46kg) of concentrate.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, maize and concentrate.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana madre soltera, mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, honesta, humilde con sus hijos ha salido adelante, ofreciéndole todo lo que puede para que se preparen profesionalmente. Su trabajo le ha permitido ir poco a poco mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda pero requiere la construcción de un cuarto. Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción cemento, arena, piedrines, hierro, bloques, piedra cantera, lamina de zinc, playcem entre otros materiales. Agradece por el apoyo al desarrollo del bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Juana is a single mother. She is a hardworking, resourceful, honest and humble woman, and she has managed to provide for her children, offering them what she can in order to give them a good education and to make them study to become professionals. Thanks to her job, she has succeeded in gradually improving the structure of her house, but now she needs to have a room built. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand, piedrín (a type of building stone), iron, blocks, quarry stones, zinc sheets, Plycem (cement boards) and other materials. She is grateful for the support offered to the improvement of her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room.

loans.name: Cristo Me Ama 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Cristo Me Ama 1, 2, 3 (Christ love me). As a single mother, she makes her home in a simple structure with her 3 children. To earn a living, she operates a clothing sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. She says that her most difficult challenge is saving enough money to get her own house. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy attending the church.

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for 2 and a half years, and it was started with a loan she took. She has been saving her profits because, through this business, she wants to make her dreams come true- to have her own house and to help her children.

Maria's group is located in the rural area surrounding L. Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: Juana de la Cruz se dedica a la venta y elaboración de rosquillas. Tiene más de 11 años en su negocio, inicio este medio de vida ayudándole a su Mama fue así que con el paso del tiempo que Juana aprendió y decide establecer el negocio en su vivienda. Tiene que levantarse temprano desde las 5 de la mañanas hasta las 6 de la tarde, pues siempre se esfuerza por brindar una buena calidad de sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de maíz, leña, sal, mantequilla entre otros productos.
texts.en: Juana de la Cruz engages in preparing and selling rosquillas (a Nicaraguan type of doughnuts). She has been engaging in this activity for more than 11 years: she started it with her mother’s help, and after having learnt from her Juana decided to open her own shop in her house. She has to get up early, working from 5 am to 6 pm, as she always works hard to offer good quality products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy maize, firewood, salt and butter among other products.

loans.use: To buy maize, firewood, salt and butter.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena forma parte del Banco comunal “El Canelo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares.
Ella se dedica a vender cremas para el cuidado personal desde hace 3 años. Las ventas las realiza persona a persona, ya que los productos son a pedido. Además ofrece sesiones de masaje dependiendo del producto, puesto que vende cremas modeladoras para el cuerpo, cremas para el rostro, cremas para las manos y cremas de uso diario. Su horario laboral es totalmente flexible, ya que depende totalmente de las solicitudes de sus clientes por sus productos y/o servicios.
Comenta que durante la temporada de invierno las ventas tienden a disminuir por el frío, lo que limita a sus clientas salir de su casa. 
Lorena compra directamente sus productos en la casa matriz de la marca en la cual compra.
Con el préstamo comprará cremas. Sus metas son continuar con el negocio, para que éste vaya en expansión y así obtener mayores ingresos. Además quiere incursionar en el rubro de la venta de ropa, ya que éste se complementaría con la venta de cremas, por lo que atraería nuevos clientes y también mayores ingresos. 
Lorena vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 3 años de edad. Sus expectativas son tener una estabilidad económica que le permita vivir tranquila y sin preocupaciones económicas. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, desde la facilidad de los créditos hasta las capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones del grupo del banco comunal, ya que ha podido incorporar estos aprendizajes en su propio negocio, por lo que ahora distribuye sus ingresos y gastos de mejor manera, lo que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y tenerlo más organizado.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Lorena is part of the “El Canelo” communal bank belonging to the city of Linares.  She has been selling personal care creams for the last three years.  Her sales are person to person since the products are order based.  Besides, she also offers massages depending on the product because she sells body firming creams, face creams, hand creams and creams for everyday use.  Her work schedule is totally flexible because it depends completely on customer requests for products and/or services.  She comments that during the winter sales tend to drop due to the cold which keeps customers indoors.  Lorena buys her products directly from the headquarters of the brand she buys.

She will buy creams with the loan.  Her goals are to stay in business so that it will expand and she will earn increased income.  In addition, she wants to go into clothing sales because this will complement her creams sales attracting new customers and higher income.

Lorena lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  Her expectations are to have economic stability that will allow her to live tranquilly without any economic worries.

She is very happy and grateful for the support provided by Fondo Esperanza from the ease of the loans to the training that takes place during communal bank meetings because she’s been able to incorporate these skills into her own business; she now manages income and expenses better which has made it possible for her to invest in her business and have it better organized.

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region located in the central part of the country.  This zone is developing in an important way in agricultural and wine producing areas especially for export.  The crops that stand out are cereals (rice, wheat, corn and oats), leafy green vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard and legumes) and fruit.  Linares is Chile’s main rice producing province, in fact, 78% of national production of this cereal takes place in this province, especially in the commune of Parral.

loans.use: to buy creams for personal use.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
