Since she started participating in the credit program, she has had a good repayment history. For the new loan cycle, she wants a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for the pigs.

Chuc is 45 years old with 2 children who are in High school. She has a small wood workshop that makes housing equipment. She needs a loan of 7,194,000 Vietnamese dong to buy materials for her workshop. Lien is 30 years old with 1 child. She manages a small restaurant. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to buy food for  them

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr.Battulga is 21 years old and lives with his wife in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. Battulga is an Army serviceman. He has been transferred to Erdenet from Ulaanbaatar city in 2010. After his marriage last year, he is planning to live in Erdenet.

Last year, he bought a small plot of land and started his family's house building project. The house is 70% complete. He is asking for a loan to buy necessary building materials such as cement, wood planks, windows and doors to complete his family's house building project.

loans.use: buy building materials such as cement, wood planks, windows and doors to complete his family house

loans.name: Florajaida

texts.en:
Florajaida, 69 years old, is from Labo Ozamiz City. She is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Florajaida owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community.  Florajaida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Florajaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florajaida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Florajaida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods, softdrinks, noodles and spices for her store. This loan will be her tenth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase canned goods, softdrinks, noodles and spices to sell in the store.

loans.name: Manh Tan-1-1 Group

texts.en:
Thom is 30 years old with 2 children. He is a leader of group including 4 members. All of them have different businesses. Mr Thom has been a taxi driver for two years. For the first cycle, he used the loan to pay for his fee to attend a drivers training course. After one year, he found a job as a taxi driver and began to get a stable salary. Since he started participating in the credit program, he has had a good repayment history. Now, he needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy a sewing machine for his wife.

Huong is 26 year old with 1 child. She manages a small restaurant in her village. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy some equipment for her restaurant.

Quyen is 30 years old with a small child. Being retail merchant , he focuses on selling chicken for meat in the local market. He wants a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more chicken to meet the demand of customers.

Ngan is 41 years old with 2 children. She is raising 5 pigs for meat. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them.

Thiet is 26 years old. She manages a wood work shop and needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 25 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamiz City.  She is married with 1 child. 

Rosemary has a motor cycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has  requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair her existing motor cycle and to purchase tires. 

Rosemary has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to use her income for motor maintenance and to provide basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing motor cycle and to purchase tires

loans.name: Enkh-Amgalan

texts.en:
Enkh-Amgalan, 37, is a professional driver.  He lives with his wife, mother-in-law and two children, aged 12 and 15, in his mother-in-law’s small house, in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Both of his children attend public school. His wife works as a separator at a local cashmere factory, while his mother-in-law is a retired and she stays at home. 

Enkh-Amgalan worked as a driver at a local public transportation company from 2002 to 2008.  Since 2008, Enkh-Amgalan has been running a transportation business using his family minivan.  He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote bus lanes which lacks bus services. He is planning to sell his old car and purchase another second car, due to safety regulations for transportation.  He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT to purchase the second car.

He said “I wants to improve my business and then to be able to buy my own house”

loans.use: To purchase second car

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 33 years old and married with 1 infant aged child.  His wife is a housekeeper, and engaged in the retailing business. 

Pablo is a farmer working in the Philippines.  He is engaged in growing of rice and has been doing it for 10 years.  Pablo is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase manure fertilizers and seeds of rice to be planted in his farm.  He wants to maintain and improve his farming business for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds of rice to be planted in his farm

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old, married, and has an 8-year-old son.  She has been running a small retail shop for the last three years earning 16,500 KES a month from her business.  Agnes sells various products and goods to residents in her surrounding community at the busy Lukenya market. 

She plans asking for a 16,000 KES loan to buy more goods such as wheat flour and sugar.  This is Agnes’ first loan with KADET.   She plans to use the proceeds from her business to open a supermarket in the future.  Agnes describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and sugar to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is married with five children.  She is thirty six years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City.

To earn a living, Ivy has a bamboo furniture business.  She has had this business for eight years.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000.00. Ivy has been a member of GDMPC for three years.  In the future, Ivy hopes to expand her furniture business to provide for her family needs .

loans.use: to buy bamboo for manufacturing furniture

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 39 years and a single mother to four children aged 13, 12, 9 and 8. She has been running her hotel business for the last six years, earning a profit of 30,000 KES per month. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a member of Kadet staff.
This will be Catherine's first loan. She plans to open a spacious hotel that can accommodate more than ten customers thus bringing her more profit. With the anticipated profits she plans to open another hotel. In the future, she hopes to open a five-star hotel.

loans.use: to open a spacious hotel that can accommodate more than ten customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows, goats and sheep for his livestock trading business.

loans.name: Orlino

texts.en: Orlino, a 58-year-old married father of a school aged child, is a farmer working in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper. Orlino is requesting a loan to acquire inputs needed for their farm such as fertilizers, seeds and pesticides. He will also use some of the loan to pay for the services of planting and land preparation. In the future, Orlino hopes that his business will become more profitable to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farming.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, a 50-year-old married mother of five children, lives in Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis. Occ. where for the past three years she has had a business selling dried fish to earn a living. Earning Php 10,000 each month, she is now requesting a loan of PhP 20,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. Rebecca, who has been a member of PMPC for one year, will use the extra income for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchased more dried fish for her retail store.

location.town: Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is twenty years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married with three children. 

Margie has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 2000.00 each month from doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for motorcycle maintenance. Margie has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Glenita

texts.en:
Glenita is widowed with two children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Glenita is a farmer and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan of eight thousand pesos to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance and to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Glenita has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Glenita hopes to expand her banana plantation to support her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance and to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oven for roasting meat.

loans.name: Floranie

texts.en:
Floranie is 20 years old and married. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, Floranie has been selling fish for a living. 

Floranie is a new member of GDMPC. She is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to use her profits to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 32 years old. He is married to Elizabeth and they have two children, ages three and five. For the past nine years, Antony has run a charcoal-selling business. He is a very hardworking man and makes a monthly profit of 40,000 KES.  

Antony was introduced to KADET LTD by a staffmember. This will be his first loan and he plans to buy a wheelbarrow to transport his charcoal instead of carrying on his shoulders. 

In the future, he hopes to buy a pick-up truck to help transport charcoal. His dream is to use his anticipated profits to open a hotel.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow to transport charcoal

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and is married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past ten years, Virginia has been selling fish to earn a living. 

Virginia has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, Virginia hopes that her business will provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 37 years and married to David. For the past six years, she has been running a green grocer business. She is a very hardworking woman who makes a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her second loan. She buys greens from the Gikomba Market and sells them in her community in Kibera. Margaret is requesting a loan to buy vegetables in large quantities to sell and increase her profit.

In the future, Margaret would like to open her own stall and start supplying all of Kibera with greens.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of greens to sell

loans.name: Marjie

texts.en:
Marjie is 24 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years, she has run a shop that sells perfume. Marjie earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Marjie joined PMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC and this will be her second loan. Marjie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more perfume to sell in her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the living standard of her family. 



About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase perfume to sell

loans.name: Nonvignon-Ste Rita Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON-STE RITA est formé de trois  personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe nommée Fifonsi Hortense est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Fifonsi Hortense est née le 27 Novembre 1977 dans une ville du Bénin. Mariée à un coiffeur du nom de Ambroise, Fifonsi Hortense est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leur parents. Fifonsi Hortense a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de sept ans que Fifonsi Hortense mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois, de pétrole et de boisson locale de F.çon secondaire. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Fifonsi Hortense achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Fifonsi Hortense désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON-STE RITA.
texts.en:
The NONVIGNON-STE RITA group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s third time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Fifonsi Hortense, the group’s representative, has her hand raised in the photo. She was born on November 27, 1977 in a city of Benin. Hortense is married to a hairdresser named Ambroise, and she is the mother of two children, both in school. The whole family live together. Hortense herself quit school at the secondary level.   

She started selling charcoal and kerosene nearly seven years ago. As a sideline, she also sells a local beverage. These activities allow her to provide for her children without difficulty. She gets her merchandise in Benin. 

In an effort to replenish her stock and better meet customer demand, Hortense is seeking this new loan together with the other members of the NONVIGNON-STE RITA group.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, kerosene, and a local beverage for resale

loans.name: Lolitisia

texts.en:
Lolitisia is 53 years old, married, and has three children. She has been selling clothing for the last four years and earns a monthly income of 23,000 KES. She sells clothing at a busy market in Bissil where most of her clients are female. Lolitisia plans to take out a 50,000 KES loan to open a shop in the neighboring town of Namanga. 

This is Lolitisia’s second loan with KADET. She has been a good client who repays her loan well. She plans to use the profits from her business to pay her son’s school fees. 


In the future, Lolitisia hopes to become a wholesaler. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: to open another clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three cows, ten sheep, and ten goats to rear.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married with three children. Ester is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ester is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer. In the future, Ester hopes to use the extra income for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Samato

texts.en:
Samato is 28 years old and married with three children ages two, four and seven. For the past two years, she has sold Masai clothing and jewelry at the Bissil market. Samato earns a monthly salary of 20,500 KES. 

Samato is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more Masai clothing and jewelry to sell. This will be her second loan with KADET LTD. Samato describes herself as ambitious and has been a good client with a good loan repayment record. 

Samato plans to use the profits from her loan to expand her business and open a boutique selling Masai-ware. In the future, she hopes to own a big store selling Masai clothing and souvenirs to tourists.

loans.use: to buy Masai clothing and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Pura

texts.en:
Pura is 51 years old and married with two children. She lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. For the past five years, Pura has sold banana-que (deep-fried bananas with caramelized sugar) to earn a living.

Pura has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She is requesting a loan to purchase the raw ingredients to cook and sell banana-que. In the future, Pura hopes to achieve her goal of developing her micro-enterprise to increase her income so her family can lead a better life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make banana-que

loans.name: Parsitau Ole

texts.en:
Parsitau is 38 years old. He is married and has two children, aged four and six. Parsitau has been working in the livestock trading business for seven years. He sells livestock to butchers to the KMC, Kajiado, and Kitengela markets. Parsitau describes himself as hardworking.

Parsitau has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more livestock for his business. This will include two cows, five goats, and five sheep. This will be Parsitau’s second loan with KADET. He has been a good client who repays his loan well. 

Parsitau plans to use the proceeds from his loan to buy a truck to transport livestock to the market. In the future, he hopes to start supplying more livestock to surrounding markets.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
For the past three years, Sammy has been operating a welding business in Mulolongo town. He also manages a hardware shop. Sammy earns a monthly income of 22,000 KES from his businesses. 

This is Sammy’s first loan from KADET LTD. He will purchase another welding machine and hardware and tools to sell. Sammy plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to enlarge his store and open another branch at Athi River.

In the future, Sammy would like to expand his business and open a large hardware and metals shop.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine and tools

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Dicoyong, Sindangan. For the past six years, Eva has been running a shop where she sells charcoal. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

Eva is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of coconut shells for her charcoal business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for her charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase land to expand his agriculture business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bale of childen clothes because they are bought quickly

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 64 years old and lives in P-1 Embargo, Ozamis City. She is married with three children. 

Rosario has a shop that sells charcoal. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of coconut shells to turn into charcoal for her charcoal business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shell to make into charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock for his business

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna comes from village of Zeniti, Adjara Region, West Georgia. He is 37 years old, unmarried, and lives with his mother, who is 57, and his father, who is 60. 

The family earns a living with agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows and sell dairy products at the local market. Also they grow citrus and maize on their plot of land. Most of the harvested corn is used in the dairy farm and the other part is sold at the local market. Citrus is also sold locally. The average monthly income of the family is 600 Georgian laris. 

With the requested credit Datuna purchased a mini tractor. He will use it in his citrus farm and will cut his costs on tilling, as won't have to rent a tractor any more. Also he will be able to offer tilling services to  neighboring farms, earning additional income. 

In the future Datuna plans to save for the expansion of his dairy farm by purchasing additional milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor for the farm

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is 49 years old, married, and has five children. She has been working in the hotels business for the last two years, earning 10,500 KES a month.  Her business is located at a busy market near a quarry site. She sells food to the quarry staff and to the surrounding residents. Mwikali has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES to extend the hotel and to buy new seats and tables.

This is Mwikali’s fist loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the profits from the loan to open another hotel. In the future, Mwikali hopes to own a very big hotel and have hotel branches in neighboring towns. Mwikali describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to buy new seats and tables for her hotel

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old, married to Jamleck, and together they have 2 children, ages 13 and 8. She has been in the shoe sales business for the last 11 years, getting a profit of 30,000 KES per month.
 
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to add more stock of gumboots for this rainy season. She hopes to use the anticipated profit from the loan to open a stall in the market and sell shoes wholesale.

In the future Mary hopes to have 3 wholesale stores. She is a very hard-working woman.

loans.use: to add more stock of gumboots for this rainy season

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 58 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City.

Patricia produces and sells seaweed to earn a living and has had a business for 5 years. Each month she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase materials for her seaweed production.

Patricia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her seaweed production business

loans.name: Amangul's Group

texts.en:
Amangul is a member of this group. She is 36 and married to a builder. Together with her husband she takes care of three children: two sons and a daughter. The sons are at school and the daughter is not yet, as she is preschool age (under seven). 

Three years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Amangul purchased three livestock animals for breeding. She resells livestock at a higher price after being fattened. In this way she earns 3000 soms per month.  

Amangul applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for house repair. With money received from the loan she will purchase building materials and hire labor. In the future Amangul wishes to improve her family’s living conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for house repair.

loans.name: Roukaya

texts.en:
Roukaya is a 30-year-old married woman, living in Qana with her husband and three children. Roukaya has had her own special business for eleven years. Roukaya helps her husband with their family's income to cover their expenses. 

Roukaya is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the first time, in order to increase her stock of summer fruit and to pay for what's left of the price of a new car they intend to buy.

She is a hard worker, beloved by most of her neighbors and friends. She's known for her famous smile, and special customer care she provides. She works hard on improving customer care to face competition around her.

Roukaya hopes to expand her business through selling wholesale and hopes to cover her family's needs as much as she can.

loans.use: to increase her stock of summer fruit.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin is married with three school-aged children. Valentin is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 10 years.

Valentin is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow for his farm. Valentin hopes this loan will expand his operations. Currently, Valentin earns Php 30,000 every crop season in this field of work.

In the future, Valentin hopes that his farm will improve to be able to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is a 32-year-old farmer from village Shemokmedi, Guria Region. He is unmarried and lives with his mother in their own house in the village. The main income of the family comes from agriculture. In particular Malkhaz has 8000 nut trees on family-owned land and he sells the harvested nuts to nut retailers in season. Also he grows apple, pear and chestnut trees in his garden and sells the harvested fruit on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family amounts to 250 Laris, including the pension of Malkhaz’s mother. 

Tourism is another source of income for the family. He has a small apartment in Batumi – a town on Black Sea coast, the tourism center of Georgia. Malkhaz rents his apartment to tourists, July - September. 

With the requested credit Malkhaz plans to renovate the apartment to make it ready for the season. According Malkhaz’s estimate, he’ll be able to get higher rent after the renovation. With the increase in income he plans to expand the nut business through planting additional nut trees.

loans.use: to renovate his apartment to rent it to tourists.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
Natural de da Maputo. Foi a escola ate 5 classe, solteira e Mae de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 7 e 19 anos. 
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salário que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com colegas de serviço e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
A Senhora vem a tornar se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema no ano de 2007 ate o presente ano.  O primeiro financiamento no valor de 4.000,00Mts foi para compra de cimento para bater blocos, no segundo no valor de 6.600,00Mts tambėm  compra cimento, no terceiro emprestimo no valor de 8.000,00Mts para compra de pedra, no quarto emprestimo foi no valor 9.000,00Mts para compra de cimento para iniciar com as fundações  foi para compra de varoes e cimento, no quarto e Com o presente emprestimo de 20.000,00Mts pretende continuar com a sua actividade( compra de aros para janelas , chapas de zinco  e outros materiais).
Tenciona ver  a sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Born and raised in the district of Matutuine, in Maputo province, Lucia attended school up to the 5th Grade. She is a single mother to 3 children aged between 7 and 19. Currently she lives and works in Ponta D'Ouro's tourist area in the district of Matutuine. With the salary that she receives, she manages to feed her family and save a little in her BCI bank account.
She learned about Hluvuku-Adesma from conversations with work colleagues and friends and decided to approach them for clarification on how to become a client, and to win financial backing for her projects.
The applicant became a Hluvuku-Adesema client on the 11th August 2007 and remains so today. Her first loan of 4,000Mts was used to buy cement for making cinder blocks. The second loan was for 6,600Mts which was also used to buy cement, her third loan was for 8,000Mts to buy stone, the fourth loan was to buy cement in order to begin laying foundations (to buy rods and cement). By combining the fourth loan and this one for 20,000Mts she plans to continue her current activities (to buy window arches, zinc sheeting and other materials).
She intends to finish building her house and she is relying on Hluvuku-Adsema for further financing.

loans.use: to buy window arches, zinc sheeting and other materials

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann, 52 years old, is a tailor. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. They are married with two children and they are now working in Thailand. 

This family can make $17.5 per day, and they spend it on food, $60; electricity, $4; and other things, $5. 

Vann would like to request a loan of $1,000 to repair her house to make it more comfortable for her career as a tailor. After this loan she expects that her family will get more income and will live in better a situation than now. She plans to buy a new sewing machine and another machine that is related to her career.

loans.use: To repair her house to improve her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Natural da Cidade de Quelimane Provincia da Zambezia. Foi a escola ate 9 classe, casado maritalmente e ė Pai de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 13 e 16 anos. 
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salário que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com colegas de serviço e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Vem a tornar se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema apartir do dia 15 de Maio de 2011.  O primeiro e unico financiamento no valor de 15.000,00Mts foi para compra de cimento para Fabrico de  blocos e pagamento da mao de obra
Tenciona ver  a casa de sua Mãe concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Quelimane in the Zambezi province.  He attended school through the 9th grade.  He is married and father of two children, ages 13 and 16.  He currently lives and works in the tourist area of Ponta D'Ouro in the Matutuine district.  His salary provides enough to feed his family and he saves a little at the Banco Comercial (BCI).

Jorge learned about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with coworkers and friends and he decided to learn more about the process of becoming a client and how to benefit form loans to complete his projects. He became a client of Hluvuku-Ademsa on May 15, 2011.  His first and only loan was for 15,000.00Mts for the purchase of cement to make blocks, and to pay for labor.  

He is anxious to see his mother's house completed and for that purpose he will rely on Hluvuku-Adesma for additional loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement to make blocks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nelson Julio

texts.pt:
Natural da Provincia da Gaza. Foi a escola ate 9 classe, casado maritalmente e ė Pai de 1 filho ainda menor de um ano. 
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salário que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com seu irmao, amigos e colegas de serviço e decide aproximar acompanhado do seu irmão para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
tornou se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema no ano de 2010 ate o presente ano.  O primeiro financiamento no valor de 8.000,00Mts foi para compra de cimento para bater blocos e pagamento da mao de obra, no segundo no valor de 12.000,00Mts para compra de areia e pedra, com o presente emprestimo no valor de 20.000,Mts pretende continuar com sua actividade comprar cimento, pagar mao de obra e chapas de zinco.
Tenciona ver sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Born and raised in the city of Gaza, in Gaza province, the borrower attended school until the 9th Grade. He is married and has a son who is under one year old.
Currently he lives and works in Ponta D'Ouro's tourist area, in the Matutuine district. With the salary that he earns he manages to feed his family and save a little in his BCI bank account.
He heard about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with his brother, friends and work colleagues, and decided to approach them, accompanied by his brother, to find out more information on how to become a client and benefit from financing for his projects.
He became a Hluvuku-Adesema client on the 23rd June 2010 and remains so today.  His first loan for 8,000Mts was his only source of financing, it was used to buy mortar to make cinder blocks and to pay labour costs. His second loan for 12,000Mts was used to buy sand and stone. With this current loan for 20,000Mts, he wants to continue his work by buying mortar, zinc sheeting and paying labour costs.
He hopes to finish building his house and he is relying on Hluvuku-Adsema for funding for this aim.

loans.use: to buy mortar and other materials

loans.name: Alyiman's Group

texts.en:
Alyiman, 59, is the leader of this group; unfortunately she is a widow. She has a son who is married and has three children.  Alyiman’s son works in construction; his monthly salary is 5000 soms. He earns additional money by selling fruits and vegetables on the market. 

In order to contribute money to the family budget, Alyiman breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after being fattened. In this way she earns 8000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Alyiman wants to increase the number of livestock. In the future she wants to save money to purchase a vehicle for her son and build a sauna near the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more timber to resell.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is a 39-year-old taxi driver from village Kobuleti, Adjara Region, Black Sea coast. He is unmarried and lives with his parents--his 56-year-old mother and 70-year-old father, in the village. 

Tengiz’s family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. Cheese is sold on the local market. Also they have a citrus garden with an area of 3,000 sq. meters. The harvested citrus is sold to wholesalers. Along with the above-mentioned, Tengiz and his parents run a small bee-keeping farm. They have seven bee-hives with bee-colonies. Honey is gathered twice a year and sold on the local market. 

Along with agriculture, Tengiz’s taxi is an important source of the income for the family. Tengiz mainly works in Batumi and Kobuleti, nearby towns and a tourism centre of Georgia. His car is very old and already not comfortable, so Tengiz decided to sell it, add the borrowed amount to its price, and buy a new, better car. He should do it before July, as in July the tourism season starts and he should be ready to serve the tourists. 

Tengiz hopes that he will have more clients for this season as he will have a better, more comfortable car. This will be positively reflected in family income. Tengiz plans to use one part of the profit gained this season for purchasing additional bee-hives and bee-colonies.

loans.use: to purchase a new car (taxi).

loans.name: Costancio

texts.pt:
Natural do Distrito da Catembe  Provincia da Maputo. Foi a escola ate 7 classe, casado maritalmente e pai de 1 filho com 4 anos idade. Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salario que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com colegas de serviço e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Tornou se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema e este e seu terceiro emprestimo. com os primeiros comprou outros materiais( cimento para para fabrico de  blocos) nos valores de 8.000,00mt e 13.000,00mt respectivamente.

Com o presente emprestimo de 16.000,00Mts pretende comprar um jogo de sofas e uma estante de madeira.
Tenciona ver  a sua casa concluida e mobilada no molde desejado e para tal conta com a hluvuku-adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Born and raised in the district of Catembe in the Maputo province, Constancio attended school until the seventh grade. He is married, and the father of one four year old. Currently he lives and works in Ponta D'Ouro's tourist area, in the Matutuine district. With the salary that he earns, he manages to feed his family and save a little in his BCI bank account.

Constancio heard about Hluvuku-Adesema from conversations with work colleagues and friends and he decided to approach them to find out more about how to become a client and benefit from financing for his project.

This is is third loan with Hluvuku-Adesema. With his first two loans, for 8,000.00mts and 13,000mts respectively, he bought cement for the manufacture of cement blocks.

With this loan of 16,000mts, he plans to buy a sofa set and a wooden shelf. He intends to furnish his house in this style, and in order to do so, he counts on Hluvuku-Adsema for financing.

loans.use: comprar um jogo de sofas e uma estante de madeira.

loans.name: Sumeth

texts.en:
Sumeth, 32 years old, sells groceries at home. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, and they are living in Battombong Province. 

Their income is $10 per day. They are married and have two children, 15 and 12 years old. Both are in school. 

Every month, they have to spend $83 on food, $10 on electricity, and $75 on school fees for their children. 

Sumeth would like to a request loan of $500 to buy more canned goods and other things for her grocery shop to sell. Before, her grocery shop was very small and there were not enough things for her costumers to buy, so she expects that after this loan, she can offer her costumers the things they need. 

She also plans to enlarge her shop when she gets more income and she will send her children to school until they are finished and get a good job.

loans.use: To buy more canned goods and other things for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to the stock in her clinic.

loans.name: Kairbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kairbubu, 60, is the leader of this group. Despite her age, Kairbubu leads an active way of life. For the past sixteen years she, together with her husband, has been working selling of various types of goods. The major part of the assortment includes consumer goods and tobacco. The working spot is in a local big market. 

The size of the town Kochkorka, where our group leader lives, isn’t very big, therefore almost every buyer makes purchases here. Kairbubu has only one financial dependent, her  youngest son, while the older ones live on their own. Her start-up capital sixteen years ago totaled 2 000 soms. Fortunately at the moment her monthly income is five times more than that. The gradually increasing profit has assisted the couple to provide their livelihood and finish their son’s tuition payment. 

Kairbubu believes that increasing the variety of her assortment will attract more customers. She hopes Kiva lenders’ financial assistance will allow her  to increase circulation of her goods and she can stock her stand with new products. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour, macaroni, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.pt:
natural de Provincia da Inhambane. Foi a escola ate 7 classe, solteira e Mae de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 7 anos. Saiu de Inhambane sob proposta de emprego que uma amiga tera lhe aranjado e decidiu afixar sua residencia.
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salario que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com colegas de serviço e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
tornou se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema apartir do dia 25 de Março de 2009 ate o presente ano de 2011.  O primeiro financiamento no valor de 3.000,00Mts foi para compra de cimento para bater blocos, no segundo no valor de 8.000,00Mts, no terceiro no valor de 10.000,00Mts tambem para compra de materiais e pagamento de mao de obra. Com o presente emprestimo de 30.000,00Mts pretende continuar com a sua actividade( compra de pedra , e chapas de zinco para cobertura).
Tenciona ver  a sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a hluvuku-adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Halima is from the Inhambane province.  She attended school until the 7th grade.  She is a single mother of 2 sons ages 3 and 7.  She left Inhambane for a job that a friend had arranged for her, and she decided to stay.  She now works and lives in the tourist area of Ponta D'Ouro in the Matutuine district.  Her salary enables her to feed her family and save a bit in the bank.  

She learned about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with colleagues and friends, and decided to learn more about the process of becoming a client and benefiting from loans to complete her projects. She became a client of Hluvuku-Adesma on March 25, 2009, and is still a client in 2011.  Her first loan was for 3.000.00Mts to purchase cement for blocks.  The second was for 8.000.00Mts, and the third was for 10.000.00Mts also to purchase materials and pay for labor.  With this loan of 30.000.00Mts, she plans to continue the work, purchasing stones and zinc panels for roofing.

She is anxious to complete her home, and will count on Hluvuku-Adesma for additional loans.

loans.use: to purchase stones and zinc panels for a roof.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm supplies, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.pt:
Natural da Provincia da Inhambane. Foi a escola ate 8 classe, casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 7 anos. Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo para procurar emprego e vem a iniciar seu negocio no distrito de Namaacha onde tem sua residencia fixa, e na ponta de ouro vem a procura de melhor mercado para desemvolver o seu negocio estando ospedado em casa do seu primo. 
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do seu negocio consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com seus primos e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Tornou se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema apartir do dia 04 de Abril de 2011 ate o presente ano de 2011.  O primeiro financiamento no valor de 13.000,00Mts foi para compra de creditos para venda. Com o presente emprestimo de 25.000,00Mts pretende continuar com a sua actividade( compra de recargas para celulares).
Tenciona ver  o seu negocio a crescer  e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
This client is from the Inhambane province.  He attended school until the 8th grade.  He is married and has two children, ages 3 and 7.  He left Inhambane for Maputo to look for work, and he started his own business in the Namaacha district where he established residence.  He came to Ponta D'Ouro in search of a better market for his business and stayed at his cousin's house. He currently lives and works in the tourist area of Ponta D'Ouro in the Matutuine district.  With his business he is able to feed his family and save a bit at the bank.  

He learned about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with his cousins and friends and decided to learn more about the process of becoming a client and benefiting from loans to help him with his projects. He became a client of Hluvuku-Adesma on April 4, 2011 and he is a current client.  His first loan was for 13.000.00 for the purchase of cell phone minutes for sale.  With this loan of 25.000.00 he plans to continue with this activity (purchasing cell phone minutes). 

He is anxious to see his business grow and for that purpose he will count on Hluvuku-Adesma for additional loans.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone minutes

loans.name: Mira Jalpetekova's Group

texts.en:
Mira, 61, leads this group. Like most of her neighbors in the village of Kochkorka, she makes a living raising cattle. In recent years, this work has become harder for her to do because of health issues, so she is grateful to have a 24-year-old son who has taken over the work and is continuing to increase the number of cattle they own. This is important because it’s easier to cover fixed and variable costs with a large herd than a small one. Mira is applying for this loan to buy more cattle and increase her family's income so that her son can buy a car and begin working as a cab driver.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stone, zinc sheets to cover the area and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and light equipment.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia lives in the Nkubu area in Central Kenya. She is married and has three children, two of whom are grown while the third is still in school. She has made a living as a farmer for the last 10 years, and produces milk as well as maize and beans. She sells all of her products locally. Lydia has requested for a loan for 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy goats. She says she prefers raising goats because they are drought resistant and because they will allow her to increase her income and become financially able to send all of her children to college. Lydia believes that drastic climatic changes have caused a fall-off in production and means she needs to shift to goats.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and light equipment.

loans.name: Ana Jaime

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos de 8 aos 14 anos todos vão a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições pois foi abandonada pela sua mãe e fica nos cuidados da avo. Vive na casa própria com sua familia e sustenta sua avo que vive com ela.


Sai do Distrito para cidade da Matola no tempo da guerra, anos depois regressa a sua Terra natal. Iniciou sua activivdade comercial muito jovem, porque sua avo ja não tinha possibilidades de a sustentar, é proprietária de um estabelecimento onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade nomeadamente( arroz, açucar, sabão, refrigerantes e mais). Não tem empregados conta com ajuda dos seus filhos , trabalha das 6h as 23h consegue um rendimento de 6.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra, poupa 1.500.00mt na sua conta bancaria  porque conta com ajuda do seu marido que é docente.

Este é o quarto empréstimo  na Hluvuku e terceiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para revenda. Os anteriores de (7.000.00, 10.000.00 e 15.000.00)mt foram usados para o comércio.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Ana was born in the district of Namaacha in Maputo province. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children between 8 and 14 years of age. All of her children attend school. She went to school through the fifth grade, but had to stop going when her mother abandoned her and left her in the care of her grandmother. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her grandmother, who lives with them.
She left Namaacha for the city of Matola during the war. Years later, she returned to her homeland. She started working when she was very young because her grandmother didn't have the economic means to support her. She owns a shop where she sells staple goods (rice, sugar, soap, perishables, etc.). She has no employees, but two of her children help her in the shop. She works from 6 a.m. till 11 p.m. and brings in about 6000 meticals a month, which she uses for household expenses and for construction on the house. She is able to save about 1500 meticals a month in her bank account because her husband, who is a teacher, also contributes to the household financially.
This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku and her third with Kiva. She will use this 20,000-metical loan to buy staple goods for her shop. Her previous loans (in the amounts of 7000, 10,000, and 15,000 meticals) also were invested in the business.
She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan without difficulty and request an additional loan to finish the construction.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods for her shop.

loans.name: Ainur's Group

texts.en:
Ainur, 41, is the leader of this group. She resides in the small town of Nookat with a population of approximately 13 000 people. The residents of the town most of the year enjoy caressing sun rays and fresh air. Ainur is a native resident, who was born, grew up and built a family here. She is the mother of five children, the youngest of whom is 3. She married her spouse Orozali Mamataliev 21 years ago. In 2001, joining their efforts, Ainur and Orozali started cultivating several hectares of land using start up capital of 2 000 soms. The soil together with the favorable weather conditions of Nookat and its nourishing water, turned out a rich harvest. Now the children are grown and are capable of accomplishing their own portion of field work. Relying on his skills and knowledge in architecture, Orozali was accepted as a construction worker to a local company. Currently Ainur cultivates potatoes, corn and sunflowers. She believes that intensive work and care will bring a rich harvest this fall. For now she still has a lot to do including using fertilizers. Ainur hopes that a loan from Kiva with the help of Mol Bulak Finance will allow her purchase some fertilizers.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a kiosk for her fish business and to add the sale of vegetables.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo Sul de Moçambique, tem 41 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 6 filhos de 4 aos 27 anos  5  vão a Escola excepto o mais velho porque já esta empregado.vive na casa própria com sua familia, responsabiliza se pelo irmão que é doente mental.

Sai de casa dos seus pais quando junta se com seu esposo, anos depois ela consegue aranjar um emprego na Escola Primaria de Mugado no mesmo Distrito como Auxiliar Administrativa é  funcionaria permanente a mais de 9 anos trabalhando das 10h as 17h auferindo mensalmente 2.731.04mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra, para alêm do salário conta também com ajuda do seu esposo que é Guarda Fronteira.

Ja teve empréstimo no BIM, conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas que são clientes da Instituição. Este é o 5º  empréstimo de Angelina na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprarar material de construção( cimento, ferros, pedras) para concluir a sua cozinha. O primeiro de 7.000.00mt foi para compra de congelador e os restantes, de 8.000.00, 8.500.00 e 9.000.00 foram para habitação.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo crédito para construção do murro de vedação na sua residência
texts.en:
Angelica was born in the district of Namaacha in Maputo province in southern Mozambique. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of six children between 4 and 27 years of age. Five of the children attend school, while the eldest is already working. She lives in her own home with her family, and also takes care of her brother, who is mentally ill.
She left her parents' home when she got married. After a few years she was able to find work at the elementary school in Mugado, also in Namaacha district, where she has had a job as an administrative assistant for the past nine years. She works from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. and earns 2731 meticals a month, which she uses for household expenses and for construction on her home. In addition, her husband, who is a border guard, also brings in a salary.
Angelica has already had one loan with BIM. She learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also clients of the organization. This is her fifth Hluvuku loan, and she plans to use the 12,000-metical loan to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, stone) to finish her kitchen. She used her first loan, in the amount of 7000 meticals, to buy a freezer, and the others (8000, 8500, and 9000 mt) for the bedroom.
She is confident that she will be able to pay off this loan early and request a new one in order to build a boundary wall for her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, light equipment and labor.

loans.name: Shakar's Group

texts.en:
Shakar, 47, is the leader of this group. She resides in the town of Nookat, known for its agricultural products of a high quality and taste. It’s been ten years since she got involved in agriculture, following the example of most of her friends. Land feeds all residents of this town, therefore every resident is thankful for being born in a land with such rich soil and good climate. Shakar is a widow, however she has given a worthy life to all of her three kids, two of whom already have their own businesses. For ten years Shakar has been saving and gradually expanding the size of the land she owns. At this moment her piece of land is one of the largest in the neighborhood. This means that she cultivates a bigger amount of agricultural products and she needs more inputs such as water and fertilizers.  The initial capital of 1500 soms used ten years ago allowed Shakar to grow only one type of product, unlike now when Shakar grows a wide variety of products. However Shakar isn’t always capable of covering  all her costs, especially fertilizers. For such big land and wide range of products, Shakar needs a large amount of different types of fertilizers. With this purpose she is applying  for a loan from Kiva.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Nitron

texts.pt:
nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 4 filhos dos 6 meses aos 12 anos, 3 dos quais vão a Escola. Concluiu o Ensino Médio Proficional de professorado estando agora a frequentar o Ensino Superior a distância. Vive na casa própria com sua familia e responsabiliza se pelos seus 3 sobrinhos que vivem com ele em sua casa.

Sai de Inhambane com seus pais para o Distrito de Namaacha onde cresce e se forma proficionalmente. E  Docente, funcionario permanente, trabalha das 6:45h as 13:50h auferindo mensalmente 9.055.75 mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra, consegue poupar 1.000.00mt mensalmente porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa que também e Docente. 

Ja teve empréstimo no BIM, conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que são clientes da instituição. Este é seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, barrotes, chapas de zinco, portas e mais) para concluir as minimas partes da mesma. Os anteriores de (10.000.00, 18.000.00 e 12.000.00) foram para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir mais credito para comcluir  sua obra. Seu maior sonho é concluir os estudos e ter uma vida estavel.
texts.en:
Nitron was born in Inhambane province. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of four children between the ages of 6 months and 12 years. Three of the children attend school. He finished high school, where he trained as a teacher, and he would like to pursue higher education. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports his three nephews, who live with them.
He and his parents left Inhambane for the district of Namaacha, where he grew up and received his professional training. He has a permanent position as a teacher and works from 6:45 a.m. till 1:50 p.m. He earns 9055 meticals a month, which he uses for household expenses and for construction on the home. He is able to save 1000 meticals a month because his wife, who is also a teacher, also contributes to the household.
Nitron has also taken out loans with BIM. He learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also clients of the organization. This is his third loan with Hluvuku, and he will use the 20,000 meticals to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, sheet metal, doors, etc.) to finish his house. His previous loans (in the amounts of 10,000, 18,000, and 12,000 meticals) were also used for the same purpose.
He is confident that he will be able to pay off this loan early and request an additional loan to finish the construction. His greatest dream is to finish his studies and have a stable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sheet metal, doors, etc.) for his home.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a resident farmer of Nkubu town in Central Kenya producing and selling bananas, beans and maize to the local market. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 11.

Harriet has made a loan request amounting to 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase  poultry birds. She says she wants to venture into poultry farming and expects to earn enough to educate her children as well as provide other basic needs.

She notes animal diseases and inadequate rainfall are the greatest challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Karamat's Group

texts.en:
Karamat is 55 years old and leads this loan group. She lives in the sunny town of Nookat, where she has three grown children. Everyone in the family works, and most earn money by farming. Six years ago the family business was worth 2 400 soms and based on a very small piece of land. But the family has done a great job of using the money it earns to buy more land, an automobile and furniture for its home. Karamat's husband, who makes a living as a cab driver, believes that they do not have enough money to buy fertilizer -- and when Karamat heard about loans from Mol Bulak Finance, she put this group together so that they could all join together to get the funding they needed. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase  more timber to make wooden chairs and windows to sell.

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane tem 37 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos de 4 a 10 anos, todos vão a Escola, fez a 7ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições.Vive na casa própria com sua familia, não responsabiliza se por ninguem para alêm dos filhos.

Muda se de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha com seu esposo. Começa a trabalhar numa alfaiataria onde aprende a costurar, seu marido emigra para a Africa do Sul e compra lhe uma maquina de costura, assim ela passa a fazer trabalhos de custura na sua própria casa. E proprietaria de uma banca na sua residência onde também vende produtos de primeira necessidade como( açucar, amendoim, arroz, feijão, massa e mais), tem gastado em cada viagem uma média de 8.000.00mt nas compras e tendo de lucro 3.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Conta também com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul.

Nunca trabalhou com outros Bancos. Conhece a Hluvuku atraves de amigos que também são clientes da instituição. Este é seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume dos seus produtos de venda. Os anteriores de (3.000.00,08.000.00 e 15.000.00)mt foram para o comercio

Esta convicto que vai pagar cem nenhum problema para aceder a outros empréstimos no futuro, e dar inicio da costrução da casa no novo terreno.
texts.en:
Judite was born in Inhambane province. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children between 4 and 10 years of age. All of her children attend school. She went to school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of her family's financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family, and is not responsible for anyone else besides her children.
She and her husband moved from Inhambane to the district of Namaacha, where she started working in a tailor's workshop and learned to sew. Her husband emigrated to South Africa and bought her a sewing machine, so she began taking in sewing jobs at home. She has counter in her home where she also sells staple goods (sugar, peanuts, rice, beans, pasta, etc.). She spends an average of about 8000 meticals on each shopping trip and earns a profit of 3000 meticals, which she uses to cover household expenses and construction on the house. She also gets help from her husband, who works in South Africa.
She has held loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the organization. This is her fourth loan, and she will use the 17,000 meticals to increase the stock of products she carries for her shop. Her previous loans (in the amounts of 3000, 8000, and 15,000 meticals) were also invested in the business.
She is confident that she will have no trouble paying off this loan and will be able to request others in the future that will help her start building a house on a new lot.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods for her shop.

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul, 32, leads this group. For the last 12 years, she has lived in a town called Nookat with her husband Bakytbek, a construction worker. They have three children, all of whom go to school. For the last five years, the couple has run a farm where they grow a range of products, including tobacco, potatoes and corn. Their local brand of tobacco is well-known across Central Asia, and most of it is sold to large tobacco-producing companies. The family started its farming operation five years ago with an investment of 4,000 soms but has steadily reinvested profits to buy more land and make major improvements to its home. Nazgul is very grateful for the help she receives from Kiva lenders and will use this loan to buy fertilizer. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three school-aged children. In 2001, she started running her own business; she works as a beauty specialist, receiving clients at her home. She has worked in this domain for more than 10 years. Her income is important to help with her household expenses and to pay for her children’s school fees. 

Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges Lebanese women are facing in running a business and at the same time raising children and taking care of their houses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a massage machine in order to satisfy her customer’s demand. In the future, she hopes to open a formal beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase a massage machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles and tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase his inventory of new mobile phones and purchase prepaid telephone cards.

loans.name: Anarkan's Group

texts.en:
Anarkan, 51, leads this loan group. She became a widow two years ago, and has continued to live in Kerben with her two children. She makes a living raising livestock and has worked hard for the last three years to increase the size of her herd. She invested 25,000 soms in her animals, and now earns about 3,500 soms a month. She will use this loan to buy sheep, and hopes to earn enough money to repair her house and buy kitchen appliances. 

Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and light equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a small place to do his work.

loans.name: Kalinisa's Group

texts.en:
Kalinisa, 46, is the leader of this group. She is divorced and has a sixteen year old son. Her father, who is a retiree, helps her take care of her cow and calf. The profits have allowed her to renew her apartment. Seven years of hard work now bring 1,000 soms per month, from an initial capital investment of 12,000 soms. The purpose of the loan is to purchase a calf for fattening and resale. In the future, Kalinisa would like to open her own farm and supply milk products to the entire region. Kalinisa is also a geography teacher in the local high school. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old engaged woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and two siblings. She started working as a private teacher from her home over the past two years. To receive the students properly, she has prepared a special education room. Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform modifications needed for the room by adding more tables, a bigger wall and new educational equipment. She intends to increase her income because she is hoping to get married soon and needs to finalize all the wedding preparations as soon as possible.

loans.use: to perform modifications needed for her schoolroom, adding more tables, a bigger wall and new education equipment.

loans.name: Okyeso Nyame (Kajebir) Group

texts.en: Esther is the leader (in the blue blouse and white skirt) of this group and sells travel bags and other kinds of bags at Takoradi. She has been in this trade for three years. Esther is a single parent, taking care of one child. She is responsible for the upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: to buy more bags for resale.

loans.name: Neefe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité a été créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il est composés de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et pratiquent les mêmes activités (le petit commerce)

Madame Nafissatou (à la droite de la photo levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a en charge onze autres enfants en sa charge confié par ses parents et ses voisins.

Elle s'active dans la vente de fruits et légumes depuis très longtemps. Elle a une bonne maitrise de son activité et de sa clientèle.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses marchandises pour une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et de se procurer plus de bénéfices

Les profits lui permettront d'aider son mari à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille(nourriture, santé) et d'augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on 9th July 2002 and is made up of women who live in the same district and have the same activities (small trading businesses).

Nafissatou (on the right of the photo and raising her hand) is in charge of the group. She is 50 years old, married and mother to eight children. She has eleven other children in her care, entrusted to her by her relatives and neighbors.

She has been selling fruit and vegetables for a long time and masters her business and her customers well. This loan will allow her to increase her stock of goods, thereby satisfying better customer demand and reaping in more profit. The profits she makes will enable her to help her husband to improve the family's living conditions (food, health) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds, and tools

loans.name: Shee

texts.en:
