Shee is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while the other two have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail business, selling in a nearby school. Her potential customers are school-going children. Seasonality is a major challenge as during holiday season, children do not attend school, meaning low customer turn out. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 10,000 Kshs loan, she plans to purchase sacks of ground nuts, biscuits and sweets for sale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of ground nuts, biscuits and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm supplies, seeds, and tools

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn is a widowed mother of three residing in Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. As a stay-at-home-mother, she carries out a variety of duties including taking care of her children, cooking good meals, managing cash flow, etc.  

Yom is presently dependent upon support from her daughter, a garment factory worker, and her son-in-law, a sewing machine repairer. In order to earn an income, Yorn is requesting a Kiva loan to open a small business selling a variety  of goods in front of her house. She is really optimistic and thanks all  who make her loan possible.

loans.use: to open a small business selling a variety of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beans, onions, rice and ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy planting supplies, seed, and small equipment.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Mary hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 10,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cereals and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cereals and maize flour.

loans.name: Twisungane 23 B Group

texts.fr: Boniface  est agriculteur du riz, né  au Rwanda.et il est membre du groupe TWISUNGANE 23 B. Il est marié, il  a 31ans, il n’a aucun enfant et il n’a aucunes personnes en charge. Il  a six  ans des études primaires. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour payer les ouvriers et acheter les angrais chimiques pour ses activités de l’agriculture du riz. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter les champs en vue d’accroitre la production. Sa vision est de faire la réhabilitation d’une maison et avoir la bonne production. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le frais de mutuel de sante.
texts.en: Boniface is a rice farmer who was born in Rwanda.  He is a member of the group TWISUNGANE 23 B.  He is married and 31 years old. He has no children and no dependents.  He has had six years of primary schooling.  This is his first round of loans with ACB.  He will use his loan to pay workers and buy chemical fertilizer for his rice farming business.  He does not expect any difficulties with repaying his loan.  His business growth strategy is to make the fields bigger in order to increase production.  His vision is to fix a house and have a good harvest.  For his family, he would like to pay their medical insurance premium.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Mboa Kuw (Mpohor) Group

texts.en: Mboa Kuw is an association of which three members, Fanny, Yaa and Maame, make up the solidarity subset group. Fanny, who has her hand up in the photo, is the leader. She is married with two children and has a junior high school education. Fanny sells cosmetics at Takoradi, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a carpenter. Fanny uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fanny plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI I  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de DANGASSO  de la commune de DAH, préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 42 ans et au moins  6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du fonio comme cultures principales. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne.
ALIMATA, deuxième debout en boubou rougeâtre, compte utiliser son prêt actuel pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, de fonio, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN, KOUTIALA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes (les gens communément appelées les acheteurs).
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30 000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi I is a grouping of married women from the village of Dangasso in the commune of Dah, which lies in the San prefecture in the Segou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They live in traditional families, average 42 years of age with at least six children each. They mainly grow groundnut and fonio. With a view to making their farming activities profitable, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program three years ago. Having repaid their previous loans in full, they are now on their third farming loan.

Alimata, standing second from the left in a reddish boubou (flowing West African dress) is planning to use her current loan to buy a sufficient amount of groundnut and fonio seeds, small materials and agricultural inputs at the large market in San. After the rainy season the crops are stocked for a certain amount of time in order to gain value before they are sold at the large markets in San, Koutiala and in surrounding markets, on a retail basis (but often wholesale) for cash to a customer base which generally comes from large towns (people commonly called buyers).

The members of the Benkadi I group are each expecting to make, once their crops are sold, a profit of between 30,000 and 40,000FCFA, which will be used to repay the interest on their loans and to cover household running costs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a married man with children who attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past three years, he has operated a business selling farm products, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. He sells products like cassava, mangoes and coconuts. He faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation from the farm to the market. Justin dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, he wants to purchase bundles of oranges, cassava, coconuts and mangoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of oranges, cassava, coconuts and mangoes.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI II  est constitué de 10 femmes toutes mariées du village de DANGASSO de la préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 7 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du fonio et du sésame   Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt  de campagne.
MARIAM, la présidente du groupe, qui est la première debout à droite avec une écharpe blanchâtre tachetée de bleu, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, de fonio, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et Kimparana  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 31000 à 49000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi II is composed of ten married women from the village of Dangasso, San prefecture in Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. They are on average 38 years old with at least seven children.
They cultivate groundnuts, fonio and sesame. In order to make their farms more profitable, the group's members have decided to be a part of Soro Yiriwaso's loan program for three years now. Having successfully repaid previous loans, they are on their third farming loan.
Mariam, the group's president, is the first woman standing to the right of the picture, with a blue-speckled white scarf. She plans on using her loan to purchase sufficient quantities of groundnut and fonio seeds, as well as small equipment and agricultural inputs, from the great market of San. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a certain time to gain value before they are sold at the great markets of San and Kimparana, and on neighboring markets, either retail or (often) wholesale, to customers who mostly come from larger cities.
After selling their agricultural products, the members of the Benkadi II group plan on making each a profit comprised between 31,000 and 49,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan's interest and for the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Mboa Kuw (Mpohor) Group

texts.en:
On the left of this photo is Florence, wearing a white blouse. She is the leader of this four member group. 

Florence is married and has a junior high school education. She sells cosmetics at Takoradi, which she has done for five years. Her husband is in mining. She helps him to take care of the home. Florence will use this loan to purchase varieties of cosmetics for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to build her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a mango selling business, selling at the market to her town dwellers. Lozi faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation from the rural to urban area for sales. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 15,000 Kshs, she plans to purchase sacks of mangoes and pay for transport costs. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loan products.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of mangoes and pay for transport costs.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI III est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de DANGASSO de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargie et ont en moyenne 39 ans et en moyenne 9 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide, du fonio et du haricot.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel de MAMINE, la première assise à gauche avec un foulard  vert à la tête, sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 22500 à 70.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi III is a group of married women from the village of Dangasso, part of San in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional extended families and are on average 39 years old and have on average nine children.

They cultivate peanuts, fonio (Western Africa cereal) and beans. In order to make their farms profitable, the group decided three years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. After successfully repaying previous loans, they are on their third agricultural loan.

Mamin, the first person on the left wearing a green scarf, will use her portion of the loan to buy peanuts for planting, small equipment and inputs for cultivation, at the general market in San.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value before being resold at the general market in San and in surrounding markets, retail (but often in bulk), for cash, to customers usually from large cities.

After selling their agricultural products each group member hopes to achieve profits between 22,500 and 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover daily expenditures of the family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small farming equipment

loans.name: Mukisa Womens Goup Group

texts.en: Rebecca, 43, has been engaged in a pub business in Kayunga for nine years. The happily married mother of six offers her patrons a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. Nine years running this business has made her realize that she needs to constantly restock in order to meet the demands of her increasing clientele. People all over Uganda like consuming alcohol and it's quickly becoming second nature in the country, especially in the urban areas. Rebecca also farms. Her weekly profits total up to 185,000 Ugandan shillings. She plans to use this loan to purchase more crates of beer for resale, as it is consumed more than any other beverage.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beer for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI IV  est composé de  7 femmes mariées du village de DANGASSO relevant de SAN région de SEGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide  et du fonio.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième   prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel  de ROKIA, la deuxième debout à gauche, tout de vert vêtue, sera utilisé pour acheter, de  la semence d’arachide,  payer des frais de labours,  des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, la récolte est  stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de SAN  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 22000 à 59000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi IV group is made up of seven married women from the village of Dangasso in the San region of Ségou, which is the fourth administrative region of Mali.  They live in traditional families, and are an average of 42 years old with at least six children each.

They raise groundnuts and fonio millet.  To increase the profitability of their farming activities, the group members decided three years ago to participate in Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program.  After repaying the previous loans, they are on their third loan.  

Rokia’s current loan (standing second to left, in green) will be used to pay labor costs and buy groundnut seeds, small tools, and fertilizer in the large market in San.  After the rainy season, the harvest is stored for a period of time in order to grow in value before being sold in the large market in San and in surrounding markets, either at retail or—often—in bulk, on a cash basis to customers mostly from large towns.

After the sale of their crops the members of the group expect to each earn a profit of 22,000 to 59,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interest and to pay their families’ expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and small tools.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Everline is 33 years old and lives in Paynesville.  She is married and her husband is a Mason. They have four children, two of whom are attending school.

For the past two years, Everline has been selling pigs feet in the local market. She enjoys selling a lot since pigs feet is widely eaten in her community. One thing she loves the most is that she gets more income to enable her to pay for her children's tuition.

Everline is requesting a loan to purchase one barrel of pigs feet and a drum of oil. She plans to build a house and buy a car in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase one barrel of pigs feet and a drum of oil

loans.name: Theora

texts.en:
Theora is a 22-year-old woman who lives in the Paynesville area. She stopped her education at the six grade level and has one child who was attending school and had to drop out because she had no tuition.

For eight years she has been running a local food center where she sells delicious Liberian dishes. She has a lot of customers and the food finishes very early. 

Theora is requesting a loan to purchase red oil drums to sell in the local market. She plans to buy land and build a house on it in the near future for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase red oil drums to sell in the local market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business

loans.name: Sodisa

texts.en:
Sodisa is an active 49-year-old mother. Her husband works in Russia. Sodisa has five children and loves all of them. She is engaged in a farming business and cultivates wheat, rice and corn. Her son and daughter always help her to improve their living conditions. The income she earns from this business allows her to take care of her family of five children. She has a good credit history. Sodisa needs to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants. Sodisa is requesting a loan of $1,100 USD to help her with this purchase.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Bazargul

texts.en:
Bazargul’s economic activity is agriculture to which she has dedicated herself for several years. She is married and the mother of five children. Bazargul learned the farming business from a young age and now has a lot of experience. She cultivates wheat, maize, corn, tomatoes and water melon. Her husband and older son help her in this business. The reason why Bazargul is requesting a loan from IMON International is to invest in seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants. This will be her 5th loan and she has a good credit history. With this loan she will be able to succeed and have better opportunities for the sale of her products after the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foods to increase the variety of goods he sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Masaai clothes, sukas, jewelry, and beads to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge because of the high cost of transporting charcoal to her place of sale. Patricia dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Patricia wants to purchase utensils for cooking fish and bundles of fish. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase utensils for cooking fish and bundles of fish.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom is a hardworking man. He is married and has one daughter. His wife is a housewife and she always supports her husband. Bahrom produces  ice-cream at home. He has several freezers for production of ice-cream. He delivers ice-cream to markets for selling. He started his business with the service of playing on computers. He has 10 sets of computers for playing and for providing computer services for his clients. Bahrom would like to get a loan of 6,500 Somoni for purchasing five sets of tables and four freezers to expand his businesses. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy five sets of tables and four freezers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats for resale

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 34 year old married man and father of two  children, living and working in Bint Jbeil.  Moustafa has worked in hardware selling since 2005. His business has expanded through the years and his customers are increasing more and more.  Moustafa needs to increase his capital, in order to fulfill his customers needs and requests. To do so, Moustafa has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner. This is Moustafa's third cycle with Al Majmoua. All his previous loans have had a positive impact on his business, and he has been a good standing borrower. 

Moustafa hopes to improve his business more and buy a new truck, in addition to providing his family the best living.

loans.use: To increase his Capital

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 2 years, Santa has operated a local brewing business, selling from home to her local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and starting another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 Santa wants to purchase jerrycans for sale of brew. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase jerrycans for sale of brew.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widow with 7 seven children, all of whom are grown up. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Mbodze has operated a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. During the dry hot season the availability of coconut for sale is low compared to the rainy winter season. She dreams of expanding and starting another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 Mbodze wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks, sweets, cigarettes, etc. in bulk to add to her inventory

loans.name: Sabineh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sabineh” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000.00 each to invest in their businesses. 

Agnes is the leader of this group. She is 30 years old and married with five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school. Agnes sells a variety of items – bars of soap, body creams, toothpastes, etc. She has been in the business for many years. With the help of this loan, Agnes will invest in expanding her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy soaps, body creams, toothpastes, etc. in bulk to add to her inventory

loans.name: Zinunula Omunaku Women's Group

texts.en: Teddy, runs her 20-year-old food sales business at a stall in Kayunga food market. The mother of four, she also does some farming. Most of the foods she sells are harvested from her own garden. She sells mostly bananas and cassavas. Weekly she says her sales revenue totals shillings 40,000. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase additional bananas and cassavas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and cassavas to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of four who started baking "saj" (a flat bread popular in the Levant) in 2001 in order to help her husband with their family's expenses. She intends to expand her business, which is why she has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva Partner to buy another Saj-Convex metal griddle necessary to bake saj bread and also flour and gas.This is fatima's fifth cycle with Al Majmoua, she's a perfect paying-back borrower and all her previous loans reflected positively on her situation. She hopes to keep expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new metal griddle, gas and flour necessary for her saj-baking business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes wholesale to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lapper, handbags, and eggs to offer for sale

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson has operated a bicycle garage business for the past five years. His customers are his neighbors and passers-by. His primary business challenge is seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing another garage in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase equipment for use in his garage.

Anderson and his wife have one small child who is too young yet to attend school. Anderson owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for use in his bicycle garage

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Nelson es casado desde hace 5 años con la señora Obdulia es una familia muy humilde que tienen dos hijas Janeth de 3 años y Elizabet De 7 años, el esposo se dedica al servicio de instalaciones eléctricas domiciliarias el trabajo este no es constante y muy escasos su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica cama afuera ellos viven en la casa de su madre del señor R. ubicado en la zona de el Plan 3000 que se encuentra a 15 minutos de la ciudad 

El préstamo que solicitan es porque  necesitan para poner un centro para hacer trabajos y sacar fotocopias ya que donde ellos viven esta cerca de un colegio y quieren mejorar un poco sus ingresos ya que su esposo no tiene un trabajo constante y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson has been married to Obdulia for five years. They are a humble family and have two daughters – Janeth (3) and Elizabet (7). Nelson works in home electrical installation but his work isn’t constant and is scarce. His wife works as a live-out housekeeper and they live at Mr. R.’ mother’s house located in the Plan 3000 area, 15 minutes from the city.

The loan requested is because they need to set up a center for doing assignments and making photocopies, as they live near a school and want to improve their income since Nelson does not have a constant job. Thus way, they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to have the working capital to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Dukundubuhinzi 3 A Group

texts.fr: Joël est agri-éleveur de  né  au Rwanda.et il est membre du groupe DUKUNDUBUHINZI 3A. Il est marié, il  a 30 ans, il a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 7 ans et deux enfants vont à l’école, et il n’a aucunes personnes en charge. Il  a six  ans des études primaires. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour  acheter des sacs, payer les travailleurs qui vont faire la récolte du riz. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir les champs du riz pour avoir une grande quantité de la récolte. Sa vision est d’augmenté des activités de la récolte du riz pour conquérir le marché et d’augmenter son clientèle. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval pour ses enfants et le faire soigner
texts.en: Joël is a farmer born in Rwanda. He is a member of the Dukundubuhinzi 3A group. He is 30 years old, married, with three children from two to seven years of age, and no other dependents. He has finished six years of primary school. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. [He] is going to use his loan to buy bags and pay workers harvesting rice. He does not except any difficulty in repay his loan. His business strategy is to enlarge his rice field in order to have a bigger harvest. He would like to harvest more rice to have a good position on the market and increase the number of his customers. As to his family, he would like to be able to pay  his children's school fees and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy bags for rice harvesting and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, and pepper.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice and other cooking ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en:
Mere is a 58-year-old married woman and mother of three children living and working in Qana, South Lebanon. She has been baking saj bread (a type of flatbread baked on a domed or convex metal griddle) for many years in order to improve her family's poor financial situation and cover some of their expenses. Mere has been an Al Majmoua borrower for six loan cycles. She is a good standing borrower and all her previous loans have greatly helped in increasing and expanding her business and in improving her family's situation.

Saj bread is much requested by most villagers, tourists and friends and Mere hopes to stay active and capable of meeting her customer's needs. All she asks for is to stay healthy and to open a larger bakery for her children, in order to expand her business more in the future.

loans.use: To buy saj flour and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Magaaju Twimukye Women's Group

texts.en: Forty-six-year-old Alice has been engaged in the farming business for over 20 years in Ntungamo, Western Uganda. Alice is happily married with 4 children. She is able to make a weekly profit of 30,000 UGX. She plans to use this loan to purchase young goats that she will eventually resell.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El señor Nicolas C. Castellón es casado con la señora Justina Corrales Mejía más de 13 años, tienen 5 hijos dependientes de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel primaria y secundaria, la familia vive en la comunidad de 2da Candelaria hace 18 años atrás, se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papaliza, como también cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 1 lechera y 4 de engorde.                                                                                                                                           
El señor Nicolas y su familia son de bajos recursos económicos que a veces apenas cubre los gastos para el estudio de sus hijos, por esta razón se apersonaron a solicitar un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) mas 2 cabezas de ganado vacuno (yunta), ya que ellos necesitan la yunta para utilizar en las faenas agrícolas y tener en cualquier momento que el necesite arar o cultivar en el terreno, por que acudir a otros bancos de la ciudad les queda muy lejos, de este modo el señor Nicolas se siente feliz de tener la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito en el momento que más necesitaba.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Finalmente el señor Nicolas nos comenta, con todo esto tendrá mejor calidad de vida y luchar siempre para salir adelante económicamente hacia el futuro.
texts.en:
Nicolas has been married to Justina for more than 13 years, and they have 5 dependent children of different ages who study in primary and secondary school. The family has lived in the community of Segunda Candelaria for 18 years. They grow potatoes, broad beans, okra, and red potatoes, and they also have cattle -- 1 milk cow and 4 other cattle being fattened.

Nicolas and his family have limited economic resources and at times, can barely cover the costs of educating their children. For that reason, they are soliciting a loan to buy organic hen droppings, plus 2 head (a yoke) of cattle. They need the yoke of cattle to prepare the fields for planting and to be available when needed for plowing. Other banks in the city would be too far for them to go. 

Nicolas is very content to have this opportunity for access to a loan at a time when it is most needed. Finally, he says that with the loan, he will have a better quality of life and can continue in the future to struggle to get ahead economically.

loans.use: buy organic manure and other crop supplies.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina tiene  31 años de edad y vive en una casa de propiedad de su hermana vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio Morros Blancos de la ciudad de Tarija. Martina es madre soltera de tres hijos, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Martina se dedica desde hace mas de 4 años a trabajar como envasadora de medicamentos naturales productos que los venden a nivel nacional. Medicamentos que son muy consumidos por las personas que conocen el producto. Siendo muy conocida por sus clientes que le solicitan los medicamentos por ser estos preparados de forma natural,  Martina quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con sus hijos, pero ella nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar estos medicamentos para poder revenderlos. Ya que tiene un pedido de medicamentos para varias personas, 

Martina tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro, ella solicito el crédito para abastecerse de sus productos, y poder cumplir con la gran demanda que tiene de este modo incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Martina nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Señora Martina is 31 years old and lives in her sister's house in the Morros Blancos neighborhood in the city of Tarija.   Because of life circumstances she is a single mother with three children and has to work to provide for her children.  For the past 4 years Martina has been packaging natural medicine products that are sold nationally.  These medicines are in high demand among the people that know the product because they are naturally prepared.  Martina wants to increase her income to get her family ahead.  She has to purchase the medicines first before she can sell them.   She has an order for several people.  Martina has a lot of experience in this job. 

Martina is requesting a loan to stock her products so she can meet the high demand, and thereby, increase her income.  She tells us that she wants to improve her living conditions and that the next loan that she requests will be used to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: purchase natural medicines to stock her business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, 2 of whom attend school while 4 have already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Nyamvula has operated a charcoal sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Her greatest challenge is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Nyamvula plans to use this KES 80,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane 24 A Group

texts.fr: Onesphore est agri-éleveur né  au Rwanda, et il est membre du groupe DUSHYIGIKIRANE 24A. Il est marié, il  a 36 ans, il a 3 enfants entre 3 ans et 9 ans, deux enfants vont à l’école, et il n’a aucunes personnes en charge. Il  a 8 ans des études primaires. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour  acheter du riz pour le revendre. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business il voudrait vendre en grande quantité du riz sur le prix élevé. Pour sa vision il voudrait acheter du riz en vue de maximiser le profit. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval pour ses enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en: Onesphore is a farmer-breeder who was born in Rwanda.  He is a member of the DUSHYIGIKIRANE 24A group.  He is married and 36 years old. He has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 9 and two children attend school.  He has no dependents.  He has had 8 years of primary schooling.  This is his first round of loans with ACB.  He will use the funds to buy rice for resale.  He does not expect any difficulty with repaying the loan.  His strategy for growing his business: he would like to sell large quantities of rice at a high price.  For his vision, he would like to buy rice to maximize profit.  For his family, he would like to pay his children’s school fees and to take care of them.

loans.use: to purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, fish, meat, and palm-oil in bulk in order to be able to cook larger quantities of rice dishes to offer for sale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated a farming business for the past two years, selling farm supplies from his shop. His customers are his neighbors and passers-by. Daniel faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and gaining more income in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase fertilizers for his farm supplies business. 

Daniel and his wife have two children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm supplies business

loans.name: Emmerencia

texts.en:
Emerencia, who was born in 1955, is a widow with eleven children, one of whom is younger than 15. She lives in a four room house with her children. Emerencia joined GHAPE in 2009 and received a loan of 50,000 XAF, which was successfully repaid. The only problem that Emerencia faces in life is that she has to singlehandedly take care of her children since her husband died. She hates thinking of the deaths of her father, husband and son. She struggles to see that she takes care of the children her husband left behind, paying tuition fees, feeding them and catering to their health.

Emerencia is requesting a loan to purchase Irish potatoes. She plans to buy five bags of potatoes at 23,000 XAF each and she will use 20,000 XAF from her savings to pay for the transportation of her goods to the Belo weekly market. She believes her business will succeed because there is a ready market and her prices are moderate, which would encourage customers. Any profits made would be used to pay tuition fees for her children. Emerencia prefers a loan from GHAPE because a lower interest is charged and repayment is gradual.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Esilia

texts.en:
Esilia, who was born in 1968, is married and has six children. She lives in a two room house in Elimighong, in the Belo subdivision. She joined GHAPE in 2009 and was given a loan of 50,000 XAF, which she repaid successfully. Life has not been easy for Esilia in the past as she was unble to provide for her family, especially when her husband had an accident. GHAPE has therefore revived her from this bondage. With the profits earned from her first loan, she has paid her children's school fees.

Esilia is now requesting a second loan which she plans to use to buy ingredients for puff puff (doughnuts), Irish potatoes and kerosene. The population of her area provides a ready market and she is experienced in the field. With any profits earned from this loan, Esilia intends to pay fees and purchase a pot. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because repayment is gradual and a lower interest rate is charged.        

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, flour, Irish potatoes and kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Mourtalha Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Mourtalha est créé depuis le 12 mai 2011; il est composé de 15 femmes issues du même quartier, elles mènent comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou la responsable est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants en charge dont un neveu. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou avec fleurettes couverte d'un châle noir et affiche un grand sourire.

Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de tissus, d'ustensiles de cuisine, d'arachide et de haricots. Elle a une bonne expérience de quatre ans dans ce domaine.Elle s'approvisionne dans les villes et la capitale pour les tissus et ustensiles de cuisine pendant la saison où elle ne trouve pas assez de produits alimentaires; et pour l'arachide et les haricots dans le marché hebdomadaire et revend sur place dans le village.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite renforcer son activité pour gagner plus de revenus.

Elle participe aux dépenses familiales pour soutenir son mari et souhaite avec ses bénéfices constituer une bonne épargne pour obtenir un crédit élevé et se rendre à l'étranger pour acheter des marchandises.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Mourtalha solidarity group was set up on 12th May 2011 and is made up of 15 women who come from the same neighborhood; their principal activity is small-scale trading.

Fatou, who is in charge of the group, is 38 years old, married and mother to four children who are in her care, one of whom is her nephew. She is standing on the right of the photo wearing a boubou (a West African flowing dress) with florets covered with a black shawl, and a big smile. 

She has a small trading business selling fabric, kitchen utensils, groundnut and beans. She has four years' experience in this field. She gets her supplies of fabric and kitchen utensils in various towns and the capital city during the season when she cannot find sufficient food products; she buys her stocks of groundnut and beans in the weekly market and sells them locally in the village.

With her loan she would like to strengthen her business in order to make more money.

She contributes to the household expenses, thereby helping out her husband, and she would like to build up a good level of savings with her profits in order to get a big loan and go abroad to buy her goods.

loans.use: to buy fabric and kitchen utensils to sell on

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is a 52-year-old farmer from village Maghlaki, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Maya, their 24-year-old son and 23-year-old daughter. 

The only source of income for the family comes from their agricultural business, where all family members are involved. They have two milk cows, produce cheese and sell it to local retailers. They also have a greenhouse where tomatoes (in the summer period) and greens (in winter) are grown. Amiran sells tomatoes and greens to vegetables exporters. Along with the above-mentioned they have a plot of the land where greens and watermelons are grown. They sell watermelons to local retailers. 

Amiran requested credit for construction of another greenhouse. Demand on the market will allow him to sell more greens and vegetables and almost double the income of the family. 50% of the increased profit will be reinvested in agriculture and the rest will be used for covering household costs – purchase of furniture and renovation work.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Terimberemuhinzi No 30 Group

texts.fr: Aloys  est agri-éleveur  né  au Rwanda.et il est membre du groupe TERIMBEREMUHINZI NO 30. Il est marié, il  a 33 ans, il a 4 enfants entre 1 an et 9 ans et deux enfants vont à l’école, et il n’a aucunes personnes en charge. Il  a six  ans des études primaires. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour  acheter les engrais chimiquer pour felitiriser son champs et payer la main d'oeuvre.Il n’a aucun difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt.sa stratégie pour la croissance de son affaires est d'améliorer la qualité du riz  récolté. Sa vision c’est pour développer son business, et avoir l’intérêt plus élevé. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval pour ses enfants et le faire soigner.
texts.en: Aloys is a farmer-breeder who was born in Rwanda.  He is a member of the TERIMBEREMUHINZI NO 30 group.  He is married and 33 years old. He has 4 children between the ages of 1 and 9. Two children attend school.  He has no dependents.  He has had 6 years of primary education.  This is his first round of loans with ACB.    He will use the funds to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize his fields and pay laborers.  He does not expect to have any difficulty repaying the loan. His strategy for business growth is to avoid selling rice at a low price compared to the harvest.  His vision is to grow his business and to have the highest interest. For his family, he would like to pay the school fees of his children and to take care of them.

loans.use: achater les engrais chimiques  et payer la main d'oeuvre

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bok Jom est créé le 12 mai 2011; il est composé de quatorze braves femmes qui sont parentes, amies et issues du même quartier et qui ont comme lien commun le petit commerce.

Madame Ngoré la responsable est âgée de 58 ans, elle est veuve et mère de six enfants mais a en charge six autres neveux et cousins. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo est habillée en robe orange et adossée au mur.

Elle gère une boutique de tissus et produits cosmétiques depuis plus de trois ans; elle s’approvisionne dans la capitale et revend à dans son village.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter beaucoup de produits pour remplir sa boutique afin de satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle mais aussi de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle aide son frère avec qui elle vit dans la prise en charge scolaire, sanitaire et vestimentaire des enfants.Elle souhaite également augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Bok Jom cooperative group was created on May 12, 2011.  It is made up of fourteen good women who are relatives, friends, and neighbors from the same neighborhood and who all run small businesses.

Madame Ngoré, the group’s leader, is a 58-year-old widow with six children who also cares for six other nephews and cousins.  She is standing on the right in the photo, dressed in an orange dress and leaning against the wall.  

She has managed a fabric and cosmetics store for over three years; she buys her products in the capital and resells them in her village.  Her loan will allow her to buy a large amount of products to fill her store, in order to satisfy her customers and increase her income.  Madame Ngoré lives with her brother and helps him with his children’s school fees, clothes, and healthcare.  She would also like to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cosmetic products for sale.

loans.name: Nasibu

texts.en:
Nasibu is married to a businesswoman and they live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 2 years, Nasibu has operated a video shop business, with neighbors and passersby as his potential customers. He has faced a major challenge of theft in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Nasibu plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase a plasma television for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a plasma television for his business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard es un joven que vive en el municipio de Colcaphirua del departamento de Cochabamba, él trabaja como albañil junto a su padre, el hace un año estaba conviviendo y tiene una hijita, pero como el no ganaba mucho como albañil su pareja lo dejo llevándose consigo a su hijita,

Richard siempre a buscado el tratar de superarse por tal motivo  aprendió a confeccionar pantalones y logro comprarse una máquina de coser pero aún le faltan dos, el necesita ese crédito para poderse comprar las máquinas y tener mejores ingresos para poder ofrecerles una mejor vida a su hijita y  pareja,  y así  pedirle que regresen a vivir con él, porque las extraña mucho.
texts.en:
Richard is a young man who lives in the Colcaphirua municipality in the Cochabamba department.  He works with his father as a bricklayer.  He lived with his life partner a year ago, and he has a little daughter.  However, as he did not earn much as a bricklayer, his life partner left and took his daughter with her.

Richard has always looked for a way to prevail.  That is why he learned how to make pants, and he managed to buy a sewing machine.  However, he still needs two.  He needs the loan to be able to buy the machines and to have better income.  Then he will be able to provide a better life for his daughter and life partner.  That way he will ask them to come back and live with him because he misses them so much.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, born in 1956, is married to Mr Rumanus and they are blessed with two children. They live in a two-room house in the Elemighong Quarter of Belo Subdivision, Northwest Region of Cameroon. Since her husband fell ill, life has not been the same; Mercy finds it difficult to care for her children with no one to assist her. Her husband can’t do anything because of his illness. 

Mercy became a GHAPE member in 2009, and a loan of 50,000 XAF was lent to her. She proved to be very serious due to the fact that she repaid her first loan without any problems.

Mercy now requests her second loan to continue with her buy-and-sell trade. She plans to buy Irish potatoes for 37,000 XAF, rice for 21,000 XAF, garri for 11,000 XAF and a goat for 21,000 XAF. She plans to fatten and resell the goat. A ready market would enhance a smooth running of her business. The profit she would get would be used to pay tuition fees for her children, enlarge her house and provide food and medication for the family.    

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, rice, garri and a goat for resale

loans.name: Beug Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Beug Diam est créé depuis le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de six femmes qui habitent la même concession.

Faty la responsable est mariée mère de six enfants, elle a en charge trois petits enfants. Elle est à droite sur la photo est habillée en rose avec un châle blanc sur les épaules.

Elle mène une activité agricole pendant la saison des pluies et fait en même temps de l'embouche bovine et ovine depuis un an. Elle a une expérience d'un an mais s'en sort avec succès.

Elle s'approvisionne dans le marché hebdomadaire du village et les villages                                    environnants en moutons chèvres et bœufs, elle revend après 3 ou 6 mois d'embouche.   

Elle compte avec son prêt augmenter son cheptel et acheter un stock d'aliments de bétail.

Faty aide son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales pour la nourriture, habillement et santé des enfants; elle souhaite augmenter son épargne avec les bénéfices obtenus.
texts.en:
The Beug Diam solidarity group was set up on 12th May 2010 and is made up of six women who live in the same compound.

Faty, who is responsible for the group, is married and mother to six children; she also has three grandchildren in her care. She is on the right of the photo and dressed in pink with a white shawl on her shoulders.

She has a farming activity during the rainy season and at the same time has been fattening both cattle and sheep for the past year. She has only a year's experience but has been successful.

She gets her supplies of sheep, goats and oxen at the village's weekly market and in surrounding villages. She resells them after three to six months of fattening.

With her loan she is planning to increase her livestock and buy a stock of food for them.

Faty helps her husband to cover the household's running costs for the children's food, clothes and health; she would like to boost her savings with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and then sell

loans.name: Koutediomboulo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui habitent la même localité. Leurs différentes activités sont la vente d'huile de palme, de crevettes et de légumes.

Madame Khady qui est à droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a en charge cinq autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s'active dans la vente de crevettes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité, car elle l'a pratiqué depuis plus de dix ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son capital pour répondre à la demande de ses clients.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: The borrowing group was created on October 19, 2001.  It consists of 7 women who live in the same area.  Their different businesses include the sale of palm oil, shrimp, and vegetables.  Mrs. Khady, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the head of the group.  She is married and mother of one child.  She supports five other children entrusted to her by their parents. She is in the business of selling shrimp.  She has solid experience in this activity because she has been doing it for over 10 years.  This loan will allow her to increase her capital and meet the demand of her customers.  The profits will enable her to contribute to the payment of her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy shrimp.

loans.name: Duteraninkunga Rsz Group

texts.fr: Etienne est commerçant naquit au Rwanda, et il est membre du groupe solidaire DUTERANINKUNGA. Il est mariée, il a 33 ans, il a cinq enfants entre 8 ans et 16 ans tous vont à l’école, et il n’a aucune personne en charge, il a 4 ans des études secondaires. C'est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Claudine va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les habits des enfants qu'elle vende pour accroitre son business dans le marché locale. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d'augmenter les heures de travail, de huit à dix heures. Sa vision, il voudrait acheter une moto qui va servir de déplacement pour atteindre son objectif ainsi que sa vision. Pour sa famille il va  payer le minerval pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Etienne is a small-scale merchant who was born in Rwanda and she is a member of the solidarity group DUTERANINKUNGA. He is married, 33 years old, and has five children between the ages of eight and 16. All go to school and he is not responsible for anyone else. He spent four years in secondary school. This is his first loan through ACB. He is going to use her loan to buy children's clothing to grow her business at the local market. 

There is no expectation that he might not reimburse her loan. His strategy for growing his business is to work every day selling clothing, and increase his working hours to work from 8am to 10pm. His dream is to buy a motorcycle to help her with his business. For his family, he plans to pay the semester fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and enlarge her little clothing business.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Gora, Imereti Region, in the western part of the country. He is 48 years old and a farmer, married and lives with his wife Bella, their 24-year-old son, 20-year-old daughter and his parents. Giorgi’s son works in a local private company as an electrician. Their daughter is temporarily unemployed and assists her parents in farming activities. Giorgi’s parents are retired. 

Giorgi and Bella lead the agricultural business in the family. They have one milk cow, whose milk is used for cheese production. The latter is sold to local dairy product retailers. Also they have a vineyard with 2000 grape vines. Approximately half of the harvested grapes are sold in the village and the other half is used for wine production. Produced wine is sold on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Giorgi’s house is old and needs renovation. He requested credit from Credo for purchasing materials for renovation – ceramic tiles for the floor and plaster bars for the walls. After the renovations, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
otatoes at 23,000 XAF each, three tins of beans at 7,500 XAF each and two tins of groundnuts at 7,000 XAF each. She knows that her business will succeed because she has so many customers and her marketplace is located on a good site. Her community will also benefit from this trade because she will bring goods nearer to them, thus reducing distance and time. She prefers GHAPE to other financial institutions in her area becaClementina was born in 1974. She is married to Mbribeh Peter and they are blessed with six children, four of whom are younger than 15. They all live in a three-room house in Elemighong Quarter in Belo Subdivision, NWR Cameroon. Faced with the problem of inadequate business capital made her start looking for a way to get a loan to increase her business capital. GHAPE was the place where her problem was solved. She became a GHAPE member in 2009, and got her first loan of 50,000 XAF, which she used in her buy-and-sell trade. This helped her a lot because the proceeds from her first loan was used to buy her kitchen utensils. She proved to be trustworthy because she repaid her loan with no problems.

Clementina is now requesting a second loan from GHAPE. She plans to continue in her buy-and-sell trade. She plans to buy three bags of Irish puse GHAPE asks for no collateral and their interest rate is low and encouraging. 

 
About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, beans and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline, a native from Elemighong Village in Belo Subdivision in the NW Region of Cameroon, was born in 1965. She is married to Komfuei Simon and they are blessed with four children, three of whom are younger than 15 years of age. They all live in a three-room house in the Anyajua Quarter in Belo Subdivision. 

Roseline faced the problem of inadequate business capital and borrowing from other financial institution was very expensive for her because she needed to provide collateral, something she could not provide. She got enrolled into GHAPE in 2009, and took her first loan of 50,000 XAF, which she has successfully repaid. 
 
Roseline is now requesting her second loan from GHAPE. She needs this second loan because she wants to expand in her buy-and-sell trade. She plans to buy three bags of Irish potatoes at 23,000 XAF per bag, two tins of palm oil at 13,000 XAF each and two bags of flour at 10,000 XAF per bag. She believes that the business will be a success since she is always punctual, as well as being very good to her customers. She is helping the community by employing people to transport her goods to the market. She will use the proceeds from the loan to care for her family.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and flour for resale

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta es una mujer emprendedora de 44 años de edad. Ella vive con su esposo y 4 hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

Alberta se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas en toda la avenida principal del mercado central de la localidad de Tambogrande. Posee un buen número de clientes y cuenta con buenas referencias personales.

Alberta solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar ingredientes para la preparación de su comida, así como para la compra de mercadería que ayude a mejorar el desarrollo de su negocio. Además, ella desea realizar mejoras en el local para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y obtener mayores ganancias.

Alberta tiene su puesto en el mercado desde hace más de 20 años, ella desea mejorar la atención a sus clientes y ofrecerles mayor variedad de opciones.
texts.en:
Alberta is an enterprising woman who is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children in the district of Tambogrande - Piura.

Alberta sells food and drinks in the town of Tambogrande along the main avenue of the central market. She has a good number of customers and has good personal references.

Alberta is asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy ingredients to prepare her food and also to buy merchandise that will help to improve the development of her business. Besides, she wants to make improvements to her location to be able to offer a better service and to earn M. money.

Alberta has had her place in the market for M. than 20 years. She wants to improve the attention she gives to her customers and offer them a better variety of options.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise.

loans.name: Itabaza  Rsz Group

texts.fr: Chantal est commerçante naquit au Rwanda.et elle est membre du groupe solidaire ITABAZA. Elle est mariée, elle a 30 ans, elle a un  enfant de 4 ans et va à l’école, et elle a deux personnes en charge .elle a 3 ans des études secondaire. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour  acheter  les poissons pour les revendre dans le marche locale,. Il n’a aucun difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt.sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business elle voudrait augmenter la quantité des poissons à vendre. Sa vision c’est pour développer son business, sa famille et éduquer son enfant et le faire soigner.
texts.en:
Chantal is a small-scale merchant born in Rwanda and she is a member of the solidarity group ITABAZA. At 30, she is married and she has a child four years old who attends school. She is also responsible for two other people. 

Chantal went to secondary school for three years. This is her first loan with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy fish to resell at the local market. There is no expectation that her loan will not be reimbursed. Her strategy for growing her business is to increase the quantity of fish she has to sell. Her dream is to develop her business, her family, educate her child and have him taken care of.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell at the local market.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene  42 años de edad y es padre de un niño de 9 años. Segundo cuenta con su propio domicilio ubicado en una comunidad rural y humilde del distrito de Olmos- Lambayeque.

Segundo se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público. Él cuenta con una mototaxi, que es una moto con una cabina en la parte posterior donde se pueden transportar pasajeros. Segundo brinda el servicio de mototaxi desde hace 3 años en su comunidad y alrededores, él cuenta con clientes fijos.

Segundo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que destinará en el mantenimiento de su moto, así como mejoras en su vivienda. 

Las mejoras en la moto de Segundo, le permitirán seguir brindando un buen servicio y por lo tanto obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Segundo is 42 years old and is the father of a 9 year old boy. Segundo has his own home located in a rural and humble community of the district of Olmos- Lambayeque.

Segundo offers public transportation services. He has a motorrickshaw, which is a motorcycle with a cabin in the back part where passengers can be transported. Segundo has offered the motorrickshaw service for 3 years in his community and the surrounding areas. He counts on his steady customers.

Segundo is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he will use to maintain his motorcycle as well as make improvements to his home.

The improvements on Segundo's motorcycle will permit him to continue offering a good service. Therefore, he will earn more to improve the quality of his life. He would be very thankful for considering him for the loan because it would be a great help to him.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle and to improve his housing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and other ingredients with which she uses to cook.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas was born in 1961 and is a widow. Her husband died, leaving her with five children of whom she takes care. She and her children live in a two-room house in the Elemighong Quarter in Belo Subdivision of Cameroon. The death of her husband has been a major setback to her and her children because it became very difficult for her to singlehandedly take care of them. 

She thought of doing business that could raise money to care for her children. There was a big problem because she could not raise the business capital. The introduction of GHAPE in her community became a solution to her problem. She became a GHAPE member in 2010. She took her first loan of 50,000 XAF and started buying and selling Irish potatoes. She was very successful because she was able repay the loan without any problems and could also pay tuition fees for her children. 

She is now requesting her second loan to continue in the same business. She plans to buy five bags of Irish potatoes at 23,000 XAF each. She will use 10,000 XAF from her past savings to pay for the transportation of her goods to the weekly Belo market. She knows her business will succeed because she has so many customers. She says her community will benefit from her trade because they will be able to have Irish potatoes from her stock at very cheap prices.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for retail

loans.name: Elvis Deibys

texts.es:
Elvis es un joven trabajador y pujante de 23 años de edad que vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Chepén – La Libertad.

Elvis se dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería en un puesto ubicado frente a uno de los mercados más concurridos de su comunidad. Él tiene este negocio desde hace 4 años y las ganancias obtenidas le permiten darle comodidades a su familia. Es por ello que Elvis desea invertir en su actividad.

Elvis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles, para comprar mercadería que su puesto necesita y que sus clientes requieren. Además utilizará otra parte del préstamo para usos personales.

Elvis solo ha trabajado con nuestra institución y cuenta con un excelente récord de pagos. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito.
texts.en:
Elvis is a hardworking and vigorous young man. He is 23 years old, and lives with his parents in a developing community in the district of Chepén, La Libertad. 

Elvis sells hardware in a stand located in one of the busiest markets in his community. He has had this business for 4 years, and the income he earns permit his to provide comforts to his family. Because of this, Elvis wants to invest in his business.

Elvis requests this loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise that his clients need. Additionally, he will use part of the loan for personal uses.  

Elvis has only worked with this institution and has an excellent repayment record. He is very thankful to be granted this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and personal goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace,  born in 1961, is married to Mr. Peter  and they are blessed with seven children, two of whom are below the age of fifteen years. They live in a a two-room apartment in the Elemighong quarter in Belo Sub Division of Cameroon. The quest for business capital and friends encouraged her to join GHAPE. She became a GHAPE member in 2009. In early 2010 she took her first loan of 50,000 F CFA from GHAPE. She used this loan in her little business, and this helped her a lot because she was able to buy a pot from the proceeds she got from the loan. She was also able to repay this loan without any problem.

She is now requesting her second loan. She plans to continue with her same line of business. She plans to buy dried fish for 65,000 F CFA, gari for 30,000 F CFA, and 20,000 F CFA will be used for the purchase of a goat for fattening and resale. She knows this business will succeed because she has been doing this trade for a very long period and she also has many customers who will buy from her. This will help her community in that they will be able to have goods at their doorstep. She decided to obtain a loan from GHAPE because their interest rates are very low and the way of repaying the loan is bit by bit, thus very easy. She also says she will use the proceeds to buy more kitchen utensils and also pay tuition fees for her children. 

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.
