loans.use: to buy fish, gari (manioc grits) and a goat to raise for sale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su novia y sus dos menores hijos en la comunidad rural de Mórrope  en Lambayeque. Este lugar se caracteriza por ser zona de agrícolas y ganaderos.

Carlos se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores contando con 15 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientela fija, él actualmente posee  un ganado ovino que cría en un corral ubicado en la parte trasera de su casa.

Carlos solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado, así como, en la compra de más animales para ampliar su producción. Además, Carlos utilizará parte del préstamo en la compra de abarrotes para habilitar su nuevo negocio de venta de comestibles.

Carlos es un hombre emprendedor, con muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, goza de buenas referencias personales y ya ha trabajado con nuestra institución. Tiene un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old, and lives with his girlfriend and his two young children in the rural community of Mórrope en Lambayeque. This is an area known for agriculture and livestock.

Carlos raises and sells young animals, and he has 15 years of experience in this business with a fixed clientele. At present, he has a sheep that he cares for in a pen located behind his house.

Carlos requests a loan for 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will be used to buy animal feed and more animals to increase his production. Also, Carlos will use part of the loan to buy groceries to stock his new business, which will sell food products. 

Carlos is an enterprising man, with a desire to improve his quality of life. He has good personal references and has already worked with the institution. He has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, animals, and groceries for his business

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva tiene 41 años de edad y es madre de familia de tres niños, ella vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad pequeña y rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. Primitiva es conocida por ser una mujer alegre y trabajadora, dedicada a su familia.

Primitiva se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino desde hace 5 años.  Ella cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos en las afueras de su hogar. Primitiva tiene clientes fijos y vende sus animales a los pobladores de su zona, principalmente. También se dedica a la agricultura, pues ha heredado terreno agrícola en el cual tiene limón en producción y lo cosecha semanalmente.

Primitiva solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado y hacer una adecuada fertilización de sus cultivos. Estas actividades le permitirán a Primitiva, progresar en sus negocios y tener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 41 years old, and has three children. She lives with her husband in a small, rural community in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. Primitiva is known for being a happy and hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family.

Primitiva has raised sheep for 5 years. She has appropriate and spacious pens behind her house. Primitiva has fixed clients and sells her animals mostly to people in her area. She also works in agriculture, using inherited land on which she grows lemons, which she sows twice a year.

Primitiva requests a loan for 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animal feed and adequate fertilization for her crops. These activities permit Primitiva to go forward in her business and to have a higher income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre casado, con dos hijos y tiene 63 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su familia, en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, en uno de los caseríos de este lugar. La comunidad de Luis, se caracteriza por ser una zona de agrícolas y ganaderos. Esta comunidad rural se encuentra a 40 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura. Cuenta con terreno agrícola donde cultiva limón y ají semanalmente. Además Luis tiene un ganado ovino, el cual cría para luego comercializarlo en el mercado de su localidad. Su esposa también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, aves de corral, las cuales comercializa junto a su esposo en el mercado. Existe una buena relación familiar lo que permite que ambos negocios se desarrollen adecuadamente.

Luis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes especiales para su cultivo de limón y ají que le permitirán tener una mejor producción que venderá a mejores precios. Además destinará parte del préstamo en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado y las aves de corral de su esposa. 

Luis es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad. Su primer crédito fue Kiva y lo canceló puntualmente. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele este préstamo pues le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Luis is 63 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in his own home together with his family, in a small village, in Tambogrande district, Piura.   Luis' community is noted as being an area where people farm and raise livestock.  This rural community is 40 minutes from Tambogrande district.

Luis is a farmer.  He owns farm land where he grows lemons and chilis weekly.  Luis also has a flock of sheep which he raises and then sells in the market in his village.  Luis' wife raises animals (poultry) which she sells alongside her husband in the market.  They have a good family relationship which allows both businesses to develop adequately.

Luis is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy special fertilizers for his lemon and chili crops.  This will enable him to grow better crops that he will be able to sell for better prices.  In addition, he will use some of the loan money to buy balanced feed for his flock of sheep and his wife's birds.

Luis is an existing client of our organization.  His first loan was from Kiva and he repaid it on time.  He would be very grateful to receive this loan

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and balanced feed

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy  was born in 1975, got married to Mr. Timti Emmanuel, and is blessed with eight children, five of whom are  below the age of 15. They all occupy a five-room apartment  in Elemighong quarter in Belo sub Division of Cameroon. The search for business capital encouraged her to became a GHAPE member in  2010. This same year she obtained her first loan of 50,000 F CFA which she repaid with no difficulties.

Mercy is now requesting a second loan from GHAPE. She plans to invest this loan in her needing workshop and also in buying and selling Irish potatoes. She plans to buy needing thread for 20,000 F CFA and 80,000 F CFA will be used for the purchase of Irish potatoes. She knows her business will succeed because she has been doing this trade for a very long time now and her community will serve as a ready market for her goods. She prefers to obtain a loan from GHAPE because their interest rate is low and encouraging and also GHAPE provides her with training on how to manage her business.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy thread and Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer trabajadora de 32 años de edad. Vive con sus 4 hijos y esposo en una comunidad rural, pequeña y humilde perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope en Lambayeque.

Maribel desea darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos y es por ello que se esfuerza en el desempeño de sus labores para obtener mayores ganancias. Ella se dedica a la crianza  y venta de animales, actualmente cuenta con un ganado porcino el cual cría  en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su casa.Maribel tiene una gran experiencia en este rubro y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su esposo también goza de buenas referencias y se dedica a la compra y venta  de menestras.

Maribel ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de animales y sus respectivos alimentos, así coma para el negocio de su esposo.

El primer crédito de Maribel fue KIVA y cumplió adecuadamente con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking woman, who is 32 years old. She lives with her 4 children and husband in a small, rural, and humble community in the district of Mórrope in Lambayeque. 

Maribel wants to give a good quality of life to her children. Because of this, she works hard in her business to earn a higher income. She raises and sells animals. At present, she has a pig, which she cares for in pens located outside her house. Maribel has a lot of experience in this field, and has good personal and work references. Her husband also has good reference, and he buys and sells vegetable stews.

Maribel has requested a loan for 2500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the purchase of animals and animal feed, and for her husband’s business. Maribel’s first loan was on Kiva, and she complied with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Maria Exaltaciona

texts.es:
María,  tiene 21  años de edad, es una mujer casada y tiene 2  hijos que dependen de ella y su esposo. Esta familia vive  en una comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo ubicada a 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope – Lambayeque.

María tiene gran experiencia en la actividad que realiza. Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos), contando con clientela establecida que son los pobladores de su comunidad y alrededores. María cuenta con corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio donde puede realizar con comodidad esta actividad.

María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles  para comprar pavos y alimento balanceado para estos. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y por ende sus ganancias.  María y su esposo tienen muchos deseos de superación y es por ello que este crédito le sería de gran utilidad.

María es una clienta antigua de nuestra institución y goza de un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
María is 21 years old, is married, and has 2 children who depend on her and her husband. This family lives in a developing rural community located 15 minutes from the district of Mórrope, Lambayeque. 

María has a lot of experience in raising and selling turkeys. She has an established clientele among the people in her community. María has pens located behind her house, where she can pursue this activity comfortably. 

María requests a loan for 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy turkeys and animal feed. This will permit her to increase her production and her earnings. María and her husband have a desire to improve their lives and this loan will be very useful.

María is and old client of the institution, and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy turkeys and animal feed

loans.name: Forctina

texts.en:
Forctina, a single mother of five children, four of whom are below the age of 15, was born on June 18, 1977. The family lives in a six-room apartment at the Elemighong quarter in the Belo Subdivision of Cameroon. Foctina's greatest problems were that she did not attain a primary school education and that she needed business capital to take care of her children. The search for business capital was addressed by the encouragement to join the GHAPE program by women who were already GHAPE members in her community. A member since 2009, Forctina took her first loan of 50,000FCFA to buy Irish potatoes to sell. She says sales were very lucrative, enabling her to repay the loan with no problem and also pay her children's tuition fees.

Forctina is now requesting her second loan from GHAPE to buy five bags of potatoes for 23,000FCFA per bag; she will use 10,000FCFA from her savings to pay for the transportation of her products to the Belo weekly market. She is confident of business success due to her many customers who are grateful to have the potatoes at their doorsteps for very reasonable prices. Forctina appreciates working with GHAPE because of their low interest rates and very manageable repayment methods.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust with its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness  was born in 1966; she is married to Mr.Vincent  and is blessed with five children. She shares three rooms with her five children in Elemighong, a quarter in Belo Sub Division, North West Region of Cameroon.

Happiness has faced difficulties in her life ranging from inability to meet her daily needs, the inability of her husband to get a job for himself nor carry out any activity that could raise income due to accident, the inability of her first son to continue his education due to poverty and the increasing demands from her children. Amongst other challenges, she also has had difficulties with inadequate capital to expand her business. 

With this loan, she plans to buy more foodstuffs like Irish potatoes and castle  oil (a locally made oil used for the treatment of some skin diseases and also used as food)  for sale. She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly thus has many customers. Her activity will help her community in reducing cost of transportation to buy foodstuffs at the market and their cordial relationship will give room for negotiation to pay later.

She will use a fraction of her profit to assist her husband, provide for the children’s school needs, meeting her personal needs and those of her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy castle oil and Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Esperanza Violeta

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 59 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos y clientes. Ella vive en una comunidad rural  perteneciente al distrito de Chepén- La Libertad. La condición de vida de Esperanza es buena.

Desde hace 7 años Esperanza se dedica a la venta de verduras al por menor en una zona de comerciantes ambulatorios de su dsitrtito. Esperanza cuenta con clientes establecidos, que la prefieren por el buen servicio y la amabilidad que ella brinda. 

Ella desea invertir en su negocio para adquirir algunas comodidades. Es por eso que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar verduras y así surtir su negocio. Además, desea hacer algunos arreglos en su vivienda y adquirir otros bienes.

Esperanza es una clienta antigua para Edpyme Alternativa, gracias a nuestra entidad su negocio ha prosperado y es por eso que Esperanza se siente muy agradecida y contenta con nuestros financiamientos. Esperanza ha cancelado adecuadamente sus pagos.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 59 years old, and is a hardworking woman who has good personal and work references from her neighbors and clients. She lives in a rural community in the district of Chepén, La Libertad. Esperanza’s condition of life is good.

For 7 years, Esperanza has sold vegetables in small quantities in the busy commercial area in her district. Esperanza has established clients who appreciate her good service and kindness. 

She wants to invest in her business to acquire assets. Because of this, she requests a loan for 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy vegetables and, in this way, grow her business. Also, she wants to make some repairs to her house and buy other goods.

Esperanza is an old client of Edpyme Alternativa, and thanks to the institution’s support, her business has prospered. Because of this, Esperanza is very thankful and happy with the loans. Esperanza has promptly repaid her loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, grow her business, and repair her house

loans.name: Belta

texts.en:
Belta was born in 1968; she is married to Mr. Phillip  and is the mother of seven children all above the age of 15. They are living at Elemighong, a quarter in Belo Sub Division, North West Region of Cameroon.

Belta has faced major challenges in her life especially sickness and poverty. The most difficult have been the problem of raising capital for her business and paying for her children’s education.  She plans to invest this loan in selling Irish potatoes and rearing goats. She will be able to raise a lot of profit from the business because it is highly demanded in her community. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time and so she has experience as far as the business is concerned, and she has successfully borrowed and repaid a loan one time already from GHAPE. This loan was invested in buying and selling Irish potatoes. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford Irish potatoes at a very low cost.

Belta will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's tuition fees, and save some for a rainy day. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back the loan.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and goats for resale.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is married to Mr. Shadrack and is the mother of two children both below the age of 15.  She shares one room with her children  She lives in Elemighong, one of the  quarters found in Belo Sub Division, North West Region, Cameroon.

Bridget has encountered a lot of difficulties in life, for example, difficulty in having three square meals a day. Ill health has also been one of her problems, She has been unable to have good medical treatment because she has no money. She joined GHAPE because she  had heard and seen a lot of people testify about GHAPE and she believes her life will not be the same if this loan is given to her . 

Bridget plans to buy a good quantity of castle oil(this is a medicinal oil used for the treatment of skin diseases and and also used as food). She is going to use the profit from the loan to increase her capital. Her community and family will benefit from the trade because she will provide them with castle oil at very low prices. Her activity will help reduce distance from members of her community and it will be available at all times. Bridget says “her children will all be well educated”.

She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, and also that GHAPE does not ask for collateral security, and the because of the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan. GHAPE takes care of the poor and repayment is gradual. 

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy castle oil for resale.

loans.name: Ngueyenne Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois a été inauguré le 31 mai 2011. Il est composé de 41 femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame GORY est présidente du Banc Villageois (elle assise sur une chaise à gauche de la photo levant la main). Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en charge un autre enfant qui lui est confié par son frère.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson frais et de beignets. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital afin de mieux développer son activité de vente de poisson.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This "Banc Villageois" was launched on May 31, 2011. It is made up of 41 women who live in the same village. Their main business is sales.

Madame Gory is president of the "Banc Villageois" (she is seated on the left, raising her hand). She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She also supports another child for her brother.

She does business selling fresh fish and beignets.

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital to expand her fish-selling business.

Her goal is to help with the improvement of her family's living conditions (health, diet, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and flour to make beignets.

loans.name: Maria Iraida

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 30  años de edad,  está casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Esta familia vive en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Mórrope- Lambayeque. La comunidad donde María  vive, es  una comunidad pequeña de gente emprendedora y trabajadora.    

La actividad que desarrolla María es la crianza y comercialización de animales, labor que realiza hace 4 años, teniendo experiencia otorgada por su madre con la cual inicio este negocio. Actualmente María cuenta con ganado porcino.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para  invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus cerdos y en la culminación de acabados en el interior de su domicilio, que le son de gran necesidad. María tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y este préstamo le sería muy útil. Ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra institución y  goza de un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Maria is a 30-year-old woman.  She’s married and has two school aged children.  This family lives in a marginal urban zone in Mórrope-Lambayeque District.  The community where Maria lives is a small community of enterprising, hard working people.

Maria raises small farm animals to sell, a job she’s been doing for four years, having gained experience from her mother who she started the business with.  Currently, Maria raises pigs.

She asks Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced pig feed and to finish doing some interior home improvements that are much needed.  Maria has a strong wish to improve her quality of life and this loan will be very useful for her.  She has worked with our institution previously and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 26 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo y sus dos menores hijos en una comunidad pequeña y rural ubicada a 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope –Lambayeque. Silvia es conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora y alegre, dedicada a sus hijos.

Silvia se dedica, desde hace 2 años,  a la venta de golosinas y fruta en un colegio de su localidad. Su negocio tiene gran demanda y gracias a ello, Silvia puede obtener ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. Adicionalmente, Silvia cría animales menores en su domicilio, que luego comercializa a los pobladores de su zona. 

Silvia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de frutas y golosinas para su negocio. Pues  desea ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Además parte del préstamo será destinado a adquirir bienes que beneficiarán a su familia.

Silvia ha tenido un primer crédito KIVA en nuestra entidad, y ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Silvia, 26, lives with her husband and two minor children in a small, rural community located 15 minutes from Mórrope-Lambayeque District.  Silvia is known for being a hard working, cheerful woman who is devoted to her children.

For the last two years she’s been selling snacks and fruit at a local school.  Her business is in high demand and thanks to this Silvia earns profits for her family’s wellbeing.  In addition, Silvia also raises small farm animals at home that she then sells to local residents.

Silvia is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy fruit and snacks for her business because she wants to have a wider variety of items available for her customers.  In addition, part of the loan will be used to buy assets that will benefit her family.

Silvia has had an initial Kiva loan through our firm and she showed responsibility with respect to her payments.

loans.use: to buy snacks and for personal use.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina Cheah, who was born in 1951, is married to Mr. Zachus Ashi and blessed with six children, all over the age of 15. They live in a 2-room apartment in the Tumuku quarter of the Belo subdivision in Cameroon. In 2009, hardship and tough times led Regina to become a member of GHAPE. She got her first loan of 50,000 XAF and embarked on the buying and selling of goats, earning enough to move on with life.

Regina is requesting her second loan in order to buy goats for 60,000 XAF, beans for 20,000 XAF and to pay workers on her farm 20,000 XAF. She knows she is going to succeed because she has been keeping goats for a long time and had been farming long before she got to GHAPE. Her trade is actually helping the community since she offers door-to-door service. Regina has faced challenges in life when her daughter had an accident and was hospitalized and when one of her son's hands was cut off. The profit from Regina's loan will be used to take care of her and her children's health and to invest in her agriculture. Regina prefers GHAPE because she can repay in bits.
  
About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing

loans.name: Veronika

texts.es:
Verónika  tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa de sus  padres desde hace  10 años, debido a su separación. La casa donde Verónika vive se encuentra en el distrito de Eten- Chiclayo. Esta es una comunidad en vías de desarrollo, integrada por gente emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación.

Verónika  posee una bodega de comestibles en su propio domicilio, su bodega cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes debido a la buena calidad de servicio que ella viene ofreciendo desde hace 3 años, además existe variedad en cuanto a los productos que su tienda posee. Verónika cuenta con clientela establecida a la que vende sus productos al crédito y al contado.

Ella desea invertir en su negocio pues este le trae grandes satisfacciones. Es por ello que Verónika aspira a ampliar su bodega y convertirla en la más surtida de su comunidad. Para cumplir sus objetivos Verónika ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de  2000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de abarrotes,  golosinas y bebidas que le permitirán surtir su negocio. Además comprará una refrigeradora para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Verónika is 30 years old and has lived with her parents for 10 years due to her separation from her husband.  The house where Verónika lives is in the Eten-Chiclayo district. This is a developing community, made up of enterprising people who have a great desire to succeed.

Verónika has a grocery store in her own home.  The grocery store has a large influx of customers due to the high quality of service she has offered for the last 3 years, and also the variety of products that her store stocks.  Verónika has an established clientele to whom she sells her products for credit and cash.

She wants to invest in her business as it brings her great satisfaction.  This is why Verónika aims to expand her grocery store, and make it the best stocked in her community.  To achieve her objectives, Verónika has requested a loan of 2,000 New Soles through Edpyme Alternativa which will go towards buying groceries, snacks and drinks to help her stock her business.  She will also buy a refrigerator to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort, who was born in 1960, is married to Mr. Afrem Ndeah and they are blessed with nine children, two of whom are younger than 15. They all live in a two-room apartment in the Tumuku Belo subdivision. Comfort made up her mind to join GHAPE in 2009 when she saw her friends doing well because of loans from GHAPE. She received her first loan of 50,000 XAF, which she used for her provisions store.

Comfort is requesting a second loan to expand. She needs the loan to buy kerosene for 8,000 XAF,  garri (a popular West African food made from cassava tubers) for 21,000 XAF, groundnuts for 9,500 XAF, goats for 27,500 XAF and corn for 14,000 XAF. Comfort knows that her business is going to succeed since it's located in a good site and she buys at good prices. Her business has helped to improve the living standards of the people in her community. The lone difficulty she suffered from in life was when her child was desperately sick. The profits from this loan will help to boost Comfort's business and to take care of the family's health. Comfort prefers GHAPE for trust and their training.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy corn, garri and beans for resale

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, who was born in 1975, is married to Mr. Napoleon and has six children, four of whom are younger than 15. They all live in a three-room apartment in the Tumuku Belo subdivision. Irine was having difficulties in life so a friend took her to GHAPE in 2009, and she received a loan of 50,000 XAF which she used to buy and sell Irish potatoes and beans, leading her to success in life.
 
Since Irine had a lot of success, she needs to expand. Therefore, she is applying for a second loan to buy more beans and potatoes and to add goats. She knows that she will succeed since she succeeded with the first loan and more people are demanding her goods. Irine is really helping the community since she has reduced people's distance to the market and the goods are in constant supply. Deaths have been the only challenge Irine has faced in life. The profit from this loan will help her expand her business and keep up her family's welfare. The training, the gradual repayment of loans and the low interest rates are the reasons that Irine prefers loans from GHAPE.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients

loans.use: to buy potatoes and beans for resale.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, who was born in 1956, is married to Eunice Nage and they are blessed with six children, one of whom is younger than 15. They live in a two-room apartment in the Tumuku Belo subdivision. Jacob had a lot of difficulty in providing for his six children, so in 2010 he was introduced to GHAPE by his friend, who was a member. He had his first loan of 50,000 XAF, which he used to purchase goats and to farm.

Jacob is requesting a second loan to buy seven goats for 75,000 XAF, beans for 22,500 XAF and corn for 32,500 XAF. He knows that he will succeed since he has enough land to graze his goats and to farm. Jacob is satisfying the high demand for goats in his community and thus helping the community. He was challenged when his son failed his certificate exam. Jacob will use the profit from this loan to pay his children's tuition fees and to repay his loan. Jacob took a loan from GHAPE because the interest rates are low and repayment is bit by bit. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting and goats for rearing.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 44 años de edad, convive con Edgardo, de 50 años. Ambos tuvieron 3 hijos: Joel, de 20, Wilder, de 18 y Gisela de 16 años. Todos en unión familiar, viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). La dedicación que le brida a su trabajo es muy importante para Felicita. Pues gracias al tiempo que pasa en sus cultivos, puede tener una buena cosecha en cada campaña agrícola. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las horas que pasa en la limpieza y quitar la maleza que crece entre sus frutos. Ya tiene 15 años consagrándose en el noble oficio de la agricultura, y en todo esté tiempo adquirió muchos conocimientos, y se siente feliz por ello. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátano; los cuales los vende en su misma localidad, donde después de cada cosecha encajona (una forma de envasar sus frutos), y vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que llegan los días martes y jueves. Ella se siente muy satisfecha por los resultados que está obteniendo; su principal anhelo es cultivar más productos agrícolas oriundos de la zona. Y ya dio el primer paso con la siembra de palta y cítricos, teniendo como resultado una un buen cultivo que está creciendo sin mayores dificultades y ya muy pronto darán sus primeros frutos. Por ello pide el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que se intensifique en esta actividad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Felicita, de adquirir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de café, plátanos y palta.
texts.en:
Felicita, age 44, lives with 50 year old Edgardo.  They have three children.  Joel is 20, Wilder is 18, and Gisela is 16.  They live together in their own house in the Puente Paucartambo community  (central Peruvian forest).

The dedication that she applies to her work is very important to Felicita.  Thanks to the time she spends on her crops, she is able to have a good harvest during each farming season.  What she likes most about her work are the hours she spends clearing the fields and getting rid of the weeds that grow around her plants.  She has spent 15 years devoting herself to the noble business of farming.  During this time she has acquired much knowledge, and she happy about that.

Her main crops are coffee and bananas.  She sells them in her own area.  After each harvest she boxes them (a way of canning her fruits).  She then sells them to the wholesale merchants who arrive on Tuesdays and Thursdays.  She is very satisfied with the results that she is getting.

Her primary desire is to grow more agricultural products that are native to the area.  She has already taken the first step by planting avocadoes and citrus fruits.  The result of this is a good crop that is growing without any significant difficulty.  They will produce their first fruits soon.

That is why she is asking for the support from each one of you so that she can step up this business activity.

She belongs to the “Luz del Futuro” (Light of the Future) Communal Bank.  This is her sixth loan with MFP, where she hopes to get your collaboration so that she is able to finalize her plans.  She pledges, once again, to make her payments as she has done with the previous loans she has had.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Upon receiving your support, Felicita will use the requested money to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to spread among her coffee, banana, and avocado crops.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en:
Bernice, who was born in 1965, is married to Mr. Muh Francis and is blessed with five children. She has two mates and they all live in a two-room apartment in the Tumuku Belo subdivision. Bernice got her first loan of 50,000 XAF from GHAPE in 2009, which she used for farming.

Bernice is requesting a second loan to buy planting seeds and more goats. She knows that her business will succeed since she has enough land for cultivation and for her goats to graze. She is helping the community since she is a good supplier of food items from her farm. Bernice had some difficulties when her brother died and when her mother was sick. Bernice will use the profit from her loan to improve the family's standard of living and to pay the children's tuition fees. She prefers loans from GHAPE since they train their borrowers how to use to their loans.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for farming and goats for rearing.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a widow born in 1972.  She was married to Mr. Ndifon Augustin and is blessed with five children, two of them are under fifteen years old. They live in a three room apartment in Tumuku quarter in the Belo subdivision. Evelyn received her first loan of 50,000 FCFA from GHAPE in 2009. She embarked on a retail store business in her area.

Evelyn is applying for her second loan to increase stock in her store. This loan will be used to buy 20 liters of honey for 30,000 FCFA, 100kg of rice for 30,000 FCFA, a cartoon of soap for 15,000 FCFA, and 125kg of groundnut for 35,000 FCFA. She knows that her trade will be a success because her store is the only one in the quarter and she always meets the demands of the people. Her trade actually helps the community since the demands of the people are satisfied. 

Evelyn had problems in life when the husband died and she was unable to pay her children's school fees. She will use the gain from her loan to buy a plot of land for her children and educate them. She preferred a loan from GHAPE because repayment is in small installments and it offers some training on how loans are to be used.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy rice, honey, groundnut and soap for resale

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina forma parte del banco comunal “El Canelo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para adultos y niños, se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 4 años, comenzó vendiendo ropa interior, en la actualidad ha incorporado diferentes productos, por lo que su negocio ha funcionado positivamente. Compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Santiago, específicamente en los sectores de Patronato y Barrio Meiggs. Su clientela es frecuente por lo que debe renovar sus productos regularmente. 
Con el préstamo comprará pijamas de polar, jeans, chalecos, ropa interior, gorros y abrigos, específicamente para la temporada de invierno. 
Melina comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio y eso la mantiene motivada, además que disfruta mucho lo que realiza. Sus metas en su negocio son comprar un vehículo particular para trasladar su mercadería cuando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que es muy sacrificado trasladarla en buses interurbanos, debido a la cantidad de productos que compra. 
Melina es jefa de hogar y vive junto a sus 5 hijos, 3 de ellos asisten a la universidad, por lo que debe continuar en su negocio para adquirir mayores ganancias y costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, por la facilidad de los créditos y la prioridad que le dan a los valores, principalmente la confianza, el respeto y la responsabilidad para cancelar los préstamos. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Melina is part of the “El Canelo” (Cinnamon Tree) Communal Bank in the city of Linares.  She sells new clothes for adults and children.  She has been in this field for four years.  She started by selling underwear.  She has currently incorporated different products, which is why her business is functioning favorably.  

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, specifically in the Patronato and Barrio Meiggs sectors.  She has frequent customers, and she therefore needs to regularly restock her products.

With the loan she will buy polar fleece pajamas, jeans, vests, underwear, hats, and coats specifically for the winter season.

Melina says that her business is going very well, and it keeps her motivated.  Also, she really enjoys what she does.  Her business goals are to buy her own vehicle to transport her merchandise when she buys in the city of Santiago.  It takes a lot of sacrifice to use interurban busses for transport because of the quantity of products that she buys. 

Melina is head of the household, and she lives with her five children.  Three of them attend the university.  Therefore, she needs to continue with her business in order to get greater income and to pay for her children’s university studies.

She is very happy and grateful for the support offered by Fondo Esperanza, for the ease of securing the loans, and for the priority they give to values.  They give priority mainly to confidence, respect, and the responsibility of paying back the loans.  

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region in the center of Chile. Agriculture is very important, and grapes for export are of increasing importance. Cereal crops (rice, wheat, maize, oats) and vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard) and fruit grow well. Linares is the main producer of rice in Chile with 78% of national production coming from this province, especially from the community of Parral.

loans.use: to buy polar fleece pajamas, jeans, vests, underwear, hats, and coats specifically for the winter season.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 50 años, está casada, con Ervin, de 55 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Lisbet, de 4 años, a la que educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Hace tan solo dos años, que Norma sufrió la pérdida de su casa; producto de un Huaico (crecida del río, que contiene lodo y agua abundante), y gracias a la labor humanitaria de los miembros de su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de gaseosa y cerveza en un pequeño negocio que acondicionó en su casa, según cuenta, los días donde tiene mayores ingresos son los días sábados y domingos. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Norma; ya que gracias a su buena sazón en la cocina, los profesores de la única escuela de su localidad, la contratan para que les prepare los alimentos del día, pues la mayoría son de otra ciudad y viven en casas alquiladas. Por otro lado, cuando tiene tiempo libre trabaja a lado de su esposo, en la agricultura, sembrando y cosechando café una vez al año, para luego  venderlo a los acopiadores de la ciudad de La Merced.  A ella, le va muy bien en su negocio y en sus demás actividades paralelas, por ello más adelante está pensando ampliar su negocio no solo con bebidas, sino también abrir un restaurante, donde pueda vender comida que solo ella sabe preparar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera un pequeño préstamo de ustedes para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Norma, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de golosinas, cerveza para surtir su tienda de comestibles; asimismo en la compra de mesas y sillas para la pensión que ofrece.
texts.en:
Norma, 50, is married to Ervin, who is 55.  They have 3 children, but live only with one of them: Lisbet, 4, who they are educating and raising in their own home in the town of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle.)  Two years ago Norma lost her house to a flood (resulting from an overflow of water and mud from an adjacent river.)  Thanks to the humanitarian work of members of her communal bank, she was able to get through this.  She has a business selling soft drinks and beer in a small store that she set up in her house.  According to Norma, the days when her earnings are highest are Saturdays and Sundays.  But this is not Norma's only business.  Since she is a good cook, the teachers at the only school in her town hired her to prepare food for them on a daily basis, because most of them live in rented homes in another town.  Also, when Norma has free time she works with her husband on the farm, planting and harvesting coffee at one point in the year, to later sell to the wholesalers in the city of La Merced.  

Norma's businesses and other activities are going very well, so in the future she is planning to convert her business selling drinks into a restaurant where she could sell the food that she knows how to prepare.  Norma belongs to the communal bank "Luz del Futuro" and this is her 9th loan with MFP; she expects that this small loan from you will help her to achieve these goals.  She promises again to make her payments as scheduled, as she did with her previous loans.  In addition, she is grateful to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and cooperative people.  Norma will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of candy and beer to stock her food store, and she will also be buying tables and chairs for her meal service business.

loans.use: to buy sweets and beer for her store, and also to buy tables and chairs for her catering business

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine was born in 1991 and is married to Mr. Gilbert Yem. They live in Elemighong and is blessed with one child who is below the age of fifteen. They live in a two-room house with three persons per room. Celestine had her first loan in 2009 which she used to start a business buying and selling beans.

Celestine is requesting a second loan to purchase more beans to sell and also to do farming in the Elemighong neighborhood. Her personal contribution to her business is 25,000 FCFA . She thinks her business will succeed since there is a high demand for the items she sells in the market and because of her willingness to do the business. This trade will help the community since she buys beans in and around the neighborhood to take to the market. 

Celestine has faced some challenges in her life, such as not having been educated because her father was unable to do so. What she hates thinking about is the death of her brother. She will use the profit from this loan to send her child to school and to assist her family with other problems. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because it makes her work hard to become rich one day if she abides to GHAPE rules and because repayments can be made bit by bit. 

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy beans for resale and seedlings for farming

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento el Carmen  esta compuesto por la siguiente mesa directiva: la presidenta del grupo  es la señora  María,  se dedica a la venta D.  víveres entrega a crédito   y también alquila sillas y mesas, para todo tipo D. acontecimientos se dedica a esta actividad hace tres años y la venta D. víveres desD. hace 7 años, su familia esta compuesta por dos  hijos  pequeños a quienes cuida sola ya que tiene que trabajar y cuidar a su hijos. El monto que solicito es para la compra  D. víveres para continuar con su venta  y sillas para poder alquilar ya que cada día aumenta sus pedidos para alquilar para los acontecimientos, es una persona muy dinámica agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "El Carmen" Communal Bank is lead by the following board of directors: María is the President of the group. She sells provisions on credit and delivers them. She also rents out chairs and tables for all types of events. She has been in this business for three years and has sold provisions for 7 years. In her family she has two young children. She supports them on her own and has both to work and take care of them. 

The loan that she requested is for the purchase of provisions to continue her sales. She will also buy more chairs because every day her orders increase for event rentals. María is a very dynamic woman and is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and chairs.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is a single mother who lives with her son in the Valle region of Honduras. For the past 26 years she has made a living by making and selling freshly prepared tortillas at home. She has a very solid customer base, being that most of her clients are established restaurants or regular customers in her community. Beatriz has received a number of loans in the past and has a strong payment history. She is requesting a loan of 13,000 Honduran lempiras with which she will buy corn and firewood to prepare fresh tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: Juliana.

texts.en:
Juliana is a lady who was married to Fedeline.  They have eight children, two of them are below the age of fithteen. She is now separated from her husband and lives in a two-room house with two persons per room in the Elemighong quarter in the Belo subdivision. Her first loan was given to her in 2010 and she invested it in the purchase of irish potatoes and beans to sell.

Juliana is requesting her second loan from GHAPE to do farming and also to buy irish potatoes, corn, fowls, tobacco and kerosene to resell. She plans to use the loan for 120,000 FCFA to buy irish potatoes for 30,000 FCFA, maize for 50,000 FCFA, fowls for 20,000 FCFA, tobacco for 10,000FCFA, kerosene for 10,000 FCFA.  She thinks she will succeed because she is always available at her business site to serve her clients and she makes sure her goods are always available for her customers at moderate prices. The loan will help the community since she sells what the people want. 

Juliana has faced challenges in her life.  One of her children had died, she felt sick for a long time, and her children ran and stayed in the bush for a night. The profit she will get from this loan will be used to pay tuition fees, hospital bills and food for the family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because repayment can be made bit by bit, the interest rates are low, and GHAPE also gives out a training series on loan management.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell

loans.name: Lourdes Jeaneth

texts.en: Lourdes is a single mother who lives in the Valle region of Honduras. For the past nine years she has made a living by selling men's and women's clothing, footwear and accessories out of her home. She has a loyal customer base and has successfully repaid four previous loans. Lourdes is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 with which she will buy merchandise to sell in her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing, footwear and accessories.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela, reside en el Barrio San Antonio de la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana); ahí formó su familia junto a Edwin, su esposo desde hace 6 años. Ambos tienen una hija, Darleni, a la que cuidan y educan juntos.  Las labores de está trabajadora mujer son múltiples. Desde hace 7 años su suegro le heredó una parcela de terreno, donde comenzó a sembrar café, ganando dinero una vez al año en la cosecha de éste grano, que ahora esta en plena recolección. Ella considera muy rentable el negocio de la venta de café ya que el precio del mercado es muy alto; por otro lado también se dedica en la venta de venta de pasteles y los fines de semana vende salchipapa (papas fritas con ensalada), pollo crocante y hamburguesa; en una pequeña carretilla. Como si fuera poco, aprovecha para vender ropa a los pobladores de su localidad que constantemente la hacen pedidos de las prendas de niños, varones y mujeres de todas las edades. Le va muy bien en sus actividades y ella se siente muy bien por ello. Por eso más adelante desea juntar dinero para poder tener un negocio grande y propio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo de parte de ustedes para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Estela, de adquirir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ropa importada que puede conseguirlo de la ciudad de Lima (capital del país), para venderlos.
texts.en: Estela lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio in the town of Puente Puacartambo (Peruvian central jungle). She formed her family there together with Edwin, her husband of 6 years.  They have a daughter Darleni, who they take care of and raise together.  This hard-working woman has multiples businesses.   Seven years ago she inherited a parcel of land from her father-in-law and started sowing coffee, earning money once a year from the harvest of this grain, which is now in peak harvest.  She considers the sale of coffee a very profitable business, since the market price is high.  In addition, she also sells cakes and on the weekends sells salchipapa (french fries with salad), crispy chicken and hamburgers from a little cart. As if that were not a lot already, she also sells clothing to the inhabitants of her town that are always ordering clothing from her for children, men and women of all ages.  She is doing well in the businesses and she feels really good because of it.  Because of this, in the future she wants to get together some money to be able to have her own large business.  She belongs to the communal bank “Luz del Future” “(Light of the Future) and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is waiting for a small loan from you so that she can reach her goals.  Estela, having obtained your support, will invest the requested loan in buying imported clothing that she can get from the city of Lima (the country’s capital) in order to sell them.

loans.use: to buy imported clothing to meet the demand for it by her customers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: el sr. Juan nació en Chuquisaca el 24 de julio de 1963 tiene un hijo mayor,  su esposa es doña Mercedes hace 20 años que se vinieron a Santa Cruz el torno en busca de mejores días, y mediante el sindicato agrario de Zurutu tienen una parcela de 35 hectáreas en la cual vive y trabaja siembra maíz, arroz, y yuca y también se dedica a la crianza de chancho, con el dinero del crédito comprar semillas y también lo utilizara para el preparado del terreno para la siembra, y como es una distancia larga salen una vez al mes al Torno para compra de víveres, para poder abastecerse para todo el mes, es cliente responsable hace 4 años que el esta trabajando con Emprender, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan was born in Chuquisaca  on July 24, 1963 and has one adult son. His wife is Mercedes and 20 years ago they came to Santa Cruz to find better opportunities. Through the Zurutu agrarian union they were able to obtain a parcel of 35 hectares of land on which they live and work. They grow corn, rice and yucca and they also raise pigs. 

With the money from this loan Juan will buy seeds and also prepare his land for sowing. And, since it is far from their home, Mercedes and Juan go to Torno once a month to purchase provisions to support them for the entire month. Juan has been a responsible client of Emprender for four years and he is grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: to invest in sowing rice.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luis, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , desde hace 25 años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo , los planes futuros hacia su familia es poder darle un mejor bienestar  ya que tiene cuatro hijos y su esposa labora como comerciante para apoyar con los gastos del hogar , don Luis necesita un financiamiento para poder inducir el cultivo y sacar una buena producción tanto en tamaño como color y sabor . A gradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondos Kiva para realizar la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios ya que sin este apoyo no fuese posible la producción.
texts.en:
Luis is a small farmer in Ticuantepe. For 25 years he has been growing pineapples. His greatest challenge are the pests that affect his crops. His plans for the future for his family is to give them a better quality of life. He has four children and his wife works as a storekeeper to help support the household expenses. 

Luis needs this loan to begin begin planting and to have a good harvest in both quantity and quality in terms of color and flavor. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic has given him through Kiva funds to help him buy fertilizer and the supplies he needs. Without this support he wouldn't be able to achieve the output he needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: Née le 10 juillet 1976 au Bénin, Félicité  est mariée à un enseignant  du nom de Noel. Le couple  a  cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois restent encore à leur charge.  Félicité  vit ensemble avec  son mari et  ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Félicité a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Félicité prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, accompagné de sauce aux poissons, etc.) qu’elle vend à son domicile. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus,  Félicité  vend des boissons non alcoolisées.  Félicité s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Félicité sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Born on July 10, 1976 in Bénin, Félicité  is married to a teacher named Noel. The couple have five children. All of them have been or are presently in school and their parents are still responsible for three of them. Félicité lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting the family. 

Félicité left her studies when she was in secondary school. To support herself and her children, Félicité prepares food (maize porridge or rice accompanied by fish stew, etc.) that she sells out of her home. Alongside this income-generating activity, Félicité  sells non-alcoholic drinks. She buys her supplies in a marketplace in Bénin. She is requesting her third loan from ALIDé. The two other loans were both reimbursed correctly.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, condiments for stews, fresh fish and drinks.

loans.name: Suyapa Concepcion

texts.en: Suyapa lives with her husband in the Valle region of Honduras. For the past 20 years, Suyapa has made a living by preparing and selling freshly made tortillas from her home. She has received a number of loans in the past and has a sound payment history. Suyapa is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which she will purchase corn, firewood, and a tortilla-making machine.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase corn, firewood, and a tortilla-making machine.

loans.name: Chapeline

texts.fr: Chapeline est née le 03 mars 1972 au Bénin et est mariée à un  agent de la Société Béninoise d’Electricité et d’Eau, du nom de Patrice. Chapeline est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Chapeline  et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Chapeline vend des produits cosmétiques et  des chaussures. Chapeline exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Chapeline s’approvisionne  dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que  Chapeline  sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.
texts.en:
Chapeline was born on March 3, 1972 in Benin and is married to Patrice, an agent for the "Société Béninoise d’Electricité et d’Eau" (water and electric company). Chapeline is the mother of four children, all in school and supported by their parents. Chapeline and her husband live with their children.

Never having gone to school, Chapeline sells cosmetics and shoes. She has been doing this for fifteen years, and it allows her to meet her needs and those of her children.

Chapeline gets her supplies at one of Benin's largest markets. This is the third time that Chapeline has sought a loan through ALIDé. She would like to expand her business and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Danilo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Danilo, es un pequeño comerciante de frutas y verduras  de la zona de la concepción, durante los últimos tres años se le presentan problemas de alzas de productos, en ocasiones llega a dar las frutas  casi al costo para no perderlas,  don Danilo sus sueños es poder comprar una camioneta para vender ambúlate ya que actualmente lo hace pero en un pequeño carretón que es su herramienta de trabajo , el necesita que se le apoye para poder incrementar su negocio y obtener más ganancias para poder apoyar a su familia ya que tiene  dos que estudian su primaria . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Danilo has a small business selling fruits and vegetables in the Concepción area. For the past three years he has had trouble because of increasing prices and occasionally he has to sell his fruits almost at cost to ensure that they don't go bad. Danilo's dream is to be able to buy a van so that he can travel to make his sales. He does this currently, but he only has a wagon to transport his goods.

He needs support so that he can expand his business and increase his income so that he can support his family. He currently has two children who are in primary school. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic is giving him using Kiva funds.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Patricia  Benjamine

texts.fr: Patricia  Benjamine est née le 30 mars 1971 au Bénin  et est mariée à un revendeur  du nom de Latif.  Patricia  Benjamine a six enfants  dont quatre  restent encore à leur charge. Tous les enfants de Patricia  Benjamine et de Latif sont  scolarisés. Patricia  Benjamine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants.  Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. N’ayant jamais été à  l’école, Patricia  Benjamine vend de l’huile d’arachide, de la farine de blé et des condiments de sauce (oignons, piments, tomate, etc.). Cette activité  lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille.  Patricia  Benjamine s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Patricia  Benjamine sollicite pour la première fois un crédit  auprès de ALIDE.
texts.en: Patricia Benjamine was born on March 30, 1971 in Benin. She is married to a vendor by the name of Latif. Particia Benjamine has six children, four of whom are still in her care. All children are in school. Patricia Benjamin and her husband live together with their children. The spouses jointly provide for different family needs. Never having attended school, Patricia Benjamin sells peanut oil, wheat flour and sauce condiments (onions, peppers, tomatos etc). This activity allows her to provide for herself and her family. Patricia Benjamin stocks up at one of the biggest markets in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand in mind, Patricia Benjamin is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments and wheat flour

loans.name: Na We Cam-Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Na We Cam II” group. They are smallbusiness women based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Emma. Emma is 40 years old.  She was born in a town called Port Loko but is currently residing in Makeni city with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is an architect and her children are no longer attending school. For 5 years now, Emma has been selling palm oil and fish. With this loan, she will improve her business by buying palm oil and fish in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and fish

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Née en 1977 au Bénin, Jeannette est mariée à Nestor un commerçant. Le couple à quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés. Jeannette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Jeannette subvient ensemble avec son mari, aux besoins de la famille. Jeannette  n’a  jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jeannette mène comme activité depuis quinze ans la vente des boîtes de conserves de tomate, des bols en séries et des condiments de sauce (oignons, piments, tomate, etc.). Jeannette s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Jeannette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Jeannette de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en: Jeannette was born in Benin in 1977 and is married to Nestor, a trader. The couple has four children in its care, all of them at school. Jeannette lives with her husband and children. She and her husband together provide for the family's needs. Jeannette never went to school. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, she has for the past fifteen years been running a business selling tinned tomatoes, sets of bowls and condiments for sauces (onions, peppers, tomatoes etc.) She gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets. It is the first time she has requested a loan from Alidé. This first loan will undoubtedly allow Jeannette to increase her business volume and to increase her customer base and her income.

loans.use: to purchase condiments for sauces (tomatoes, peppers, onions, spices)

loans.name: Maura Katalina

texts.es: La señora Maura, es una pequeña agricultora de la zona de de San Ignacio , desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de pitahayas , la mayor afectación  que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden las plantas , ya que estas carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatirlas  , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que ella tuvo cinco hijos ya todos casados e independientes , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder renovar gran parte de las matas de pitahayas. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondos Kiva ya que sin este apoyo no lograría realizar sus sueños y mejor su vida .
texts.en:
Maura is a small farmer in the San Ignacio area. For 20 years she has been growing pitaya fruits. The biggest challenge that she faces is due to pests that attack her plants. This is because she lacks the fertilizer and supplies she needs to fight them.

Her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions. She has five children who are all married and independent. Her plans for the future of her crops are to renew the majority of her pitaya plants. She is grateful for the support she has received from Afodenic through Kiva funds because without it she wouldn't be able to achieve her dreams or improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 27 años, está casada con Rudy, de 28 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jack, de 9 y Anahi, de 3 años. Los tres como una gran familia, vive en casa de su mamá, ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Las labores de Margarita son múltiples, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a la “cajonería” (lugar donde se hacen cajones de madera, que se utilizan para envasar las  frutas), y en todo este tiempo pudo juntar dinero necesario para poder abrir un restaurante de anticuchos, hamburguesas y salchipapas (papas fritas con salsas) y desde entonces tiene gran acogida. Como mujer joven y trabajadora, tuvo una buena idea y ahora no solo vende anticuchos, sino también pollo crocante. Pero, sus ganas de luchar son increíbles, ya que hace tan solo 2 años que incursionó en la agricultura, donde siembra plátano y café. Ahora ella quiere comprar más terrenos agrícolas y espera dentro de muy poco concretar un acuerdo de venta, pero sin descuidarse de su negocio. Para ello tiene pensado comprar una casa propia, donde pueda decorar su restaurante de manera más llamativa. Su principal preocupación en esté momento es sacar el máximo provecho a la cosecha de café, ya que solo en está temporada existe gran demanda del producto en el mercado, por ser fecha de maduración. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde está contenta de saber que recibirá el apoyo financiero. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Margarita, de adquirir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícola donde está pensando sembrar mayor cantidad de café.
texts.en: Margarita, 27, is married to Rudy, 28, and together they have two children: Jack, 9, and Anahi, 3.  They all live together as a family in the house of Margarita's mother, located in the town of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle.) Margarita is involved in several activities.  For 10 years she has worked at a crate business (a place where they make wooden crates used to pack fruit), and over this time she was able to save enough money to open a restaurant where she sells beef kebabs, hamburgers and salchipapas (a dish of sausage and fried potatoes.)  This business has been well received by the public.  As a young enterprising woman she had a good idea, and now sells not only beef kebabs but also fried chicken.  But she still has an incredible desire to get ahead, because two years ago she also started a business in agriculture cultivating bananas and coffee.  Now she wants to buy more farmland and hopes very soon to conclude a sales agreement, but she will also continue to tend to her restaurant business.  To do this, she is thinking about buying her own house where she could set up a more appealing locale for her restaurant.  Her main worry at this moment is to extract the biggest possible harvest from her coffee crops, since in this season there is a high demand for this product in the marketplace, and this is the time when her crops are maturing.  Margarita belongs to the communal bank "Luz del Futuro," and this is the group's 5th loan cycle with MFP, from which Margarita is pleased to know that she will receive financial support.  She is once-again committed to making her payments on time, as she did with her previous loans.  Also, she appreciates being part of her communal bank because all of the members are cooperative and responsible people.
