At the moment her priority is to save up enough capital to build her house in a more resistant material, which will help her provide her children with a better quality of life. 

She is a member of the "Abejitas de Pumpuriani" ("Pumpuriani's Little Bees") communal bank and this is her fifth loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she will have the necessary financial backing to achieve her goals. Once more, she is committed to repaying the loan as she's done in the past. She also enjoys being part of a community bank because all other members are responsible and very supportive individuals. If she gets your support, Bertha will invest the money in the purchase of several bags of organic compost to distribute it amongst her crops of bananas, cassava and corn, which she will harvest very soon. She will also take the first steps to improve her home, with the purchase of bricks and corrugated iron.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic compost and materials to build her home.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 31 años, es una mujer fuerte y luchadora, convive con Ronald, de 26 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos Josue de 12, Yens de 8 y Yoice de 4 años, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Todas las mañanas como de costumbre, se dirige con su hija Yoice a cuidar sus cultivos de café, plátano y yuca. Lo que les gusta es poder limpiar, podar y cuidar de sus plantaciones; ya que desde los 12 años su abuelita le enseñó a trabajar la tierra y sobrevivir de ella. Más le desagrada tener que caminar horas para poder llegar a sus terrenos de cultivo que se ubican en la zona alta de su localidad. Cuando sus cultivos están maduros los vende a los comerciantes que llegan constantemente a la comunidad, caso contrario sucede con el cultivo de Yuca; Nora viaja una vez por semana al mercado central de su ciudad para poder vender su producto. Ahora esta pensando sembrar maíz hibrido (llamado también polenta), ya que tiene mayor demanda en la zona; de la misma manera sembrará plantas estables como cítricos y con ello asegurará su producción en el futuro. Como también desea invertir en la creación de una tienda de comestibles, donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores del lugar, ya que por ser una zona alejada de la ciudad no hay negocio de este rubro. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nora de obtener su ayuda; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café. Ya que se fertiliza 3 veces al año para mantenerlos fuertes.
texts.en:
Nora, 31, is a strong, tenacious woman.  She lives with Ronald, 26, and they have three children: Josué, 12, Yens, 8 and Yoice, 4. They live in their own house located in the Peruvian jungle (native community of Centro Pumpuriani).

Every morning, as usual, she takes her daughter Yoice with her to care for her coffee, banana and manioc crops.   What she enjoys doing is weeding, pruning and caring for her plants.  Since the age of 12 her grandmother taught her how to work the soil and subsist from it.  However, she does not enjoy having to walk hours to reach her farmland which is located in a higher zone of her location.  When her crops are mature she sells them to merchants that constantly visit the community.  She does the opposite, though, with the manioc crops: Nora travels once a week to the city’s central market to sell it.

Now, she’s planning to farm a hybrid strain of corn, also called polenta, since it’s in high demand in the zone.  She will also plant stable plants, like citrus, which will assure future production.

In addition, she also wants to invest in a grocery store where she can sell basics to local residents because given that the area is far from the city there are no such businesses there.

She’s a member of the “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” (Little Bees from Pumpuriani) communal bank and this is the fifth loan with MFP where she hopes to have its cooperation to make her plans a reality.

On the other hand, she once again commits to pay her installments like she’s done with her past loans.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

If Nora were to get this help she will invest the requested money in the purchase of several sacks of organic manure to spread among her coffee crops since they have to be fertilized three times a year in order to keep them strong.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) who specializes in helping troubled adolescents. Jorge, who has over 30 years of counseling experience, has been running his practice for 13 years. Over the course of his career, Jorge has worked as a probation officer and a guidance counselor in multiple capacities at the collegiate level. He also has two masters degrees, one in Education and Counseling and the other in Administration and Leadership. 

Jorge is licensed to counsel people of all ages, but most of his clients are children. The majority of his clients are referred to him by schools, pediatricians, and the Juvenile Department Correctional Center. Because most of Jorge's clients are in school during the day, he meets with them in the evenings and on the weekends to keep them from missing class. Jorge typically meets with his adult clients in the afternoon before school gets out. 

Jorge says that success with any client begins with building trust. He makes a point to build rapport with clients before addressing serious issues. Jorge emphasizes that he doesn't change anyone--they change themselves. He then finds ways to improve their situations, but he says that the decision to change always rests with them. 

Jorge is using this loan to better advertise his business and to maintain operating capital. Until now, Jorge has spent very little money on advertising, instead relying upon referrals to generate business. He already has business cards and fliers, but will use this loan to take out a billboard advertisement. Whatever money remains will be used as cash to meet miscellaneous business expenses. Because most of Jorge's revenues come from claims paid by insurance companies, there is often little certainty of when he will actually be paid. Having cash on hand keeps the business afloat during the waiting process.

loans.use: to pay for advertising and to have operating capital.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 30 años, reside en la localidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Orfelia, su esposa desde hace 2 años. Ambos tienen una hija, María  a la que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño, ya que es todavía una niña. Los campos de cultivo han sido en la vida de Luis, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, producirla y vivir de ella, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde tiene sembrados café y plátano, en las 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que posee; los cuales una vez cosechados llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que depende del buen cuidado que brinde a sus sembríos, las ganancias que obtenga. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos, pues sabe que logrará sus objetivos ya que trabaja sin descanso. En sus tiempos libres sigue apoyando en las labores agrícolas a diferentes agricultores, que le pagan un dinero extra. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de Café” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Luis, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos da café y plátanos que todavía no maduran.
texts.en:
Luis, 30, lives in Palomar (Peruvian Central Jungle).  He formed his family there with Orfelia, his wife of two years.  They have a daughter, María, who they care for with much love and affection since she’s still a little girl.

Luis’s life has been the fields, an activity that is necessary to live.  Since he was a little boy his parents always taught him how to work the land, to make it productive and to live off it.  Because of this he decided to continue the family activity and now he has his own fields planted with coffee and bananas.  He has two hectares of farmland.  When the harvests are collected he sells them in the market in the city of La Merced.  What he most enjoys about his work is planting because he knows that profits depend on the good care he provides his plants.  He’s been in this line of work for 10 years and considers the brusque weather changes that affect crop yields quite a bit to be the most difficult part of it.

In the future he’d like to continue to work hard improving his crops because he knows that he will reach his objectives since he works tirelessly.  On his spare time he helps out other farmers who pay him a bit of extra money.

He belongs to the “Aroma de Café” (Aroma of Coffee) communal bank and this is the fourth loan with MFP where he hopes to receive financial support to reach his goals.  On the other hand, he commits once again to pay his installments like he did with the previous loans he got.  Also, he enjoys being part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible and very mutually supportive people.

If Luis were to get the requested loan he will invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of organic manure to spread among his coffee and banana crops which haven’t ripened yet.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose owns S. Construction, Inc., a commercial sub-contracting firm specializing in concrete installation.  When Jose started this business three years ago, he was his firm’s only employee.  Now, Jose has 16 full-time employees and the capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously.  Jose began working in construction 17 years ago as a general laborer.  From there, he worked his way up through the construction industry, gaining experience in cost estimating and project management along the way.  

Jose has a degree in civil engineering from the University of Texas at El Paso (UTEP), which he earned while working full-time to support his family.  In the eight years that Jose was a student, he took a variety of odd jobs both within and outside of the construction industry.  Instead of going through the motions as he pursued his goal of becoming a civil engineer, Jose took every job as a learning opportunity and a chance for self-improvement.  For example, Jose credits working at Wal-Mart with building the customer service skills he uses daily as a small business owner.  

Recently, UTEP began offering graduate studies in construction management.  Jose wants to return to school part-time so that he can learn more about the financial side of project management.  He says that his educational and work experience to this point prepared him to design and implement projects, but that management and finance courses will make him a better business owner.

Jose is using this loan as operating capital for his business.  The construction industry in El Paso was really slow during the first few months of 2011.  In order to support himself and his employees, Jose says he rolled the dice in taking projects with several general contractors he otherwise wouldn’t.  The decision backfired when they didn’t pay on time, and Jose’s cash flow diminished to the point that it threatened his ability to pay upcoming bills.  As someone who stakes his reputation on punctuality, Jose decided to take out a small loan for operating capital until business picked up.  In addition to supplying Jose’s business with needed cash, it allows Jose to build his business’ credit.

Within the next two to three years, Jose wants to become a general contractor.  To do so, he says the business will need to expand its services and add expertise, which will take time.  In the meantime, Jose believes that there is enough demand for concrete installation that his business can continue expanding its presence as a subcontractor.  

S. Construction, Inc. is a family owned and operated business.   Jose employs his dad, who has 37 years of experience in the construction industry, as his chief superintendent of projects.  Jose’s wife, Monica, manages the business’ administrative work and finances.  For the time being, they run the business out of their home to keep operating costs low, though Jose anticipates needing to open an office if business continues growing.  Jose and Monica have three children.

loans.use: to make payroll until his next project and to build company's credit.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 34 años, reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Medait, su esposa, desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos Jean y Manuel, a los que educan y cuidan con mucho amor en casa de su mamá. Desde muy pequeño Wilfredo aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras heredadas de parte de ellos, un promedio de 5 hectáreas de los cuales por falta de capital solo siembra 3 cuadras de extensión, en donde cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Él siembra Café y plátano, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced ó a la cooperativa de su localidad. Ahora está en plena cosecha, donde está segura podrá obtener buenas ganancias. Además de tener un apoyo con la venta de los viveros que realiza; vendiendo el millar a S/. 400 soles. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos.  Y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a pulir madera y sacar planchones de tablas, ganando así un dinero extra. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Wilfredo de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de canastas y el pago del salario a los peones que le están apoyando en la cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 34, lives in the community of Palomar (Peruvian Central Jungle).  He formed his family there with Medait, his wife for the last five years.  They have two children, Jean and Manuel, that they educate and care for with much love in his mother’s house.

Since he was a little boy, Wilfredo learned how to work the land alongside his parents who taught him everything needed to know to produce good crops.  Now, he has his own land part of which was inherited from them.  He has about 5 hectares on average but due to lack of capital only farms coffee and bananas with much care and patience only on 3 "cuadras" (240 sq. m. approx) of land.  He takes his harvested crops to the central market in La Merced or to his local cooperative to sell.

He is currently in the height of the harvest season and is sure to have good profits.  In addition, he earns extra money selling seedlings; he sells them at 400 soles per one thousand.

What he most enjoys about his work is harvesting his crops because he feels that his hard work is having good results.  He’s been in this line of work for 10 years and considers protecting his crops from infestations that can affect them to be the most difficult part of it.  In his spare time he polishes wood to make boards thus earning extra money.  His greatest wish is to buy a car to transport his goods to market.

He is a member of the “Aroma de Café” (Aroma of Coffee) communal bank and this is the fourth loan with MFP where he hopes to get the financial help he so needs.  On the other hand, he commits once more to pay his installments like he’s done in previous loans.  Also, he enjoys being part of his communal bank because its members are responsible and very mutually supportive persons.

If Wilfredo were to obtain the support, he will use the requested funds to buy baskets and to pay the laborers who are helping him harvest the coffee their salaries.

loans.use: to buy baskets and pay laborers' salaries to help him bring in the harvest.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 48 años, reside en la localidad de Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Eugenia, su esposa desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Carlos y Carla a la que educan y crían en su casa propia. Cuando era niño, aprendió todo lo que debía saber de la tierra y como producirla, es entonces que poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café, plátano y palta, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le brinda el sustento familiar. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus productos de la plaga de insectos. Pero el trabajo constante y la dedicación que le brinda a sus cultivos hacen que en cada cosecha de café, obtenga buenas ganancias, ya que los acopiadores de la zona lo conocen por ser una persona trabajadora y cumplida. Además lo motiva el noble sacrificio de su esposa, quien trabaja como promotora de educación en la capital del país, donde enseña a niños menores a leer y escribir. Constantemente viaja para poder ver a su familia sin descuidar su trabajo; es por ello que desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Carlos de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de café, que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Carlos, 48 years old, resides in the locality of Palomar (in the central Peruvian rain forest). Here he formed his family with Eugenia, his wife of 8 years. They have 2 children: Carlos and Carla, who they are educating and raising in their own house. 

When he was young, Carlos learned all he needed to know about the earth and how to make it produce. It was then that little by little, with the passage of time, he was placed in charge of his parents' lands. Now, he has extensive cultivated fields, in which he grows coffee, plantains, and avocados, which he sells in the city markets at La Merced.

What he likes most about his work is cultivating the earth, because it is the activity that offers sustenance for his family. He has been at this for 12 years and the most difficult part is protecting his crops from plagues of insects. But constant work and dedication has resulted in each coffee harvest resulting in good earnings, and the local buyers know him as a hard-working and reliable person.

Also, Carlos doesn't forget the noble sacrifice of his wife who works as an educational promoter in the capital of the country, where she teaches children to read and write. Constantly, she travels to see her family without neglecting her work; that's motivates him with much determination, to buy a car for transporting his products.

Carlos belongs to the “Aroma de Cafe” (Aroma of Coffee) communal bank and this is his 4th loan through MFP, whose collaboration he awaits in order to achieve his objectives. And he promises once again to make his payments, as with his previous loans. Carlos  is pleased to be a part of his communal bank, because all the members are responsible people with much solidarity. Carlos will invest the money in buying various sacks of organic manure to spread around his coffee trees, which within months will be harvested.

loans.use: buy various sacks of organic manure to spread around his coffee trees.

loans.name: Marlly Lorena

texts.es:
A sus 24 años de edad y como madre de un hijo de 7 años, Marlly Lorena se vio en la necesidad de empezar a trabajar como independiente desde muy joven, pues con lo que su esposo ganaba no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar.  Por ello, esta emprendedora Comenzó a vender ropa, zapatos y varios productos de uso personal.

Aunque ella debe estar diariamente al frente de su hogar, su trabajo no le impide realizar sus labores como madre y ama de casa. Marlly lleva a su hija al colegio y mientras su hija estudia ella visitas sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos muy favorables y de muy buena calidad y así poco a poco ha ido ganando más clientes lo que le ha permitido seguir adelante con su negocio, sin descuidar sus responsabilidades en el hogar. 

Actualmente Marlly Lorena necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía que le permita incrementar sus ventas y proporcionalmente sus ingresos, ya que ella sueña algún día tener su propia casa brindarle darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. .
texts.en:
At 24 years of age and as the mother of a 7-year-old child, Marlly Lorena was obligated to work on her own from a very young age.  They could not cover basic household expenses with what her husband earned.  That is why this entreprenuer began to sell clothes, shoes and various products for personal use.

Eventhough she must run her household daily, her job doesn’t get in the way of her duties as mother and housewife.  Marlly brings her daughter to school and visits her customers while she is studying.  She offers them very good, high-quality products and little by little has gotten more customers.  This has allowed her to expand her business without neglecting her responsibilities at home.

Marlly Lorena currently needs a loan to purchase merchandise in order to increase her sales and her income proportionately.  She dreams of having her own house one day and of providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in order to improve earnings.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: La señora Irene es de la comunidad en el estado de Puebla, México, ella tiene 58 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 5 hijos Santos de 27 años de edad, Simón de 24 años de edad ellos son solteros, Yovani de 14 años de edad está estudiando la secundaria, Ángeles de 28 años de edad y Minerva de 26 años de edad ellas son casadas, ella tiene su negocio de venta de alfarería y solicito su préstamo para comprar loza, ollas, cazuelas, jarros, Greta, celite y leña, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años por necesidad, aprendió con sus vecinos viendo como elaboraban las cazuelas y las ollas, ella fue guardando  lo de la venta de sus puerquitos que creaba y con eso compro la loza y el material para elaborar las cazuelas, las ollas y los jarros, ella está orgullosa de trabajar la alfarería su esposo le ayuda a vender la loza sale de viaje en su camioneta va a Tenancingo, Chalma, al estado de México, hay algunos clientes de esta comunidad que vienen a compran greta, celite para elaborar sus ollas, cazuelas y jarros, ella está contenta con este préstamo que le dan por que le da gusto comprar más loza para cuando llegan a comprar tiene mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes. San Marcos es un pueblo bonito, celebra  el 29 de Junio la fiesta de San Pedro, hay misas, procesión, jaripeo de toros. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes estamos triunfando”.
texts.en: Mrs. Irene is from Puebla, México.  She is 58 years old, married and has 5 children.  Santos is 27 years old and  Simón is 24 years old.  They are single.  Yovani is 14 years old and in high school.   Ángeles is 28 years old and Minerva is 26 years old.  They are married.  She has her pottery business and applied for her loan to purchase pottery, cooking pots, casserole dishes, pitchers, glaze, celite, firewood.  She started her business 4 years ago out of necessity.  She learned by watching how her neighbors made the dishes and pots.  She saved what she earned from the pigs she raised and bought the pottery and the material to make dishes, pots and pitchers.  She is proud to be a potter and her husband helps her sell it.  He travels with his truck to Tenancingo, Chalma in Mexico.  Some customers in this area come to buy glaze and celite to make their cooking pots, casserole dishes and pitchers.  She is happy with this loan they are giving her because she can buy more pottery so she will have merchandise to offer her customers when they come to shop.  San Maros is a pretty town that celebrates San Pedro on June 29th with masses, processions and a rodeo with bulls.  She would like to say thank you to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for her loans, “thanks to you we are succeeding.

loans.use: to purchase pottery such as cooking pots, casserole dishes, pitchers, glaze, celite, firewood to sell and to make the cooking pots and casserole dishes.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Petra

texts.es: La señora Petra es originaria de Acteopan, ella tiene 55 años de edad, ella es viuda pera esta a su cargo su sobrina Luisa de 24 años de edad y su tía de 88 años de edad, ella se dedica a la alfarería elabora cazuelas, ollas y jarros y los vende crudos, ella solicito su préstamo para elaborar la loza va a comprar barro, leña, tierra blanca  y una parte para la comida. Ella inicio su negocio desde que era pequeña tenía  15 años de edad y les ayudaba a sus papas ellos le enseñaros a elaborar las cazuelas, ollas y jarros de barro, después se caso y sus suegros le ayudaron le dieron dinero para comprar el material y comenzó su propio negocio elaborando ollas, cazuelas y jarros crudos, este negocio es importante porque de ahí tiene para su mantención vende las cazuelas, ollas o jarros y ya tiene para ir al mercado, este préstamo le da fuerza a su negocio para comprar la materia primas y seguir trabajando y sus sueños y esperanzas son estar bien de salud para seguir en el negocio elaborando y vendiendo cazuelas, ollas y jarros. En San Marcos se celebra el 29 de Junio a San Pedro, hay misas, procesión y toros. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias que me prestan, lo voy a ocupar en el negocio”.
texts.en: Señora Petra is a native of Acteopan.  She is a 55- year old widow but takes care of her 24-year old niece, Luisa, and her 88- year old aunt.  She makes her living making pottery.  She makes clay stew pots, smaller pots and jars.  She sells them unfinished.  Señora Petra is requesting her loan to make her crockery and to purchase clay, firewood, white clay and some food.  Señora Petra began in the business when she was young, just 15 years old.  She helped her parents, who taught her to make the stew pots, smaller pots and jars all from clay.  After she was married, her in-laws helped her by giving her money to purchase the necessary materials and she started her own business making unfinished clay stew pots, smaller pots and jars.  This business is important because she supports herself from it.  She sells her stew pots, smaller pots and jars to have enough money to go to the market.  This loan will give strength to her business so she can purchase her raw materials and keep working.  Señora Petra's dreams and hopes are for good health so she can keep her business going and keep making and selling stew pots, smaller pots and jars.  In San Marcos they celebrate the 29th of June on honor of St. Peter.  There is a mass, a procession and bull fights.  Señora Petra wants to say to Kiva and to "Fundación Realidad," “Thank you for what you have loaned me.  I will use it for my business."

loans.use: to purchase clay, firewood, white clay and food.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Jorgina

texts.es: La señorita  Jorgina es originaria del estado de Puebla, México, ella tiene 27 años de edad, ella es soltera sin hijos, ella se dedica a trabajar en la alfarería elabora cazuelas con su papas y su hermano, ella solicito su crédito para comprar leña, barro, greta y pintura para la elaboración de las cazuelas, a ella desde muy pequeña sus papas le enseñaron a trabajar el barro, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años con unos ahorros que tenia, su negocio es familiar y se siente orgullosa de trabajar la alfarería porque es de generaciones y es un trabajo que le da para comer y para los gastos de su casa, ella y sus papas salen a vender sus productos a las ferias y las utilidades las utiliza comprando mas material, ella está contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir porque va a comprar el material para seguir trabajando, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son las lluvias no pueden trabajar bien no se secan las cazuelas, en San Marcos todos trabajamos el barro elaborando la loza, siembran en tiempos de lluvias maíz y sorgo, el día 25 y 26 de abril celebran la Fiesta del Pueblo San Marcos, hacen misas, procesión y baile. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por este préstamo ya que nos ayuda en los negocio para que sigamos adelante”.
texts.en:
Jorgina, 27, is from the State of Puebla, México.  She is single and has no children. She is a potter; she makes pots with her parents and brother.  

She asked for the loan to buy firewood, clay, “greta” (chemical mixture of copper oxide and lead) and paint to make the pots.  Her parents taught her how to work clay when she was still a little girl.  She started her business ten years ago with some savings she had.  Her business is a family business and she’s proud to be a potter because it’s been their occupation for generations and it’s work that provides food for her and to cover household expenses.  

She and her parents go the various farmers markets to sell their wares and use profits to buy more raw materials to continue working.  The challenge she faces is the rain because it keeps the pots from drying properly and they can’t work.  In San Marcos we all work clay manufacturing the dinnerware.  During the rainy season they farm corn and sorghum.  On the 25th and 26th of April they celebrate the town’s feast day of St. Mark; they have masses, a procession and a dance.  

She wants to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: ”Thank you for this loan because it is of great help to us to continue in business.”

loans.use: to buy firewood, clay, paint and other supplies to make pots.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita vive en la comunidad de Acteopan, tiene 28 años de edad es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo Imanol de 10 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, ella se dedica a la alfarería elabora jarros y cazuelas, ella solicito su crédito para comprar la materia prima como el barro, la leña y la greta,  ella inicio con su negocio hace 10 años sus papas le enseñaron a trabajar el barro desde pequeñas y con un ahorro que tenía guardado en su casa compro el material y comenzó a elaborar los jarros y las cazuelas, para ella es muy importante su negocio porque es el sustento y puede cubrir los gastos de su casa y du su hijo para que siga en sus estudios , ella eta orgullosa con este trabajo porque es herencia de sus papas y le gusta ver que sus jarros y sus cazuelas le quedan muy bonitas, ella sale a vender a las ferias de Tepetlixpa, Ameca meca, ella tiene la esperanza de que su negocio siga creciendo y no falte nada en su casa y que su hijo siga estudiando, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por ayudarnos en nuestro negocio para que siga adelante “. San Marcos es bonito la mayoría se dedica a elaborar la loza o la alfarería, siembra  maíz y sorgo en tiempos de lluvias”.
texts.en:
Margarita, 28, lives in the community of Acteopan.  She is a single mother of a ten-year-old son, Imanol; he is in elementary school.  She is a potter; she makes jugs and pots.  She asked for her loan to buy raw material like clay, firewood and “greta” (chemical mixture based on copper oxide and lead). 

She started her business ten years ago with her parents who taught her how to mold clay when she was still a little girl.  She used a few savings she had at home to buy raw materials and started to make jugs and pots.  For her, the business is very important because it’s the legacy she got from her parents and she likes to see that her jugs and pots turn out to be very beautiful.  She goes out to sell them at the markets in Tepetlixpa and Amecameca.  She has the hope that her business will continue growing and that she’ll not want for anything at home and that her son continues going to school.  

She wants to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you for helping us so that our business can continue making progress.” San Marcos is pretty; most of its residents are potters and during the rainy season they farm corn and sorghum.

loans.use: to buy clay, firewood and "greta" to make jugs and pots.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Jenny Jessenia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rosa De Guadalupe.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yenny, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 17, 14, 13,  12 y 11 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es cerrajero.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganarse algo de dinero  y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar también se dedica a realizar trabajos de belleza, ella realiza cortes de cabello, tinturados, pintado de uñas, entre otras cosas, a veces sus clientes llegan hasta su casa pero la mayor parte del tiempo ella realiza sus trabajos a domicilio ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado en su casa, nos cuenta que lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va bien a pesar de que no cuenta con los instrumentos necesarios, trabaja todos los días cuando sus clientes le llamen.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar unas herramientas de trabajo que necesita como son: una secadora de cabello y una máquina para cortar el cabello. Para el negocio su esposo va a comprar hierro, soldaduras y pinturas  para el taller de cerrajería que tiene en su casa. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y es la tesorera del mismo.
 
Sus sueños son construir su casa ya que la que tenían se les quemo y allí también hacer un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The members of the “Rosa de Guadalupe” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Andrés De Vera Parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Yenny, 32, here.  She’s in a relationship and has five children who are 17, 14, 13, 12 and 11 years old.  The two oldest are in secondary school and the younger ones are in elementary school.  Her husband is a metal worker.

She is a very good housewife.  To earn some money and help her husband cover household expenses she provides beauty salon services.  She does haircuts, hair coloring and applies nail polish, among other things.  Sometimes her customers come to her house but most of the time she goes to their houses to provide the service because she doesn’t have an appropriate space in her house to do so.  She tells us that she’s been in this line of work for five years and does well despite not having all the necessary equipment.  She works every day when customers call her.

She will use this loan to buy work tools like a hair dryer and a hair clipper.  For her husband’s business she will buy iron, solder and paint for the metal shop he has at home.  

She is a founding member of the communal bank and is its Treasurer.  Her dream is to build her house since the one they had burned down and also to set up a beauty salon there.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, a hair clipper, iron, solder and paint.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Doña Erika de 33 años,  de estado civil soltera , con dos  hijos, tiene ya 10 años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y peluches de forma ambulante y en su domicilio los fines de semana. La Sra. Erika  también trabaja como cocinera en una pizzería de nuestra ciudad por las noches. La Sra.   Erika  se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la necesidad, oportunidad y  urgencia que posee de comprar más mercadería y su puesto fijo en un mercado cercano a su vivienda y con esta mercadería desea surtir su nuevo puesto.  Ella  tiene un buen historial de deuda, es cliente antiguo  de la institución con buen comportamiento de pago,  es una persona trabajadora que tiene que sacar adelante a familia sola y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Erika, 33, is single with two children.  She’s been selling clothes and stuffed toys for ten years as a street vendor and on weekends from home.  Erika also works as a cook at a pizzeria in our city in the evening.  

Erika found herself in need of requesting a loan at our institution because of the opportunity and urgency she’s facing to buy more merchandise and a fixed stand in a market near her home; the merchandise will be used to stock the new stand.  

She has good credit history; she’s a longstanding client of the institution and she repaid well.  She is a hard working person who has to move her family forward alone and she’s grateful with the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a stand in her neighborhood market.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina, de 66 años, reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana); ahí formo su familia junto a Justo, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Los largos días de trabajo que tiene Guillermina en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, los plátanos y el café que cultiva, desde hace 30 años están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña. Tiene mucha experiencia realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más importante es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Está segura de hacerlo ya que hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles en su casa, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de la localidad. Y según comenta su prioridad es continuar con la cosecha de café que en este mes está realizando, ya que el precio del grano en el mercado subió considerablemente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Guillermina de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café para la realización de los viveros. Asimismo en el pago del salario a los peones que le ayudan en esta cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 66, lives in the community of Palomar (Peruvian Central Jungle).  She formed her family there with Justo, her husband for the last 7 years.  They have 8 children but only three of them still live at home.  She owns her house.  

The long work days Guillermina spends in her fields have made her very knowledgeable about farming.  The bananas and coffee she’s been farming for 30 years are always well cared for and she always gets good sales prices for her products.  What she most enjoys about her work is tilling the soil because this is what she’s done since she was a little girl.  She has a lot of experience in this line of work and considers the most important thing transporting her products to market in the city of La Merced.  In time, she hopes to buy more land to increase production.  She is sure to do so because a short time ago she opened a grocery store at home where she sells basic need items to local residents.  According to what she tells us her priority is to continue with the coffee harvest which is going on this month because the price of coffee beans rose considerably.

She is a member of the “Aroma de Café’ (Aroma of Coffee) communal bank and this is the fourth loan with MFP where she hopes she’ll get support to reach her goals.  On the other hand, she once again commits to pay her installments like she did in her previous loans.  Also, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very mutually supportive people.

If Guillermina were to get the support, she will use the requested money to buy coffee plants to set up the nursery as well as to pay salaries of laborers that are helping with the coffee harvesting.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and pay laborers to help her with the harvesting.

loans.name: Ubalda

texts.es: La señora Ubalda es de la comunidad de Moyotepec, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 47 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo Amner de 11 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, ella tiene su cocina económica y venta de perfumes y cosméticos de Jafra por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para ampliar su negocio va a comprar mesas para su negocio de comida y va a comprar perfumes de dama, caballero y niños y cosméticos de Jafra,  ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años, como es animadora de Jafra, tiene a su cargo 29 personas, las atiende, les entrega sus catálogos, ella se vio en la necesidad de no salir de su casa y como le gusta cocinar decidió poner su cocina económica se llama “Los Arbolitos” así atiende los dos negocios, a su hijo y cuida su casa, ella está orgullosa de su negocio porque se manda sola, no depende de nadie y le gusta cocinar, le da empleo a dos muchacha una de ella elabora las tortillas a mano y la otra atiende a sus clientes que son visitantes que vienen en sus autos  transitando en la carretera y como está a la orilla de la carretera pasan a comer, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio es el costo del maíz y el frijol, las ganancias las utiliza para dar el pago, comprar trastes para cocinar y para salir a pasear, ella está contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar las mesas para que su negocio se vea más bonito. Sus sueños son que su hijo estudie la universidad para que tenga su carrera y hacer un local para su cocina económica. Moyotepec es de clima cálido, hay campo siembran maíz, cebolla, caña. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, que Dios les Multiplique su ayuda”.
texts.en: Señora Ubalda is from the community of Moyotepec, Ayala, in the state of Morelos, México.  She is 47 years old, married and has 1 son, Amner, who is 11 years old and attends primary school.  Señora Ubalda runs an informal restaurant, and she sells perfumes and cosmetics through the Jafra catalog.  She is requesting the loan to expand her businesses. She is going to purchase tables for her restaurant, women's, men's and children's perfumes and Jafra cosmetics.  She started her business 2 years ago.  As a Jafra consultant, she is responsible for 29 people.  She helps them and gets them their catalogs.  Señora Ubalda found it necessary to stay at home, and since she likes to cook, she decided to open her informal restaurant called “Los Arbolitos” (The Little Trees).  This way, she can take care of both businesses, her son and her home.  Señora Ubalda is proud of her business because she runs it herself and is not dependent on anyone.  And she likes to cook.  She employs two women, one of whom makes the tortillas by hand and the other takes care of the customers.  The customers are travelers passing through on the highway.  And since she is located at the edge of the highway, they come in for something to eat.  The challenge that Señora Ubalda faces with the business is the price of corn and beans.  She uses her earnings to pay her workers, to purchase dishes for cooking, and for her own outings.  Señora Ubalda is happy with the loan she will be receiving, and she will use it to purchase tables so that her business looks nicer.  Her dreams are that her son goes to University and studies a career and to have a store front for her informal restaurant.  Moyotepec has a warm climate and fields where they grow corn, onions and canes.  Señora Ubalda wants to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for the loans.  May god return your generosity many-fold.”

loans.use: to purchase tables for her informal restaurant, women's, men's and children's perfumes and Jafra cosmetics.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: La señora Roberta es de la comunidad de Moyotepec, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 52 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos José Alberto de 34 años de edad, Juan Carlos de 30 años de edad, Blanca Selene de 26 años de edad ellos son casados  y Jezabel de 16 años de edad es soltera está estudiando danza árabe, ella tiene su taller familiar de bordado y deshilado, ella solicito su crédito para comprar materia prima hilos, pellón, tela como tergal, manta, Camboya para elaborar manteles, rebosos, mandiles, servilletas pintadas y bordadas, ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años por necesidad porque era madre soltera y comenzó a trabajar entro a un proyecto del gobierno federal le dieron para comprar sus maquinas de coser, puso su taller familiar de bordado y deshilado donde trabajan ella su esposo y sus hijos, su negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo la familia y se siente orgullosa ver que sus hijas están aprendiendo lo que ella inicio, de trabajar elaborando los rebosos y los manteles hacerles los bordados, los deshilados y verlos ya terminados que son originales y bonitos, su negocio es popular porque es una artesanía especial con diseños de colores en los bordados, ella tiene la esperanza de agrandar el taller para el porvenir de sus hijos, Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “ gracias por su ayuda y que nos sigan apoyando con los prestamos”. Moyotepec es un pueblo bonito hay campo siembra maíz, caña de clima cálido.
texts.en:
Roberta is from the community of Moyotepec, Ayala in the State of Morelos, México.  She is 52 years old, separated and has four children: José Alberto, 34, Juan Carlos, 30, Blanca Selene, 26, all married and Jezebel, 16, who is single and studying belly dancing.  

She has a family embroidery and openwork workshop.  She asked for her loan to buy raw materials: thread, fleece, Tergal (polyester), cotton skirting and twill to make tablecloths, shawls, aprons, painted and embroidered napkins.  She started her business 25 years ago due to need because she was a single mother and needed to work.  She enrolled in a program sponsored by the federal government that gave her her sewing machines.  She set up her family embroidery and openwork shop where she, her husband and her children work.  Her business is important because the family has employment and she is proud to see that her daughters are learning what she began; they work making the shawls and embroidering the tablecloths, the open work and to see them finished in such an original and pretty way.  Her business is popular because it’s special craftsmanship with colored embroidered designs.  Her hope is to enlarge the workshop for her children’s future.

She wants to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you for your help and please continue to support us with the loans.” 

Moyotepec is a pretty town.  It has fields of corn and sugar cane.  The weather is hot.

loans.use: to buy thread, fleece, Tergal (polyester), cotton skirting, twill, etc.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha es de la comunidad de Moyotepec, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 61 años de edad, ella es sola tiene 4 hijos María Luisa de 42 años de edad, Francisca Susana de 40 años de edad, Bertha de 38 años de edad, Israel de 29 años de edad, todos sus hijos ya son casados e independientes, ella vende colchas, cobertores y cortinas, ella solicito su crédito para comprar colchas, cobertores y cortinas, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años con un dinero que tenía guardado de su trabajo anterior, por iniciativa propia y por la necesidad de recursos económicos, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos en Moyotepec con sus vecinas y conocidas es ambulante va caminando o en transporte colectivo, su negocio es importante porque gana es el sustento para sobrevivir y puede obtener ganancias para volver a surtirse de mercancía, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son el clima en tiempo de calor bajan su ventas. Moyotepec es un pueblo bonito se celebra el 6 de enero la fiesta del Pueblo celebran a los reyes Magos hay misas, primeras comuniones, bautizos, baile, toros, hay campo siembran maíz, cebolla, caña, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando en las ventas de sus colchas, cobertores y cortinas y que sus hijos estén bien y que sigan adelante con sus hijos y sus familias, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “les damos las gracias, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante y se pueden realizar los  sueños de progresar y que sigan ayudando a más personas”.
texts.en:
Bertha, 61, is from Moyotepec, Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is single  and has 1 son and 3 daughters: Maria Luisa, 42, Francisca Susana, 40, Bertha, 38 and Israel, 29.  All are married and living on their own.
She sells mattresses, bedspreads, and curtains.  By her own initiative  and because of  her financial need, she started her business 10 years ago with money that she had saved from her previous work.  She is requesting the loan to buy mattresses, bedspreads and curtains.  She sells these items in Moyotepec to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She is a street merchant and walks or takes communal taxis.  Her business is important because it is her only source of income and she can make a profit and reinvest in purchasing merchandise.
The challenge that she faces with her business is that during the hot season, sales drop.

Moyotepec is a pretty town that holds its Saint’s Day on January 6th, the three Kings.  There are masses, first communions, baptisms, dances, and bullfighting.  There are fields where corn, onions, and sugar cane are planted.
Her dreams and hopes are to continue working, selling mattresses, bedspreads and curtains and that her son and daughters are well and get ahead with their children and their families.

She wants to tell Kiva and the Realidad Foundation that she gives them thanks, and thanks to you, we can get ahead and continue progressing and realize our dreams and help more people.

loans.use: To buy mattresses, bedspreads and curtains

loans.name: Berenice

texts.es: La señora Berenice vive en Moyotepec, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 35 años de edad, ella es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos Enrique de 15 años de edad está estudiando la secundaria y Armando tiene 2 años de edad, ella vende frutas, verduras y chicharrones preparados frente a la casa de su mama, ella solicito su crédito para comprar jitomates, tomates, chiles, plátanos, cebollas, cilantro, epazote, ajos, papayas, manzanas etc. para vender,  Ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año, el papa de su hijo le dio para comprar las frutas y las verduras y su papa la llevaba en su camioneta a comprar la mercancía a la  central de abastos, su negocio es importante porque es un ingreso para la familia de ahí pueden darle a su hijo para la escuela, también pueden comer fruta y verdura ella y sus hijos para que estén sanos y contentos, ella está orgullosa de su negocio porque puede conocer gente y tener nuevas amistades, sus sueños y esperanzas son arreglar los cuartos de sus hijos para que tengan su propio espacio y comprar un carro, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por apoyarnos, con su ayuda vamos a salir adelante nuestra familia y los negocios”.  Moyotepec es bonito, es tranquilo hay campos siembran caña, maíz, cebolla.
texts.en:
Berenice, 35, lives in Moyotepec, Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, México.  She is a single mother of two children:  Enrique, 15, and in secondary school and Armando, 2.  She sells fruit, vegetables and prepared fried pork skin in her mother’s front yard.  

She requested a loan to buy red tomatoes, green tomatoes, chilies, bananas, onions, cilantro, skunk weed, garlic, papaya, apples, etc. to sell.  She started her business a year ago.  Her son’s father gave her money to buy fruit and vegetables and her father would take her to buy merchandise at the wholesale foodstuffs market in his van.  Her business is important because it’s the family’s source of income that she can use pay for her son’s education.  She and her children can also consume fruit and vegetables so that they’ll be healthy and happy.

She is proud of her business because she can get to know people and make new friends.  Her dreams and hopes are to fix up her children’s rooms so that they can have space of their own and to buy a car.  She wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you for supporting us.  With your help we will get ahead with our families and businesses.” 

Moyotepec is pretty and peaceful.  It has sugar cane, corn and onion fields.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Mechoacan Group

texts.es:
Santa C. D. Mechoacan este grupo se llama así porque todas sus integrantes viven en el barrio Santa C. y su localidad es Santa Catarina Mechoacan es por el cual le denominaron así. Todas sus integrantes se dedican a diferentes actividades economicas el cual les ayuda a sobrevivir economicamente, estas mujeres son D. raza indigena muy trabajadoras. 
La señora Rosalba es una D. las integrantes D. este grupo esta casada con el señor Aurelio quien se dedica a las labores del campo, tiene 5 hijos D. las respectivas edades (15, 13, 12, 10 y 8) D. los cuales 2 estudian y 3 trabajan.
Rosalba solicito el prestamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración D. antojitos, ya que ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en donD. venD. enchiladas, tacos dorados, sopes y tostadas, ella tiene 6 meses que inicio con este negocio, debido a la necesidad que tenia ya que el dinero que obtiene su esposo D. las cosechas no le alcanza y por ello ella inicio con este negocio.
Con el credito ella comprara los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración D. sus productos, ella comenta que existe competencia pero espera en dios que le valla muy bien en su ventas, ya que D. las ganancias que obtenga es para el apoyo en los gastos D. la casa y en la educación D. sus dos hijos.
Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos estudien; y tener su propia fonda económica.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Rosalba, Angelica, Soledad, Estela, Iganacia, Altagracia, Ilda (Venta D. antojitos)
Celerina y Emilia (Venta D. pollos)
Reyna (Elaboracion D. ollas D. barro)
texts.en:
This group is called “Santa C. D. Mechoacan” because all its members live in the Santa C. neighborhood and their location is Santa Catarina Mechoacan and that’s why they named it so.  Each member is in a different line of work that helps her survive economically.  These women are indigenous people and very hard working.

Rosalba is one of the group’s members.  She’s married to Aurelio who is a farmer.  She has five children who are 15, 13, 12, 10 and 8 years of age.  Two of them are in school and three of them work.

Rosalba requested the loan to buy ingredients to make fast food snacks because she has a small business at home where she sells enchiladas, crispy tacos, sopes and tostadas.  She started the business six months ago due to the need she had because the money her husband earns from crops is insufficient and this is why she started the business.

She will use the loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make her products.  She comments that competition does exist but, God willing; she’ll do very well in her sales.  Profits she may earn are to help cover household expenses and for her two children’s education.  Her greatest wish is that her children stay in school so that they will have their own source of income.

The members of the group are:

Rosalba, Angélica, Soledad, Estela, Ignacia, Altagracia, Ilda (Fast Food Sales)
Celerina y Emilia (Chicken Sales)
Reyna (Clay Pot Making)

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fast food snacks.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania, de 59 años, reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Ignacio, su esposo, desde hace 27 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, a los que criaron y educaron con mucho cariño y esmero. Ahora ellos viven solos en su casa propia. Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cafetales y platanales, los cuales sus frutos los  venderá en la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Pero ve que su sacrificio es recompensado, cuando vende a los mayoristas que visitan su zona constantemente, obteniendo buenas ganancias, Ahora ella se encuentra en cosecha de café, donde está segura podrá obtener los resultados que espera. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien vende pescado a los pobladores de su localidad, realizando la venta de casa en casa.  Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera un pequeño préstamo para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Melania de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café que están creciendo sin mayores dificultades.
texts.en: Melania, who is 59 years old, lives in the Palomar community (in the central Peruvian jungle).  There, she raised her family together with her husband of 27 years, Ignacio.  They had 3 children, who they raised and educated with love and great care.  Now they live alone in their own home.  By working arduously, Melania has been successful in improving her fields.  Every morning, she gets up very early to water her plantings and to offer the same care to her coffee plants and her banana plants.  She sells her fruits in the city of La Merced, which is where she gets the best prices for her products.  What she likes best about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been doing this for 30 years and considers that the most difficult part is having to work the soil.  But she sees that she is compensated for her sacrifice when she is able to sell to the wholesalers who frequently visit the area, and from whom she receives good earnings.  She is currently in the midst of the coffee harvest, and she is sure that she will obtain the results she was hoping for.  In addition, she has the support of her husband, who sells fish door-to-door in the settlements in their area.  In time, she hopes to be able to improve her fields so she can plant a lot more coffee.  Melania belongs to the communal bank “Aroma de Café” (Coffee Aroma), and this is her fourth loan with MFP, where she hopes for a small loan to achieve her goals.  She promises to, once again, comply with the repayment schedule, like she has with previous loans.  In addition, Melania is thankful for being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  When Melania receives her support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of some sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee plants, which are growing without great difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase some sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 39 años, el es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, vive en una comunidad  pequeña ubicada en el campo en una zona rural a 10 minutos  de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

Gilberto se dedica a la  comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado caprino y ovino, haci como aves, los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio.  Gilberto se dedica a esta labor desde hace 10 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Gilberto está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder invertir en reces, de tal forma ir aumentando su ganado e ir incrementando sus ingresos, Gilberto  también se proyecta a adquirir una unidad móvil con la cual pueda transportar sus animales, y así agilizar mas sus ventas.

Gilberto es una  persona emprendedora y responsable, el desea poder crecer como empresario y poder alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 39, is single living in his parents’ house in a small community located in the countryside in a rural zone 10 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.

Gilberto sell animals.  Among them we have primarily goats and sheep as well as fowl that are located in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants who always frequent the area where he lives.  He runs his business from home.  Gilberto has been in this line of work for 10 years which is to say he knows it to perfection.

Gilberto is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to invest in cattle in order to increase his herd size and income.  He also plans to acquire a vehicle to transport his animals thus speeding up his sales.

Gilberto is an enterprising, very responsible person who wants to grow as a businessman to attain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Martina Moserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martina, tiene 37 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen  cuatro hijos de 16, 15, 11 y 9 años de edad los mismos que estudian tres en  colegio y  el menor en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar realiza los quehaceres domésticos en una casa en las mañanas, en las tardes pone un puesto en el centro de la ciudad en la cual vende empanadas de verde y corviches, productos  que ella misma prepara, allí trabaja desde las 14h00 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que lleva con este pequeño negocio tres años y que le ha servido de mucho ya que gracias a lo que ha ganado ha podido ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, porque lo que gana su esposo no les alcanza muchas veces ni para la comida.

Este crédito es para comprar plátano, maní, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus productos. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
The “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its world renown crafts; it is the home of the famous Panama straw hat.

We met Martina, 37, in this place.  She’s married and has four children who are 16, 15, 11 and 9 years old.  Three of them go to secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She is a very good housewife who works as a domestic employee in a home during the morning to help her husband meet household expenses.  In the afternoon she sets up a stand downtown where she sells “empanadas de verde” (turnovers made from green bananas) and “corviches” (deep fried banana dough stuffed with onions, fish and peanuts) that she herself makes.  She works there from 2pm until 7pm.  She tells us that she’s had this small business for three years and it’s been very useful for her because thanks to what she’s earned there she’s been able to help pay for her children’s schooling because what her husband earns often doesn’t even suffice for food.

This loan is to buy bananas, peanuts, meat, fish and other ingredients needed to prepare her products.  She’s been in the communal bank for four cycles and likes it because of the benefits she gets from the bank.  Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy bananas, peanuts, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS LIRIOS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maribel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: atención de pensión, venta de ropa, venta de detergentes, venta de figuras para chiflaría. 

La señora Maribel indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chiflaría (productos para realizar rituales culturales), el cual inicio al ver la capacidad de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para comprar azúcar, para la elaboración de estos productos. Posterior a la elaboración este producto lo venderá en los comercios de la ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.

En la foto encontramos a la prima de señora Maribel, que acompaño al grupo.
texts.en:
The association 'Los Lirios' (The Irises) will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the Senkata Centre. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive committee led by Maribel. The community group's members carry out a range of activities, including hotel reception and the sale of clothes, detergent and figurines used in cultural rituals. 

Maribel told us that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer after being invited to participate by their promoter. She currently runs a business selling products used in cultural rituals which she began after observing her husband's capabilities in the same field.

Maribel will use this loan to purchase sugar to make her products, after which she will sell them to the merchants of El Alto's commercial zone. This work allows her to generate an income to support her partner and their son.

When we asked Maribel what she liked about Pro Mujer, she told us that she liked health. 

In the photo we can see Maribel's cousin who took part in the group.

loans.use: to puchase sugar

loans.name: Florecitas De Santa Ana Tlapaltitlan Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Florecitas de Santa Ana Tlapaltitlan" ubicado en el estado de México. Esta conformado por nueve integrantes entre ellas se encuentra la señora Ines, ella esta casada desde hace 27 años, tiene 4 hijos; la señora nos platica que lleva 15 años vendiendo flores y tiene un pequeño invernadero, ella vende en las calles ya que las necesidades en su familia eran cada vez mayores y los ingresos tanto de su esposo como los de ella no eran suficientes, Ines esta muy entusiasmada en que su negocio crezca anhela tener un local para vender arreglos florales, con el prestamo que le brinden va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de esta manera va a poder tener más variedad de flores para cultivarlas y así vender en mayor cantidad. Su sueño es brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir estudiandoen y algun día lograr una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This group is called “Florecitas de Santa Ana Tlapaltitlan”, which is located in the State of Mexico and has nine members.

One of the members is Sra. Ines. She is 27 years old, married, and has four children. Sra. Ines says that she has been selling flowers for 15 years and manages a small greenhouse. She sells her products on the street. The needs of her family keep growing each time, and the incomes that both she and her husband generate are not sufficient. Ines is very excited about growing her business and hopes to have a shop where she can sell floral arrangements. This loan will allow her to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and seeds so that she can cultivate a wider variety of flowers and sell them in larger quantities. Her dream is to provide her children with the opportunity to continue their studies so that they can earn a professional degree someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for cultivating flowers.

loans.name: Juarez Group

texts.es: Este grupos solidario se llama Juárez, está Ubicado en San Andrés Cuauhtempan, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por la señora Ana Laura va a comprar con su crédito aceite para mantenimiento de sus maquinas, la señora Gabriela y la señorita Noemí van a comprar maíz para sembrar, cosechar y vender. El señor Ismael va a comprar fertilizante y abono para el nopal, el tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre tiene 1 hija Ana Itzel de 4 años de edad, el tiene su parcela de nopal y solicito su crédito para comprar abono para abonar su siembra de nopal y produzca mas, para vender, también siembra maíz, el inicio su negocio hace 3 años su papa le enseño a trabajar en el campo, el siembra nopal, maíz y cuenta con borregos para crianza, su negocio es importante porque va saliendo para ir comiendo, lo que más le gusta es cuando corta el nopal y lo vende, este negocio es muy conocido internacionalmente por sus propiedades alimenticias y curativas, los desafíos que enfrenta su siembra de nopal es el clima en temporal le salen manchas, cuando graniza rompe el nopal, sus sueños y esperanza son crecer la siembra de nopal, componer su casa hacer mas cuartos, crecer su negocio de borregos y que no le falte nada a su hija que estudie y que crezca sana. San Andrés Cuauhtempan es un pueblo bonito ahí el nació, cuenta con todos los servicios, es de clima templado, siembran maíz, jitomate, nopal, frijol, tomate. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por apoyarnos con sus préstamo, por la confianza que nos dan y que nos sigan apoyando cada día mas, vamos a salir bien en los pagos para que nos sigan apoyando”.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Juárez” is located in San Andrés Cuautempan, which is in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The members are as follows: • Sra. Ana Laura will use her loan to buy oil for maintaining her machines. • Sra. Gabriela and Srta. Noemí will buy corn to plant, harvest, and sell. • Sr. Ismael will buy fertilizers and compost for growing “nopal” (the edible leaves of the prickly pear cactus).

Sr. Ismael is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a four-year-old daughter named Ana Itzel. He owns a parcel of land on which he grows nopal. Ismael is requesting a loan to buy compost for fertilizing his crop of nopal so that he can produce more to sell. He also grows corn. Ismael started his business three years ago. His father taught him how to work in the fields and grow nopal and corn. Ismael also raises sheep. His business is important because it enables him to get ahead and feed his family. The part he enjoys most is harvesting and selling the nopal. This type of business is recognized internationally because the nopal is known for its flavor and medicinal properties. His main challenge is dealing with the weather during the harvest season. If there is hail, the impact from the hail will leave marks and cuts on the nopal leaves.

His hopes and dreams include increasing his nopal harvest, adding more rooms to his house, growing his sheep business, and seeing that his daughter grows up healthy and lacks nothing in her education. San Andrés Cuauhtempan is a beautiful town and Ismael was born there. It receives all services and has a mild climate. The crops that are grown there include corn, nopal, beans, and both red and green tomatoes.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for supporting and trusting us with this loan. We appreciate the continued support each day and plan to succeed in submitting our payments.”

loans.use: to purchase compost for fertilizing a crop of "nopal".

loans.name: La Esperanza De Los Pobres Group

texts.es:
La señora Magday  tiene treinta y un años de edad ella es casad y a su responsabilidad están cuatro hijos y son: Weimar de doce años de edad, Abimael de diez años de edad, Yuriana de seis años de edad y el más pequeño es Marvin de cinco años de edad.

     Ella se dedica  desde hace  tres años a la compra y venta de artículos de la marca  avon, jafra y fuler y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de más mercancías para  que así mejor sea su compra de cosas y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan y le encargan.

   Comenta que por su propia creatividad inicio con este tipo de trabajo para que ha sí apoye a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y con los ahorros que valla obteniendo  darle una vida mejor a sus hijos que están creciendo y no les haga falta lo más necesario.

    Su más grande deseo es que con el préstamo que ha  solicitado pueda mejorar su calidad de compra y con el tiempo tener su propia actividad y así seguir apoyando a sus  hijos a que sigan estudiando.

    Las señoras  que integran el grupo son  la señora: Dilia, quien se dedica a la  compra  y venta de pollos aliñados (destazados), también se integra la señora Evangelina, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos.
texts.en:
Sra. Magday is 31 years old, married, and responsible for four children: Weimar (age 12), Abimael (age 10), Yuriana (age 6), and Marvin (age 5).

For the past three years, she has been buying and selling products from the Avon, Jafra, and Fuller brands. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise. Magday says that it is better to buy products and keep them on hand so that customers can find what they need when placing their orders.

She indicates that she had to be creative when starting this type of business. Magday is able to support her husband with the household income and provide a better life for her children. As a result, they will be able to grow and not lack in the necessities.

Her greatest wish is that the loan she requested will help improve the quality of her purchases. Eventually she wants to have an established business and continue supporting her children with their studies.

The other women in the group are as follows: • Dilia buys and sells butchered chickens. • Evangelina buys and sells cheese.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics of various brands.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban, de 49 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí vive desde hace 12 años en su casa propia, cuidando con mucho esmero de sus cultivos. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura; donde trabaja arduamente en su siembra, con el tiempo logró obtener 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas propios. Desde entonces cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plátanos y café, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Pero en temporada de cosecha de café, que se realiza una vez al año, vende su producción a la cooperativa de la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. “Me gusta sembrar”, concluye. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de Café” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Esteban de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus cultivos de café que recién sembró. Asimismo en el pago del salario a los peones que le están apoyando en esta campaña de cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Esteban, age 49, resides in the community of Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle. He has lived there for 12 years and owns a home. Esteban looks after his crops with great care. His main business activity is farming. He works hard on his farm where he owns four hectares of land. Every morning he wakes up early so that he can water and look after his banana and coffee plants. Esteban sells his produce in the city of La Merced where he is able to get the best prices for his crops. During the coffee harvesting season, which occurs once a year, he sells his coffee beans to a cooperative in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar.
