What he enjoys most about his job is the freedom of working in the green fields. Esteban has been farming for 10 years and considers the most difficult part to be having to work every day because he is left with little time to devote to other activities. Later on, he hopes to acquire more land so that he can grow citrus fruits because these items currently sell the best. “I enjoy farming,” says Esteban.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Aroma de Café” (Scent of Coffee) and will be receiving his third loan from MFP. Esteban hopes that this support will help him achieve his goals. For this reason, he promises once again to complete his payments on time, just as he did with his previous loans. He is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. With the loan he received, Esteban will invest in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on the coffee plants he recently planted. In addition, he will pay the salary of his workers who have helped him during the coffee harvesting season.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and to pay the salary of his workers.

loans.name: Angela Felisa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 49 años de edad, actualmente mantiene una relación de unión libre pero de otro compromiso que tuvo hace varios años tuvo tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad. Su actual marido es chofer. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en un taller que enseñaba esta rama artesanal.
 
Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller para que les elabore sus prendas, también cose uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad en temporadas de clases. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar: telas, hilos, botones, cierres  y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta todo del banco.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received attention on a national and international level. This place is where the famous Panama hats are made.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Angela. She is 49 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three adult children from a previous relationship. Her current husband is a chauffeur. She learned sewing and dressmaking several years ago at a workshop that provided classes in various crafts.

Angela has a small sewing business where she has worked many years as a seamstress. She makes all types of garments and works according to orders she receives from customers who come to her establishment and are in need of clothes. Angela also makes uniforms for businesses, schools, and colleges whenever classes are in session. She works every day from 6am until 10pm, and sometimes even later whenever she has orders to be delivered.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials. She has been with the Communal Bank for five loan cycles and enjoys everything about it. Her dreams are to have a much larger business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Tracey L.

texts.en:
When Tracey started Elegant Minerals in 2006, she did not know how successful her all-natural cosmetics line would be.  She only knew that she had a business opportunity that allowed her to earn money while staying at home with her five children.  At the time, Tracey and her husband, Joe, were supporting their family with his salary as a manager at 7-Eleven and money Tracey made from her eBay business.  Not wanting to go into debt, they started with a modest budget of $145 a month to get Elegant Minerals started.  Now, five years later, Elegant Minerals offers over 300 all-natural cosmetic products to women around the world.

Tracey became interested in all-natural cosmetics after having her third child.  The cosmetic products she used at the time caused her skin to break out, prompting her to begin a trial-and-error period of testing countless cosmetic brands.  She says she tried everything from the most expensive brands to the cheapest without seeing improvement.  As she researched common ingredients used in cosmetics, she discovered that many brands claiming to be “all-natural” still use synthetic ingredients that can irritate skin.  Only after switching to cosmetics with 100% all-natural ingredients did her skin improve.  Tracey reasoned that she couldn’t be the only woman whose skin reacted to cosmetics with synthetic ingredients.  With this assumption, she began building the business model for Elegant Minerals.

Elegant Minerals sells its products to people all over the world.  Through online advertising, Elegant Minerals has become known for their affordable and quality cosmetic products.  Recently, Elegant Minerals was recognized on the Martha Stewart Living Radio as one of the best all-natural cosmetic brands.  This summer, Elegant Minerals will be featured in the independent movie “Liquorice.”  Elegant Minerals has donated its products to be used for the actors’ makeup, and will benefit from the publicity of having their products placed in the movie. 

Elegant Minerals has a diversified sales approach.  While Tracey estimates that roughly 80% of Elegant Minerals’ sales are through their website, they also sell their products through salons, spas and independent contractors.  Tracey says that the independent contractors tend to be stay-at-home moms wanting to earn a living without sacrificing time with their kids.  Recently, Elegant Minerals reached an agreement with a large cosmetic corporation to sell Elegant Minerals products under the corporation’s name and label.  Regardless of where Elegant Minerals is purchased, the price is always the same.  This diversified sales strategy provides multiple avenues for market penetration.  

Tracey and Joe recently built an addition to their house that will serve as their new office.  The cost of this new addition has put pressure on cash flow they need to maintain their business. This loan will be used to order hairbrushes with their personalized logo.  These hairbrushes are an accessory sold at retail outlets carrying Elegant Minerals’ products.

Here is the link to their website http://www.elegantminerals.com/, and here is the link to a blog post on Martha Stewart’s website discussing Elegant Minerals.  http://bit.ly/iVGBPN

loans.use: to pay for a shipment of hairbrushes.

loans.name: Tanya Marisol

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tanya, tiene 31 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvieron tres hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio.
 
Ella es una gran madre que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica a trabajar como guardia de seguridad en una empresa en la ciudad de Manta, pero además de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, nos cuenta que todas las noches ella visita a sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra por semanas, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace varios años  y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received attention on a national and international level. This place is where the famous Panama hats are made.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Tanya. She is 31 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children in school (ages 16, 14, and 11).

Tanya is a good mother who makes sure that her children lack nothing. She works as a security guard for a company in the city of Manta. In addition, she sells all types of clothing by going door-to-door and taking requests. She says that she visits her customers in the evenings to offer them her products. Tanya extends credit and then collects payments on a weekly basis. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil as needed. Tanya has been in this business for ten years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Tanya has been with the Communal Bank for several years and enjoys the convenience of the payments. Her dream is to see her children finish their studies so that they can become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Javier Yvan

texts.es:
Javier  tiene 39 años de edad, el vive en casa de su suegra, la cual está ubicada  en una zona  urbana marginal, la vivienda cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe, la zona donde vive es  pueblo joven en el distrito de la Victoria a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Javier  se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte público, el cuenta con una mototaxi (moto, con cabina para transportar personas). Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años.  En este tiempo el a adquirido clientela fija, experiencia en el rubro

Javier está  solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800  nuevos soles para poder realizar un mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, con sus respectivas actualizaciones de documentos y para comprar más mercadería para su negocio de verduras.

Javier es una persona bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Javier is 39 years old and lives in his mother-in-law's home which is located in a poor, urban area.  The house has electricity, piped water and sewerage.  The area in which Javier lives is a young village in Victoria district, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Javier's business is providing a public transport service.  He owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He has been in this business for three years.  Over the years he has acquired regular customers and experience in the field.

Javier is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can carry out some maintenance work on his vehicle as well as update some documents and buy more merchandise for a vegetable business that he has.

Javier is a hard-working person who strives to get ahead every day so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.  People who know him consider him to be a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance work on his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 46 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Custodio, su esposo desde hace 26 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, ahora solo cuidan y educan a 2 de ellos en su casa propia.  La principal actividad económica de la localidad es la siembra de café. Por ello desde niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y saber producirla. Ya cuando formó su familia comenzó a producir sus cultivos por ella misma, de eso hace 12 años promedio. Sus principales sembríos constan de café, plátano y piña de la variedad “única”, los cuales abono y cuida constantemente, ya que es el único sustento familiar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el apoyo que recibe de parte de su esposo, con quien traslada su cosecha a la cooperativa “Ecológica Chanchamayo”, donde comercializa toda su mercadería, “es un lugar seguro”, afirma. Asimismo comenta que hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles en su localidad, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su comunidad, Esta idea lo concreto gracias al apoyo de sus hijos quienes le incentivaron a tener un dinero extra en temporadas del año donde no existe cosecha de café.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para poder concretar sus objetivos, y se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas. María de obtener su colaboración, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
María, age 46, resides in the community of Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle.  She and her husband Custodio have been together for 26 years.  They have seven children, but only two still live with them and attend school.  María and her husband own their own home.  Her main business activity is growing coffee.  When she was a young girl, María’s parents taught her how to work the land and make it productive.  When she started her family, she began producing crops in the same manner and has been doing this for 12 years.  Her main crops include coffee, bananas, and a variety of pineapple called “única”.  She fertilizers and monitors her crops constantly since they help to sustain her family.  What she enjoys most about her work is the support she receives from her husband, since he is responsible for transporting their crops to the Chanchamayo Ecological Cooperative, where they sell all of their crops.  “It is a safe place,” María says.  She indicates that she recently opened a grocery store in her community where she sells basic necessities to the local residents.  Her children suggested this idea so that they would have extra money if there was ever a time when they were not able to harvest coffee.  

María is a member of the Communal Bank “Aroma de Café” (Scent of Coffee) and this is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes that this support will help her accomplish her goals and is committed to paying punctually.  In addition, María is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals.  With this assistance, María will invest her loan in the purchase of basic necessities to restock her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessities to restock her store.

loans.name: Mariana Cecilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mariana tiene años 33 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  un hijo de nueve años de edad que estudian en escuela. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia en Montecristi.  Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser, ella confecciona  ropa deportiva, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, nos cuenta que lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le gusta lo que hace ya que además de ganarse la vida honradamente también está  al tanto del cuidado de su hijo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres  y otros materiales para la costura.
 
Su sueño es que nunca le falte trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received attention on a national and international level. This place is where the famous Panama hats are made.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Mariana. She is 33 years old and a single mother with a nine-year-old son who is in school. Mariana learned sewing and dressmaking several years ago at a school in Montecristi. She lives at the home of her parents. Mariana has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the assistance the loans have given her.

She has a small workshop where she has been sewing for many years. Mariana makes sportswear and works based on orders from customers who come to her establishment. She works every day from 6am to 10pm, and sometimes much later when she has orders to deliver. Mariana says that she has been in business for four years. She also likes the fact that she is able to earn an honest living so that she can take care of her son.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials. Her dream is to always have work to do.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic grains, detergents, soups, matches, toilet paper, and other products.

loans.name: Carlos Leonel

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 37 años de edad, el es casado, cuenta con casa  propia, en la que reside con sus esposa e hijos, su esposa se desempeña en la venta de productos de belleza, actividad con la que apoya a carlos desde su casa , que esta ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura en el norte del Perú.

Carlos se dedica a desarrollar labores de agricultura desde hace varios años, el suele sembrar distintos tipos de tubérculos. Además se dedica a la comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado ovino los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive

Carlos desea dar mantenimiento a su cultivo y ampliar corral de sus animales para lo que  cuenta con una experiencia de más de 15 años. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles, para solventar dichos gastos.

Carlos es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old, married, and owns his own home where he lives together with his wife and children.  His wife sells beauty products and, through her business, she supports Carlos.  She works from their home which is located in Tambogrande district, in Piura department, in the north of Peru.

Carlos has been farming for several years.  He usually grows different types of tubers.  He also sells animals, mainly sheep, which he keeps in an area behind his home.  When they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the traders who always visit his area.

Carlos would like to care for his crops and expand his animal pen (he has more than 15 years experience raising animals).  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, in order to cover these expenses.

Carlos is a calm and responsible person.  His greatest wish is to grow as a businessman and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to care for his crops and expand his animal pens

loans.name: Gladiz Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gladiz, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18  y 15  años de edad los mismos que estudian en un instituto. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella y sus esposo tienen una granja en la cual se dedican a la cría de pollos, nos cuenta que en temporadas crian hasta 200 pollos los mismos que los tienen por espacio de dos a tres meses y luego cuando están listos para la venta los entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta su granja o también los pelan y entregan por libras a tiendas o venden por libras a los vecinos y allegados.  Tienen su granja ya por 8 años y que poco apoco la han ido mejorando con el paso del tiempo.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Ella ingreso en el segundo ciclo del banco comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que reciben los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda comercial.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received attention on a national and international level. This place is where the famous Panama hats are made.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Gladiz. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 18 and 15) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have a farm where they raise chickens. They can have up to 200 chickens during a period of two to three months. When they are ready, the animals are sold to merchants who come to her farm. Gladiz also butchers the chickens and delivers them by the pound to stores or sells them to neighbors and relatives. She has managed her farm for eight years and has improved it gradually over time.

This loan will be used to buy more chickens, as well as feed and medicines so that the birds can develop properly. She joined the Communal Bank when it started its second loan cycle. Gladiz likes the speed in which she has received the loans.

Her dream is to have a commercial store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, poultry feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 24 años, convive con Nilton, de 30 años. Producto de su amor, nació Luis, de 4 años de edad. En unión familiar, los tres viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Cuando era niña, su papá tenia una cajonería (fabrica de cajos de madera que se utiliza para envasar frutas), en ahí aprendió este oficio y desde entonces hasta hoy, se dedica a ello, pero no trabaja para su padre, debido a los constantes problemas de enfermedad que sufría le impidieron surgir y, tubo que cerrar. Ahora Jessica trabaja, para terceros, donde todas las mañanas realiza un promedio de 300 cajones diarios, los cuales después se comercializa a diferentes partes del país. Pero hace algún tiempo su suegro le regaló una hectárea de terreno agrícola, donde comenzó a sembrar. Lo que más le gusta a Jessica, es dedicar la mayor parte del día en sus sembríos de café y plátanos. Ya tienen 2 años dedicándose a ello. Y se siente feliz y realizada, ya que es “su propio negocio”, afirma. Por eso con las 2 hectáreas de terrenos que heredó de su madre hace poco desea sembrar en mayores cantidades. Este mes dio un gran paso en la siembra de café que con muchos cuidados dará su primer fruto dentro de 2 años. Lo que le molesta a ella es la lejanía de su terreno agrícola, donde tiene que caminar muchas horas para poder llegar. Pero consiente de su buenos ingresos ella está ahorrando para comprar su casa propia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Jessica de adquirir su apoyo, comprará plantitas de café para sembrar en el espacio de terreno agrícola faltante.
texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old,lives with Nilton who is 30 years old, and 4 year old Luis is a product of their love.  The family of three live in a rented home located in the Puente Paucartambo community ( Peruvian central jungle).  When she was a child her dad had had a company ( factory that made wooden drawers used to pack fruit) and it was there where she learned her current trade.  She no longer works for her father due to consistent health problems that inhibited him from keeping it open. Now, Jessica works 3rd shift and by morning she averages 300 completed drawers daily which are then sold to different parts of the country.  However, some time ago her father-in-law gave her a hectare of farmland where she has already begun planting.  What Jessica likes most is to dedicate the majority of her days tending to her coffee and banana crops.  They have been at it for 2 years now and she feels happy and accomplished since it is her own business, she affirms.  This is why she wants to plant in larger quantities with the 2 hectares of land she inherited from her mother.  This month she made great strides in planting coffee and after much care she will have her 1st harvest in 2 years.  The only thing that bothers her is the far distance of her planting grounds since she has to walk many hours just to get there.  Conscious of her good earnings, she is saving to be able to purchase her own home. 
She belongs to the comunal bank, Luz del Futuro " (Light of the Future). This is her 3rd loan with MFP, a financial supporter she is counting on in order to achieve her goals.  On the other hand she pledges to fulfill her payments as she has with previous loans.  She enjoys being a part of her comunal bank because all of its members show solidarity and are responsible.  With your support Jessica will purchase small coffee plants for the remaining farmland.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena, de 21 años, es una mujer un poco tímida pero trabajadora y hábil; ella vive con su mamá y su hermano Frank de 16 años, en una casa alquila ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Como mujer soltera, Lorena piensa que lo más importante es pensar en su futuro y el de su familia, por ello desde hace 3 años, logró comprar un pequeño terreno donde siembra plátanos, maíz y café; que después los vende a los compradores que visitan los fines de semana la comunidad nativa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, trabajar la chacra y la ayuda incondicional de su hermano Frank; “eso me incentiva a salir adelante”, menciona. En este mes se encuentra muy ocupada, ya que deposita todo su esfuerzo en la cosecha de café que tiene. “Esta es la única temporada donde se pueda obtener ingresos”, afirma. En su hectárea de café y plátano está logrando adquirir buenos frutos y eso gracias a la fuerza que su juventud le otorga. Por ello está ahorrando para comprar más terrenos de cultivo y así sembrar mayor cantidad de café, a pesar de no contar con un capital de trabajo propio, pero está segura de poder hacer realidad su objetivo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Lorena, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café que hace poco sembró.
texts.en:
Lorena, 21 years old, is a slightly timid but hard working and skilled woman. She lives with her mother and her brother Frank who is sixteen years old, in a rented house located in the Peruvian jungle (Centro Pumpuriani indigenous community). As a single woman, Lorena thinks that the most important thing is to think about her future and that of her family. This is why three years ago, she bought a small plot of land where she grows plantains, corn and coffee. She then sells it to buyers that visit the indigenous community on the weekends.

What she loves most about her job is planting, working the small farm, and the unconditional help she gets from her brother, Frank. “This is my incentive to come out ahead,” she mentions. She is very busy this month, since she put all of her energy into her coffee plot. “This is the only season that I can obtain inputs,” she declares. 

Her hectare of coffee and plantains has resulted in good fruit, thanks to her youthful strength. She is saving to buy more land so that she can grow more coffee, even though she does not count on income from a job. But she is sure that she can realize her goals.

She belongs to the “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” communal bank. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she hopes that the collaboration helps her to continue toward her goals. She commits once more to fulfilling her payments, as she has in her other loans. She is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are reasonable and supportive people. Upon receiving support, Lorena will invest the requested money into the purchase of various sacks of organic fertilizer for the coffee crops that she has recently grown.

loans.use: purchase several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a don Luis, tiene 56 años de edad, está separado pero de esa relación de tantos años tuvieron dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad  e  independientes. El lleva cuatro ciclos en el banco comunal y está muy contento ya que sus compañeras son muy amables y divertidas.

El es artesano, hace varios años aprendió cerrajería con la práctica, luego cuando ya aprendió lo necesario puso su propio taller de cerrajería, en su taller elabora todo tipo de trabajos pero lo mas hace son muebles en hierro a los cuales les manda a tapizar para luego entregarlos a los clientes que le realizan los pedidos. Trabaja de lunes  a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y los sábados de 8h00 hasta las 14h00. Nos cuenta que lleva 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materia prima como: hierro, sueldas y pinturas para elaborar sus obras.

Sus sueños son que no le falte trabajo y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The village bank "Las Exitosas" meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are nationally and internationally recognized. Their straw hats are famous.

Here we meet Luis, 56, separated after many years with his wife, with whom he has two grown and independent children. He has been through four cycles with the village bank and is very happy because the other members are very friendly and fun.

He is a craftsman. Some years ago he learned to be a locksmith through an apprenticeship, and later when he had learned enough he opened his own workshop. In his workshop he makes all kinds of things, most especially iron furniture which he sends off to be upholstered before turning them in to the customers that placed the order. He works Monday to Friday from 8:00am til 6:00pm and on Saturday from 8 until 2. He tells us that he has been doing this work for 30 years.

This loan is to buy prime materials like iron, wages, and paints to make his pieces.

His dream is that he won't lack for work and will enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy iron, solder and paint.

loans.name: Maritza Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maritza tiene de 30 años de edad, ella es soltera, cuenta con casa propia,  la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Catacaos, Piura en el norte del Perú. Maritza vive en la parte Rural de este distrito, pero si cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Maritza se dedica a la venta de verduras en su domicilio y a  la venta de comida en un taller mecánico cerca a su domicilio, Maritza  cuenta con clientela ya establecida en el taller mecánico ya que es la única persona que vende comida y menús en dicho local. 

Maritza desea comprar más insumos para prepara sus alimentos, ya que dicho taller mecánico se ampliara y de esta manera se ampliará el número de empleados. Por ello maritza está solicitando a  Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Para poder realizar lo que se ha propuesto.

Maritza  es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Maritza is 30 years old, single, and owns her own home in Catacaos district, Piura, in the north of Peru.  Maritza lives in the rural part of this district but her home has basic services.

Maritza sells vegetables from her home and she also sells food in a car repair shop near her home.  She already has an established customer base in the car repair shop as she is the only person who sells food and meals in these premises.

Maritza would like to buy more supplies for preparing her food since the car repair shop is going to expand and so the number of employees will grow.  For this reason, Maritza is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maritza is a hard-working woman who works hard every day to get ahead and enjoy a better quality of life.  People who know her consider her to be a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling food

loans.name: Fortuna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTUNA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Tomasa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de diversos productos, venta de CD’s, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de dulces, venta de comida 

La señora Tomasa indica que hace dos años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, en distintos centro. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe que inicio hace treinta años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de ropa de bebe) que lo adquirirá  por mayor de las calle Incachaca, Uyustus y Buenos Aires; para la posteriormente venderla en la feria de la 16 de julio los días domingos y Jueves y los día lunes en el Puente Vela.. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la forma de trabajo en el área de salud.
texts.en:
The village bank "Fortuna" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima Center. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board chaired by Tomasa. The association members have various businesses including selling CDs, selling miscellaneous goods, selling sweets and food sales. 

Tomasa has worked for Pro Mujer for 2 years in different centers. Currently she has a business selling baby clothes that she started 30 years ago, learning from her mother.

The loan that she will take out now is to augment her merchandise (to buy baby clothes) that she gets in bulk on the streets of Incachaca, Uyustus and Buenos Aires. She later sells them at the 16 de Julio bazaar on Sundays and Thursdays, and in Puente Vela on Mondays. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes their work in the health field.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.es: Paúl, de 30 años, reside en la  comunidad nativa de Centro Pumpuriani, ahí forjo su familia junto a Ida, su esposa, desde hace 2 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuidan y educan constantemente. Todas las mañanas como hace 8 años se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra plátanos y café. Según cuenta; antes no tenía el dinero necesario como para comprar más terrenos agrícolas, con el tiempo y trabajo arduo pudo obtener 5 hectáreas de terrenos cultivables, donde ahora siembra de la siguiente manera: 3 hectáreas de cultivo son de plátanos y 2 hectáreas de café. Ya que el plátano tiene mayor acogida y rinde ganancias cada 15 días que dura su maduración. Pero en temporadas de cosecha de café que se realiza una vez al año, obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que una hectárea le produce 60 sacos de café como mínimo. “Cada kilo cuesta S/.12 soles”, comenta Paúl, “Estoy seguro que subirá más”. Ahora se encuentra en la cosecha de café y se siente muy contento de los resultados que está obteniendo. Por ello está pensando invertir en la siembra de sus cafetales para que en el futuro le puedan ofrecer más ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Paúl de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de café y un poco de abono en plátanos; ya que según afirma es muy importante para que produzcan más frutos.
texts.en:
Paul, 30, lives in the indigenous community of Centro Pumpuriani. There he began his family together with Ida, his wife of two years. They have four children that they constantly care for and educate. Every morning for 8 years he heads to his farmland where he plants plantains and coffee. 

According to his story: before, he didn't have the money he needed to buy more farmland; with time and hard work his was able to obtain 5 hectares of arable land. He now plants 3 hectares of plantains and 2 hectares of coffee. The plantain is more in demand and provides earnings every 15 days, which is its cycle of maturation. During the coffee harvest once a year, he makes good money because one hectare of land produces at least 60 sacks of coffee. "Every kilo costs 12 soles", comments Paul, "I'm sure it will go up even more." 

Now is the time to harvest coffee and he's very happy with the results that he's getting. Because of this he's thinking about investing in planting more coffee so that in the future he can make more money. 

He belongs to the village bank "Abjitas de Pumpuriani" and this is his first loan with MFP. He hopes that this collaboration will help him achieve his goals. He promises to make his payments. He is grateful to be part of his village bank because all of the members are responsible and unified.

Once he receives the loan he will invest in the purchase of some sacks of organic compost to spread among his coffee crop and a little for the plantains, because he feels it's very important that they produce more fruit.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Karina Mariela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5  años de edad el mismo que estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una florería.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 12h00 recorriendo la ciudad pero en su casa cuando llega un cliente lo atiende a cualquier hora. No trabaja hasta más tarde porque a esa hora llega su hijo de la escuela y tiene que en las tardes ayudarlo con sus tareas. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por la forma de pago. 

Su sueño es tener un local más grande para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS EXITOSAS" meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its pre-colonial culture and handicrafts, and renowned on both national and international levels.  This is the place of the "panama straw hat".

Here we meet Mrs. Karina, 23, who has a common-law partner and 5-year-old son in school.  Her husband works as a florist.

She sells all types of clothing on a door-to-door basis and from her home where she has a small dedicated space.  She works every day from 08:00 a.m. until noon throughout the city.  At home she attends to customers at any time of the day.  She does not work in the afternoons because her son is home from school and she helps him with his homework.  She sells her goods to customers on a credit basis and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys the merchandise she needs in Guayaquil.  For four years now she has been in business and it is going well for her.

She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  This is her third loan cycle in the communal bank, where she enjoys the easy credit terms.

Her dream is to have a larger location to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Chayito Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Chayito", porque en el momento de crear el grupo estaban entusiasmadas por las olimpiadas donde participaban algunos connacionales y le pusieron el nombre de una de las participantes. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes. La señora Maria es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 41 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y costuras. En esta ocasion solicita el prestamo para invertir y así adquirir un mayor numero de productos y materias primas para su venta y fafricacion de sus costuras en un precio más economico y poder solventar las necesidades de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo adquirir un mayor prestijio y poder expander su negocio. Con el prestamo va a comprar tela, hilos y cosmeticos para su negocio. Al solicitar este prestamo se siente muy contenta ya que se siente apoyada.Con las ganancias seguira invirtiendo en más mercancia y también para apoyar en su hogar con los gastos economicos. Observaciones La señora que aparece en la foto y no forma parte del grupo tiene sueter azul con una bolsa negra, es hermana de una de las integrantes que quizo salir en la foto.
texts.en:
This group is called "CHAYITO" because at the time it was set up the members were Olympic games enthusiasts and they wanted to name themselves after one of the participating athletes.  The group is based in the state of México and comprised of 11 members.  Mrs. María is the president.  She is 41 and sells cosmetics and is a seamstress.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell and raw materials for her dress-making.  She wants to pay lower prices, help meet her customers' needs and also acquire more prestige to expand her business.  

She plans to use the loan to buy fabric, thread and cosmetics.  She is happy about the loan because she feels supported.  With her earnings she will continue to invest in merchandise and also help cover household expenses.  Observations:  In the photo, the lady in the blue sweater is the sister of one of the group members who did not want to appear in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra.  María Ysabel  trabaja vendiendo polos en el estadio nacional lo hace los días sábados y domingos  cuando hay partidos D. futbol, fue su cuñada la que la animo a trabajar por su propia cuenta  y ya son 10 años que se dedica a ello, por otro lado también se dedica a la venta D. comidas que es su negocio principal  tiene 20 pensionistas  D. una fabrica a quienes  les venD. el almuerzo D. lunes a viernes, sus ingresos  le han  permitido ayudar en los estudios para sus hijos y sobretodo lograr comprarse su propio terreno lo que mas ansia en el futuro es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales, lo que hará con su préstamo es comprar sus utensilios D. cocina que se han deteriorado con el tiempo esto para brindar un mejor servicio a sus comensales, María Ysabel es tesorera del grupo “ MUJERES FORJADORAS” 08  socias vecinas y amigas del mismo lugar.
  
* La Sra Maria Ysabel es la ultima D. la derecha
texts.en:
Mrs. María Ysabel sells popsicles in the national stadium on Saturday and Sunday when there is a football match.  Her sister-in-law is the one who encouraged her to work independently and she has been doing this now for 10 years.  Also, her main business is catering and she has 20 factory employees to whom she serves lunch Monday through Friday.  Her income has allowed her to pay for her childrens' education and to buy her own property.  What she is most worried about is making sure her children become professionals.

She plans to use the loan to buy kitchen utensils since the ones she has have deteriorated over time.  This is so she can give her customers the best service possible.  Maria is the treasurer of the group "MUJERES FORJADORAS", comprised of eight members who are neighbors and friends living in the same town.

* Mrs. Maria Ysabel is the last one on the right.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para implementacion de su cocina

loans.name: Meliton

texts.es: Melitón, de 32 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí conformó su familia junto a Yesenia, su esposa; a la que quiere y con la que vive en una casa alquilada. Como buen hombre del campo, se dedica a “la agricultura”, principal actividad familiar y económica del lugar. En sus 3 años de experiencia en producir la tierra, logró obtener muchas cosas: entre ellas un terreno propio de 3 hectáreas de extensión, en los que siembra café y plátano. Todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana trabaja en el buen cuidado de sus sembríos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Él vende sus productos en el mercado de La Merced puesto que es donde mejor le pagan bien; pero en temporadas de campaña agrícola comercializa el café a la cooperativa de la comunidad Sanchirio del Palomar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Por otro lado se dedica al trabajo como peón en otros terrenos agrícolas, donde le pagan un dinero extra por los cuidados que brinda a dichos cultivos. En adelante, espera ahorrar el dinero necesario para poder comprar su propia casa. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo financiero para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Melitón de adquirir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizante natural (guano de isla), para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café y plátano.
texts.en:
Melitón, 32, lives in the Palomar community (central Peruvian jungle) in a rented house with his wife, Yesenia.  As any good man living in the country he is dedicated to farming, which is his main source of income, like many in the area.  For three years he has been working the land and obtained many things, among which is his own 3-acre patch of land on which he grows coffee and bananas.  Everyday he works from the early morning hours taking care of his crops because he knows the money he gets for his produce will depend on harvest quality.  He sells his crops in the La Merced market which is where he gets the most money.  During coffee season he sells his product to a co-op in the Sanchirio del Palomar community.

What he enjoys most about his work is harvest time, when he can reap the fruits of his months of hard work.  He also works as a farm laborer on other farms, where they pay him extra for the care he gives to crops.  In the future he hopes to be able to save enough money to buy a house.  He is a member of the communal bank "AROMA DE CAFÉ" and this is his third loan through MFP.  He hopes this financial support will help him meet his goals.  He is committed to paying it back on time, as he has done previously.  He enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  If Melitón receives your support he will invest the money in several sacks of organic and natural fertilizer (called "guano de isla"), to use on his coffee and banana crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 32 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos y vive en el distrito de zaña a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo ella cuenta con casa propia la misma que solo cuenta con los servicios básicos.  En sus comunidad se dedican mayormente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Agustina se dedica a la  comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado porcino, los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio.  Agustina se dedica a esta labor desde hace varios años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Agustina está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000  nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de cerdos con su respectivo alimento balanceado, además de esta manera atenderá la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,  ampliará su numero de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia.

Agustina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Agustina is 32 years old.  She has two children and lives in Zaña District 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  She has a house of her own that only has basic utilities.  In her community most are in commerce, farming and livestock raising.

Agustina is an animal merchant, principally pigs, which she raises in her back yard.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants that always frequent the area where she lives.  She works from home.  Agustina has been in this line of work for several years which is to say she knows it to perfection.

Agustina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy pigs and pig feed.  In addition, she will be able to fill unmet need in the area, increase her customer base by attracting new ones and have additional family income.

Agustina is quite a hard working woman who strives daily to get ahead and have a better quality of life.  People who know her consider her a kind person who is always willing to help others.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz, de 24 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Jesús, su esposo, desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Brayan y Lorena a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia. Con sus manos trabajadoras que de niña aprendieron a vivir de la agricultura; ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Gracias a la experiencia y su intención de ahorra logró obtener 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra, café, plátano y yuca, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado de La Merced, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta La Merced, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Pero agradece el apoyo que le brinda su esposo, quien le ayuda en las labores agrícolas y coordinan su próxima siembra. “Juntos planeamos la próxima cosecha”, comenta con mucha alegría, “nuestro deseo es contar un capital propio”. Es por ello que para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones y de esa manera brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Mariluz de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un motor nuevo para su máquina despulpadora, que sirve para pelar el grano de café maduro.
texts.en:
Mariluz, 24, lives in her own home in the Palomar community (central Peruvian jungle), with her husband of five years, Jesús, and their two children, Brayan and Lorena.  Having learned farming as a child, Mariluz works the land and makes it productive.  Thanks to her experience and savings she has managed to own four acres of farmland where she grows coffee, bananas and yucca.  She sells them at the La Merced market, wholesale.  What she enjoys most about her work is caring for the crops.  She has been in this activity for four years and feels the hardest part is transporting her products to the market since the sacks are very heavy and this takes a lot of effort.

She is grateful for the support she receives from her husband who helps with the farm activity and coordinates the planting seasons.  "Together we plan out the next harvest.", she says cheerfully.  "Our goal is to have our own capital."  In the future she wants to buy more land to increase crop production so she can give her children a better future.  She belongs to the communal bank "AROMA DE CAFÉ" and this is her second loan through MFP.  She hopes this small loan can help her reach her goals.  She is committed to paying it back on time, as she has done previously.  She enjoys being a part of the communal bank because all of its members are responsible, supportive people.  If Mariluz receives your support she will invest the money in a new pulper to hull ripe coffee beans.

loans.use: To buy a coffee pulper.

loans.name: Catherin

texts.es: Catherin, de 31 año reside en la comunidad de Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí conformó su familia junto a Moisés, su esposo, desde hace 9 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jonatan y Valeria a los que quiere y cuida con mucho amor y cariño. El trabajo de está laboriosa mujer se centra en varias actividades económicas paralelas, su lema es “el trabajo arduo”. Desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a ganarse la vida; desde entonces aprendió a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella. Hace 5 años que comenzó a sembrar café, plátanos y palta en sus terrenos propios desde entonces cuidó de sus cultivos, fertilizando, podando y limpiando constantemente. Todo ello gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien es su mano derecha. Paralelo a ello abrió hace poco una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su localidad. Además de dedicar un poco de su tiempo en la enseñanza a niños menores en el jardín del estado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar su cosecha junto a su esposo, quien negocia bien el precio de venta en una cooperativa de café de la ciudad de La Merced. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Catherin de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Catherin, 31, lives in Palomar (in the central Peruvian forests) with Moisés, her husband of nine years.  They have two children: Jonatan and Valeria, whom they love very much.  This enterprising woman does various forms of work at the same time; her motto is "hard work."  She was taught to earn her living at an early age:  she learned how to work the land and live off of it.  Five years ago, she began to cultivate coffee, bananas, and avocados on their  land, and since then, she has always taken care of the crops, fertilizing them, trimming them, and cleaning them constantly.  Her husband is her right hand man in all of this.  On top of her farming, she recently opened a grocery store, where she sells staples to the people in her area.  In addition, she dedicates a bit of her time to teaching young children at the state kindergarten.  What she likes best about her work is selling her harvest with her husband, who is good at negotiating the sale price to a coffee cooperative in the city of La Merced.  

Catherin is a member of the "Aroma de café" ("The Smell of Coffee") community bank.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She will invest the money in buying staples to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy staples to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: María Gabriela

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por la parroquia de Baños parroquia que es muy visitada por sus aguas termales, tiene varios lugares turísticos para visitar, su gente es muy amable y trabajadora.
 
Doña María tiene 25 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 6 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es pastelero de profesión, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María trabaja junto a su esposo en la pastelería y panadeía que es de su propiedad la misma que está en su casa, laboran  de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo, este trabajo lo realizan hace 7 años.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en materia prima como: harina, aceite, manteca, huevos, azúcar, etc.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Medio Ejido community bank and lives in Baños parish which is visited by a lot of people because of its thermal springs.  There are several tourist spots to visit and the people are very kind and hard working.

María is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has three children aged 7, 6 and 3.  Her eldest two are in elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a patissier by profession and, through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

María works alongside her husband in their cake shop and bakery which they own and which is located in their home.  They work from Monday to Friday but don't work fixed hours.  They have been in this line of work for seven years.

This is María's fourth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in raw materials such as flour, oil, butter, eggs, sugar, etc.

María's dream is for her children to study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, butter, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Luis Arnulfo

texts.es: Luís tiene su actividad que es brindar el servicio de molino. Tiene más 22 años en su negocio,  inicio por cuenta propia que fue muy difícil porque no tenía el capital suficiente, pero a pesar de esto solicito un financiamiento que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos para su actividad. El crédito será utilizado para proporcionarle mantenimiento a los molinos, pintarlos y acondicionar el lugar. El sueño de Luis es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Luís' business is providing a milling service.  He has been in this business for more than 22 years.  He started on his own initiative and it was very difficult because he didn't have enough capital.  However, in spite of this, he requested a loan which would help him to cover his business expenses.  

Luís will use this loan to carry out maintenance work on his mills, paint them and also fit out his premises.  Luís' dream is to continue growing in his business.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance work on his mills, paint them and also to fit out his premises

loans.name: Maira Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora. Maira es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa tanto por su estructura colonial como natural, cuenta con una variada  gastronomía, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Maira tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Maira labora en un pequeño restaurante que es de su propiedad, tiene este negocio hace dos años y medio, trabaja de lunes a sábados.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres y vajilla para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es de comprarse una casa y un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Maira is a member of the Medio Ejido community bank and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is beautiful both for its colonial architecture and its natural environment.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Maira is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is 4 years old.  Her husband is a driver by profession and he drives a truck.  They don't own their own home but rent instead.

Maira works in a small restaurant that she owns.  She has owned this business for two and a half years and works in it from Monday to Saturday.

This is Maira's fourth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying food products and crockery for her business.

Maira's dream is to buy a house and a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy food products and crockery

loans.name: Unidas Para Alcanzar El Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmela  tiene un trabajo muy sacrificado ella venD.  ropa  D. mercado en mercado para esto tiene que caminar mucho y soportar las inclemencias del clima  ya tiene trabajando así cerca D. 02 años, su mayor impulso son sus 04 hijos por quienes trabaja ella empezó vendiendo para otras personas pero  le pagaban era muy poco fue así que un buen dia decidió hacerlo por su propia cuenta  ya tenia experiencia y eso la ayudo mucho en la actualidad  sus ventas son buenas pero tiene que caminar mucho para ofrecer sus productos, lo que mas desea es tener un lugar estable donD. instalarse y  vender  sus prendas, otro tipo D. negocio que también le gustaría tener es un puesto D. venta D. frutas espera concretar ambas cosas  con ahorro y mucho trabajo sabe que  lo  lograra, con su préstamo comprara  prendas D. vestir para invierno  por la temporada  las ventas aumentan  y  le ira muy bien, ella forma parte del grupo “UNIDAS PARA ALCANZAR EL ÉXITO”.
  
* La Sra. Carmela es la segunda D. la derecha (paradas) viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
Carmela has a really hard job.  She sells clothes from market to market.  This means that she has to walk a lot and put up with the inclemency of the weather.  She has been working in this way for nearly two years.  Her greatest driving force is her four children for whom she works.  She started off selling for other people but they paid her very little so one day she decided to start working for herself since she had experience.  This helped her a lot.  Currently, her sales are good but she has to walk a lot in order to sell her products.  What she would most like is to have a stable place where she can set herself up and sell her clothes.  Another type of business that she would also like to own is a fruit stall.  She hopes to achieve both of these goals.  By saving up and working hard, she knows that she will manage this.

Carmela will use her loan to buy winter clothes.  Her sales increase during this season and it will be very helpful.  She is a member of the "Unidas para Alcanzar el Éxito" (United for Success) group.

* Carmela is the second person from the right (standing).  She is wearing a light blue top [sic].

loans.use: to buy winter clothes

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta, de 45 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí educó a su hija Mariluz de 15 años de edad. Que ahora vive en la capital donde recibe una buena educación que es su principal deseo. Ella tuvo que enfrentar momentos difíciles en su vida. Como madre soltera afrontó las responsabilidades de educación y gastos económicos de su hija. Los que asumió gracias al apoyo de “la agricultura”, actividad que le enseñaron sus padres y la que sigue realizando. Ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en la siembra de café, plátanos y palta en sus propios terrenos agrícolas; donde pasa la mayor parte del día ya que acondicionó una pequeña casa dentro de sus cultivos. De esa manera podrá brindar la atención que requieren para ser frutos de calidad. Ahora ella se encuentra en la cosecha de café donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ganancias anuales por la venta a los acopiadores de la zona. Su mayor dificultad es la falta de capital que subsidia gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, que le ayudó a invertir más y generar mejores ganancias; las cuales gasta en la educación de su hija, que es su razón de vivir. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura podrá obtener el apoyo financiero que necesita. Jacinta de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del salario a los peones que le están ayudando en la recolección del los granos maduros de café. Asimismo comprará instrumentos como machetes y palas para limpiar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 45 years old and lives in the community of Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).  This is where she educated her 15 year-old daughter Mariluz.  Her daughter now lives in the capital where she is receiving a good education.  This is Jacinta's main wish.

Jacinta has had to confront some difficult moments in her life.  As a single mother, she had to face up to the responsibility of educating her daughter and covering her expenses.  She managed this thanks to the support of 'farming', a business activity that her parents taught her and which she continues to be engaged in today.  Jacinta has 15 years experience growing coffee, bananas and avocados on her own farmland.  This is where she spends most of her day since she fitted out a small home amongst her crops.  This means that she can give her crops the care that they need in order to provide good quality fruit.

Right now, Jacinta is harvesting her coffee.  She makes most of her annual profits by selling coffee to middlemen in her area.  Her biggest difficulty is a lack of capital but she manages thanks to to the support of her community bank which helped her to invest more and make better profits.  She spends these profits on educating her daughter as she is her reason for living.

Jacinta belongs to the 'Aroma de Café' (Aroma of Coffee) community bank and this is her first loan from MFP where she is certain that she will be able to obtain the financial support that she needs.  With your support, Jacinta will invest the money she has requested in paying the wages of the laborers who are helping her to collect her ripe coffee beans.  She will also buy tools such as machetes and spades with which to weed her crops.

loans.use: to pay the wages of the laborers who will help to harvest her coffee.  She will also buy machetes and spades

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to look after his cows and invest in his milk business

loans.name: Jivann

texts.es: Jivann, de 19 años; reside en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia con Rosa, que desde hace un año. Y juntos están felices de recibir la pronta llegada su futura hija, que dentro de un mes nacerá. Desde niño se dedicó a apoyar a su madre en la agricultura principal actividad agrícola de la familia, desde entonces se dedicó al cuidado se los cultivos. Ya desde hace algún tiempo comenzó a independizarse de sus padres, ya que conformó su familia. Su principal actividad consta del trabajo de extracción de cítricos, café, siembra y macheteo de los cultivos en una hacienda agrícola muy importante de la zona. Su trabajó consta de lunes a viernes de las primeras horas del día hasta altas horas de la tarde. Pero consiente de sus necesidades y las carencias de su nueva familia. Los días domingos que descansa de su trabajó en la hacienda, se dedica a cosechar en otros terrenos agrícolas donde le pagan un dinero extra. Gracias a su buena disposición en el trabajó Jivann heredó de sus suegros una hectárea de terreno agrícola, donde está pensando sembrar por su propia cuenta. Asimismo construirá su casa en un pequeño espacio que le dio sus padres. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro” y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Jivann, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales necesarios para mejorar su casa; asimismo en comenzar su siembra de café y plátanos.
texts.en: Jivann is 19 years old and he lives in the locality of Puente Paucartambo (central Peruvian jungle). There, he started his family with Rosa last year and together they are happy to soon welcome their daughter. She will be born in one month. Since he was a boy he has helped his mother in agriculture, as the primary agricultural activity of the family. Since then he has been in charge of cultivations. For some time now he has started to separate himself from his parents, as he has a family of his own. His primary activity consists of working in harvesting citric fruits, coffee, and to plant and prune the cultivation at a very important agricultural farm in the region. His work is from Monday to Friday, from the early morning hours to the late evening hours. But he is conscious of his needs and the needs of his new family. On Sundays he rests from his work at the farm and he harvests other agricultural farms to earn extra money. Thanks to his good work ethics, Jivann inherited from his parents-in-law a hectare of agricultural land where he is thinking on cultivating on his own account. He will also build a house on a small space given to him by his parents. He belongs to the communal bank "Luz del Futuro", meaning "Light of the Future" and it is the first loan he has with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He hopes his collaboration will help him to continue on with his goals. Jivann, on receipt of this support, will invest the funds he requested in the purchase of necessary materials to improve his house. He will also start his coffee and banana plantation.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build his house.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 4 years. She is married and has 3 school-aged children.

Catherine is requesting a loan of Php 20,000 to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and other basic commodities to sell. Each month, she earns about Php 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Catherine hopes that her business will improve to be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: buy canned goods, soft drinks and other commodities to sell

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: La Señorita María es soltera vive en la casa de sus padres en  zona de ulincate, se dedica a la venta de cascara, maní pelado maíz , trigo y otros cereales de uso domestico mas ella lleva su mercadería a vender a la ciudad de La Paz por quintales en el mercado Rodríguez este mercado es el mercado mas populoso de la ciudad de la Paz aquí se ofrece productos de primer necesidad para el consumo de las familias, el préstamo que solicito es para aumentar su mercadería para poder variar sus productos, es una joven muy trabajadora y con ganas de seguir adelante agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Maria is single and he lives at home with her parents in the region of Ulincate. She sells paddy rice, shelled peanuts, corn, wheat, and other cereals of domestic use. She takes her merchandise to sell in the city of La Paz where she sells by the quintals at the Rodriguez market. It is the largest market in the city of La Paz and it is where basic needs products for the family are sold. The loan which she requested is to increase her merchandise, to add variety to her products. She is a young, hardworking woman who is eager to move forward. She is thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase cereal grains by the quintal.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is 37 years old and has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products. She has had this business for 5 years. She is married and has 3 school-aged children.

Eveline is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to buy noodles, canned goods and soft drinks to sell. Each month, Eveline earns about Php 3,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Eveline hopes that her business will improve and expand in order to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha de 33 años,  de estado civil soltera, con dos  hijos, tiene ya 5 años dedicándose a la venta de comida como asaditos, refrescos y comida en un puesto ambulante que tiene en la parada de una línea de micros  y algunos días de la semana en el domicilio de su vecina que esta a tres cuadras de su puesto. La Sra. Martha vive con su conyugue que se dedica a la electricidad ambos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia. La Sra.  Martha   se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la necesidad y  urgencia que posee de construir un techo en su domicilio y así no tener que salir a la calle para vender su comida, como también víveres para la elaboración de sus platillos.  Ella  tiene un buen historial de deuda, es cliente antiguo  de la institución con buen comportamiento de pago,  es un apersona muy cordial, amigable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Martha is 33 years old, single, and she has two children. She has been selling prepared foods for 5 years, including roasts, soft drinks, and other foods from a stall that she has at a bus stop. Some days of the week she works from her neighbors house, which is three blocks from her stand. Martha lives with her common-law husband, an electrician, and they both strive to provide for their family. Martha saw the need to access a loan from our institution given the need and urgency to build a roof on their house. She will not need to go out on to the streets to sell her foods. She 
also plans on purchasing groceries to prepare her recipes. She has a good credit history and she is a long-time client of the institution. She has had a good repayment record. She is a very cordial and friendly person, and she is thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase rice, potatoes, meats, vegetables, and to build a roof on their house to improve her business.

loans.name: Virginia 	Leandra

texts.es: La señora Virginia, se dedica  a la venta D. varios productos en su tienda D. barrio, que se encuentra bien ubicada, ella es dueña D. casa y trabaja muchos años con la institución, al margen D. tener bien surtida la tienda, ella se dedica a la venta D. huevos por mayor y menor, la señora tiene hijos ya mayores que son  independientes, y algunos casados, a veces ella cuida a sus nietos, en la semana  recibe huevos por mayor, por lo que  solicita el crédito para aumentar su capital, es una persona muy responsable, que ya trabajó varios créditos con financiamiento Kiva, es una persona muy conocida por el buen trato que da a sus clientes agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Virginia sells various products at her neighborhood store which is in a good location.  She owns her own home, is married, and has worked many years with the institution apart from keeping her store well stocked.  Virginia sells eggs in bulk and retail. She has older kids who are now on their own, some are married and sometimes she takes care of her grandkids.  During the week she gets eggs in bulk which is why she is requesting the loan, to increase her capital.  She is a very responsible person who has previously been financed by Kiva.  She is responsible and well known due to her good customer service.  She is thankful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like: eggs, groceries and candy to stock her store

loans.name: Donis Luis

texts.es:
Donis, de 30 años de edad, es originario de Quezalguaque un pueblo localizado en León, es padre de 2 hijos, el es comerciante, se dedica a vender CD y DVD. Al comienzo el señor Donis trabajaba en el campo, luego trabajo en construcción y desde hace dos años comenzó a trabajar en el sector comercio, vendiendo CD Y DVD de música películas, su esposa lo ayuda a atender el negocio, ellos venden  en el mercado de la estación de buses.

El solicito el préstamo para comprar CD para videos juegos de Play Station 2   y celulares  para vender en su local. Con esta inversión espera atraer mas clientes mejorar sus ventas e ingresos. En el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda de videos juegos y vender celulares al por mayor.  Su próxima meta poner una local de venta de pollo.
texts.en:
Donis is 30 years old and originally from Quezalguaque - a village in León.  He has two children and is a salesman.  Donis sells CDs and DVDs.  He used to work in on the land, then he worked in construction.  Two years ago he started working in sales, selling CDs and DVDs.  His wife helps him in the business.  They make their sales in the bus station market.

Donis requested this loan to buy CDs, Play Station 2 games and cell phones to sell in his premises.  With this investment, he hopes to attract more customers and improve his sales and income.  In the future, he would like to own a video game store and sell cell phones wholesale.  His next goal is to set up premises where he will sell chicken.

loans.use: to buy CDs, Play Station 2 games and cell phones

loans.name: Charisma

texts.en:
