Charisma is 21 years old and has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the community.  She has had this business for 2 years. She is married and has 1 infant child.

Charisma is requesting a loan of Php 9,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods and other daily basic items to sell. Each month, Charisma earns about Php 3,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Charisma hopes that her business will improve so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods and other daily basic needs to sell

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia, es una cliente que esta sacando crédito por tercera vez, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, razón por la cual se la escogió para crédito Kiva.  La Sra. Silvia vive en la zona cotahuma, de la ciudad de La Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con sus dos pequeños niños, el esposo trabaja  en una empresa,  La Sra. Silvia saco este crédito para el incremento de capital comprando mercadería para su tienda y surtirla, su negocio es grande y esta en plena avenida, con el tiempo ella  quiere llegar a tener su propia casa, con esmero, voluntad y trabajo.
texts.en:
Silvia is a client who is taking out her third loan.  During her loan evaluation meeting, she showed a good attitude.  She was polite and kind.  For this reason, she was chosen to receive a Kiva loan.

Silvia lives in Cotahuma district, in the city of La Paz, Bolivia.  She currently lives with her two young children.  Her husband works for a company.  Silvia took out this loan to increase her capital by purchasing merchandise with which to stock her store.  Her business is large and located right in the middle of an avenue.  Over time, Silvia would like to own her own home.  She will achieve this with care, will and hard work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise with which to stock her store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 40 years old.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  Gemma has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community.  She has had this business for 10 years. 

Gemma is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles to sell. Each month, she earns about Php 4,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Gemma hopes that her business will improve so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and has one child. She sells children's clothing at an open-air market in Berdyansk town. Elena has been in this business for 6 years. She enjoys this business and manages it well. 

Elena has a large variety of inventory and offers affordable prices. She is the only vendor who sells children's clothing at this particular market.  Elena would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories as well as improve her business facility. Elena hopes that a better looking kiosk will bring even more customers and increase sales.

loans.use: buy more inventory and renovate her kiosk

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced and has one child. She sells curtains and accessories at Image Market in Beregovo city. Her monthly gross income is 20,000 UAH and her profit is about 6,000 UAH per month.

Svetlana started this business 8 years ago. She was lucky to choose this type of goods to sell, because she had very little competition then, and even now the competition is low. This gives Svetlana a good opportunity to make her living. Svetlana is a kind and hardworking person. She treats her clients well and has a desire to develop her business even more.

Svetlana would like to receive a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase more inventories. Additional capital would allow her to offer a better assortment of curtains and serve even more clients.

loans.use: purchase more curtains and accessories

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is now 50 years of age and is married with three adult children. Emily is a farmer working in the Philippines, and she earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

Emily is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed supply and additional hogs to raise. She manages a hog-raising business and has been doing it for almost five years.

In the future, Emily hopes to improve this kind of business in order to supplement her husband's income to satisfy their daily needs and to save for the future needs of their children. They hope that Kiva lenders will continuously assess them in the business so that they can able to achieve their business goals.

loans.use: to purchase feed supply and additional hogs to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita  is now 50 years of age and is married with three adult-aged children. Clarita is a farmer working in the Philippines, and she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

Clarita is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase breeding livestock and feeds. She grows hogs and has been doing it for almost a year.

In the future, Clarita hopes to raise more pigs to earn more income for the sake of her family and for their future. She believes that she can be able to attain her business goals through the continuous support and assistance of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock and feeds.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and married. She is blessed with two school-aged children. As one way of gaining income, she put up a small general store where she sells different grocery items and other basic daily needs. Erlinda has operated this business for almost four years. 

Erlinda is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional grocery items, soft drinks and vegetables to sell. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve this kind of business in order to help her husband with getting income for the sake of the future of their children. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist her in the business in order to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items, soft drinks and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik was born in 1962 in Kapan. He is married and has two children: a son and a daughter, who studies in the agricultural institute. 

For about 14 years, Garik and his wife have had their own business. They sell household goods, shoes, underclothes, cereals, etc., at Kapan market. Garik spends part of his business profit for his daughter's education, and another part, he uses to keep his family.
 
This is Garik's tenth loan from Nor Horizon, and he is asking for 900,000 Armenian dram to buy cereals and wheat from villagers and household goods from Yerevan to resell them in the Kapan market.

loans.use: To buy cereals and wheat and also household goods to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese, food, chicken and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a responsible mother who is 33 years old. She has a general store where she sells groceries like noodles, canned goods, snack foods and other products used daily. Mary Jane has operated this business for almost six years. 

Mary Jane is asking for a loan of 23,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional grocery items like frozen foods, canned goods and soft drinks. She usually earns about PHP 8,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Mary Jane hopes to strengthen the business she manages by increasing her product offering in order to earn a higher income to support the education of their children and to give them a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items like frozen foods, canned goods and soft drinks.

location.town: Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is 38 years old, and he lives in Shikahogh village, Syunik marz, with his wife and his three children. Gegham works in village administration; his wife works at a village school as a teacher; his daughters are pupils; and his son attends kindergarten.

Simultaneously to his work in village administration, Gegham and his wife have engaged in land cultivation and animal breeding. They grow wheat and sell part of their harvest in Kapan city market, and another part they use on their farm. Also, they breed cows, pigs, turkeys and chickens, and they sell dairy produce and meat at the Kapan market to their regular customers. 

Gegham is seeking a 1,000,000 Armenian dram loan to buy a truck, which he will use for his farming needs. Gegham received loans from Nor Horizon four times, and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy a truck, which he will use for his farming’s needs

loans.name: Manya

texts.en:
Manya lives in Vanadzor with her husband. She has two children, a son and a daughter, who are already married and live separately from their parents. 

For almost 15 years Manya has managed a shop, where she sells toys, tableware, souvenirs, perfumery and household goods. Her husband helps her in the business and her son brings merchandise from Yerevan to Vanadzor and helps in the shop when needed as well.

With the profit from her business, Manya and her son support their families. Manya needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a large lot of toys and household goods, which will allow her to increase her business income in the near future. Manya has received loans from Nor Horizon 12 times and she has never delayed in her loans repayments.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of toys and household goods for her business

loans.name: Arto

texts.en:
Arto and his wife have engaged in farming. They grow maize, oat and wheat, which they use as fodder for their cows and pigs. When they do not have enough fodder to feed their animals, they buy it from villagers. Also, Arto has some bee families on his farm. Thanks to the profit from farming, Arto is able to support his family. 

Arto needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy five bull-calves for his farm and more fodder for his farm animals. This is Arto’s second loan from Nor Horizon. 
 
Arto is 38 years old and he lives in Koti village, Tavush marz. He is married and has a son and a daughter who are pupils in the village school.

loans.use: To buy five bull-calves for his farm and needed fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs, juices, cookies, beverages, and diapers in wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustin de 70 años es un hombre casado, padre de 5 hijos  y propietario de una ferretería en el barrio Los Andes de Barranquilla, negocio que emprendió una vez fue pensionado como empleado de una empresa y decidió dedicarse a generar segundos ingresos y principalmente para sentirse continuamente productivo. Agustín vende de contado a su principal mercado que son sus vecinos del barrio que compartes y a las comunidades de los alrededores todo lo que se requiere para desarrollar procesos constructivos y de adecuación y mejoramiento de viviendas; él poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas y tiene como meta fortalecer su negocio hasta lograr su posicionamiento y sostenibilidad como microempresa familiar. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer credikiva que el primero al que aplica en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales como clavos, tornillos, limas, pintura, yeso, cemento , destornilladores, tuberías PVC, seguetas, papel esmeril y especialmente impermeabilizadores . Su inversión planea ser exitosa porque la aplica a materiales que rotan permanentemente y su clientela conoce su potencial de oferta.
texts.en: Agustin is a 70 year old married man and a father of 5 children. He is the owner of a hardware store in the neighborhood of Los Andes de Barranquilla. He opened this business when he retired as an employee from a business and decided to have a second income and especially continue to feel productive.   Agustín sells up fron to his main customers who are residents of his neighborhood and of the nearby communities. He sells them everything they need for construction projects and to improve and adapt their homes. Little by little he has increased his sales and his goal is to have a good position and sustainability as a family micro business. At present, he is asking for his first Kiva loan at the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy materials such as nails, screws, rasps, paint, plaster, cement, screwdrivers, PVC tubing, blades, sandpaper and especially waterproofers. He plans on his investment being successful because he is using it for materials that have a permanent turnover, and his customers know the quality he offers.

loans.use: to buy materials such as nails, screws, rasps, paint, plaster, cement, screwdrivers, PVC tubing, sandpaper, and especially waterproofers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise from catalogs such as plastic products and cosmetics

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro es un hombre de 42 años muy dedicado a  “ Taller de servicios Sincro C.” negocio  que por iniciativa de su hermano,  nació cuandodecidieron poner en marcha un taller de sincronizaciòn y arrendaron un local, donde  actualmente ubicados tambien venden  repuestos para vehiculos al mismo tiempo que ofrecen servicios de sincronizaciòn. Asi fuè como lo formalizaron en la Càmara de Comercio de Barranquilla , ellos ademàs de conocer el ofico debieron ubicar proveedores y fortalecer su promoción para lograr sostenerlo. Este es el segundo financiamiento al que aplica en la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará repuestos de automoviles como pistones, bujias, anillos, bandas, platinos, zapatillas que le permitan tener un stock de mercancias y mientras genera ingresos por sincronización tambien venda los repuestos que se requieren para dar solución a la buena marcha de los vehiculos .  Su sueño mas adelante es tener un local propio y ampliar su oferta de productos, pero su mayor desafio el capital de trabajo que aun  no es suficiente para hacerlo y esta es la razòn por la cual estàn acudiendo a su credikiva y mientras construye su sueño, continua esforzandose en su trabajo sosteniendo una rotaciòn de sus inventarios de 17 dias.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a 42 year-old man who is very committed to "Taller de servicios Sincro C.", a business that came about through his brother's initiative.  The brothers decided to set up a repair shop and rented the premises in which they currently work.  In addition to carrying out repair work, they also sell vehicle parts.  They made their business official with Barranquilla's Chamber of Commerce.  In addition to knowing their trade well, they had to locate suppliers and strengthen their promotion work in order to support their business.

This is the second loan that Ramiro has applied for through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy vehicle parts such as pistons, spark plugs, rings, belts, points and brake shoes which will allow him to have merchandise in stock.  While he makes money repairing vehicles, he will also sell the spare parts that are needed to keep vehicles working well.

Ramiro's dream for the future is to own his own premises and expand his product offerings.  However, his biggest challenge is working capital as he doesn't have enough.  This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan.  While he works on achieving his dreams, he continues to work hard in his business, maintaining a stock turnover of 17 days.

loans.use: to buy vehicle parts such as pistons, spark plugs, rings, belts, points and brake shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new freezer for his ice creams.  He will also buy fish and a variety of merchandise such as cosmetics, clothes and accessories

loans.name: Eidy Luz

texts.es: Eidy de 33 años es una confeccionista que se dedica a la producciòn de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella tiene un punto de ventas y ya no solo confecciona sobre medidas, sino que presta el servico de maquila; sus principales clientes son mujeres y almacenes pequeños que compran mediante pedidos, su modalidad de venta es credito y tambien en su punto comercial lo hace de contado. Eidy es casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 4 años en Soledad municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su negocio inicò ayudando a su madre, de quien adquirió la mayor experiencia  y luego la aplicò en una pequeña confecciòn donde trabajó por varios años y compró una maquinaria con las cuales desarrollò su actividad como trabajadora independiente, negocio que hoy le genera sus ingresos y quiere hacerlo crecer, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, por eso recurre a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprarà: telas, hilos adornos e insumos para confeccionar nuevos diseños encargados por sus clientes, para lucir elegantes a propòsito de la celebraciòn del dia del padre.
texts.en:
33 year-old Eidy is a dressmaker who makes women's, men's and children's clothes.  She has a sales location and she no longer only makes custom-made clothes but also provides a manufacturing service.  Her main customers are women, and small stores who buy from her by placing orders.  She sells on credit and, in her sales location, she sells for cash.

Eidy is married and lives with her husband and two children who are 2 and 4.  They live in Soledad, a town which is very near the city of Barranquilla.  She started out in her business helping her mother, from whom she gained most of her experience.  She then applied her experience in a small dressmaking workshop where she worked for several years.  Later Eidy bought some machines and used them to develop her business working independently.  Her business makes her income and she would like to grow it.  However, she doesn't have enough working capital.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan.

Eidy's Kiva loan is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy fabric, threads, adornments and supplies for making new designs that her customers have ordered so that they can dress smartly when they celebrate Fathers Day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, adornments and supplies for making new designs that her customers have ordered

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather, adhesives and metal hardware for making bags, billfolds and backpacks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sausages, potatoes, ketchup, mayonnaise, plastic covers, etc.

loans.name: Florantine

texts.en: Florantine is 28 years old and has two children who are ages four and six years old. Florentine sells food stuffs and she has done this business for one year. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs and make more profits. With the profits, she plans to buy a garden in which she plans to grow some crops.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs for sale and make more profits.

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en: Gerard, a 33-year-old father of  two children aged two and six, the eldest of whom is in school, has been selling shoes for the past 10 years.  Having built  his own family house from business profits, Gerard is now requesting a loan to buy 150 pairs of shoes and expand his business. With the increased profits and his savings, he plans to buy another house to rent out and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 30 years old, married and has 6 months old child. Her husband is a driver. Clementine sells food stuffs which include rice, Irish potatoes,  sugar etc. Clementine needs a loan to buy more food stuffs to make more profits. She has been in this business for one year and  with her business profits and her husband’s savings they have been able buy a house in which they stay. Clemintine hopes to buy a car in the future which will enable her to sell her goods in different places.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs.

loans.name: Triphine

texts.en: Triphine is 41 years old, married and has 6 children who are ages 10-21 years old. Her husband is a driver. Triphine has been selling charcoal for the past 19 years. She is a very hard worker.This business has enabled her to accomplish several things including renovating her house. She is requesting a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to make more profits. With the profits she plans to expand her house.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 31years old. He is single and hard working. He owns a hair cutting salon for the past 11 years and that business enabled him open up another business of making chairs out of timber. He is requesting a loan to buy salon cutting equipment in order to expand his business and hence make more profits.

loans.use: To buy hair salon cutting equipment.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en: Marceline is 25 years old. She has 2 children who are ages three and five years old. Marceline sells different kinds of clothes which include scuffs and children's clothes. She has been in this business for 3 years and this has enabled her build her own family house. Marceline is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and make more profits to expand her business. Marceline plans to buy a piece of land from the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is a mother of two children who are ages two and seven. The eldest child is in school while the youngest isn’t. Her husband rides a motorcycle to generate income while Emerithe owns a store in which she sells different kind of items such as sugar, soap, sandals, candles, juices, water and other items. She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, soap etc in order to make more profits. She plans to begin her house construction with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy items such as sugar, soap, candles etc for sale.

loans.name: Mayra Monserrate

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayra, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de 4 años de edad el mismo que este año empezó a estudiar en un jardín de infantes. Su esposo es agente de ventas.

Es una gran ama de casa que como realiza el crédito para hacer mejoras en su casa, la misma que está semiconstruida,  quiere realizar el acabado de las paredes de su casa ya que son muy rusticas y a veces le dañan la piel de su hijo cuando este juega dentro de la casa, también quiere una casa más confortable para toda su familia.
 
Para esto ella espera utilizar el crédito para comprar material de construcción, arena, cemento, ripio, etc. Lleva cinco ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido poco a poco cumplir su sueño que es tener su casa completamente terminada.
texts.en:
The members of the Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche Communal Bank meet every fifteen days in the town of Pachinche in the parish of Colon, city of Portoviejo.  The town is known for its hard-working people who are dedicated to agriculture and livestock farming.   

In this town, we meet Mayra.  She is 23 years old and married.  She has a 4 year old son, who began kindergarten this year.  Her husband is a salesman. 

She is a great housewife and will use this loan to make home improvements.  Her home is semi-constructed.  She wants to finish the walls on her home as they are vey rusty.  Sometimes her child hurts his skin when he is playing inside the house.  She also wants a more comfortable home for her entire family.

She hopes to use the loan for construction materials such as sand, cement, gravel, etc. The communal bank is in its fifth cycle. She is pleased because the loans have enabled her to gradually fulfill her dream of having her house completely finished.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Twahirwa

texts.en: Twahirwa, a 32-year-old father of a two-year-old child, is married to a tailor, while he has been selling chickens, goats and eggs for the past six years.  This business has enabled him to feed his family, and he is now requesting a loan to buy more animals such as goats to sell in order to make more profits. Twahirwa plans to better provide for his family with the profits he hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married with one 10-year-old son. He sells office supplies, birthday cards and souvenirs at the central market in Melitopol city. Victor started this business 16 years ago. His entrepreneurial skills helped him to develop it well. Victor has many repeat customers who keep his sales at a high level.

Victor is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase assorted inventory. Since this business is the only source of income for his family, Victor is hoping to increase his sales and make additional income to be spent on improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with two grown children. She lives in Novaya Kahovka and has a small business selling souvenirs. Victoria has several vending locations at the markets and in the local mall, called “Tsentralnyi” (“Central”). Presently, Victoria has about 20,000 Grivnas in capital turnover. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnas. 

Victoria is seeking a 20,000 Grivnas loan to purchase additional merchandise to diversify her inventory. She has been in this business for 9 years and knows how to please her customers and meet their needs. Victoria enjoys working with people and this type of merchandise. She is hoping to see her business expand and flourish in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to diversify her selection

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна находится в счастливом браке. Ее мужа зовут Владимир. Она имеет свой бизнес - продает женское белье и купальники. Татьяна занимается этим бизнесом уже 12 лет и имеет большой опыт.
 
Торговая точка Татьяны находится на входе в центральный рынок, благодаря чему у нее постоянный поток клиентов. Татьяна - хороший работник и старается всегда помочь покупателям.  Она старается развивать свой бизнес и увеличивать доход, выезжая  на другие большие рынки.
 
Татьяна просит  предоставить ей кредит на сумму 10000 гривен для увеличения ассортимента - закупки 100 шт. купальников и женского белья,  а соответственно для увеличения  дохода семьи.
texts.en:
Tatiana is happily married. Her husband's name is Vladimir. She has her own business.  She sells women's underwear and swimsuits.  Tatiana has been doing this work for twelve years and has a great deal of experience.

Tatiana's shop is located at the entrance of the main market, and therefore she has a constant stream of customers.  Tatiana is a good worker and tries to always help her customers.  She tries to expand her business and increase her income, by traveling to other large markets.
 
Tatiana is asking for a loan for 10,000 hryvnia to increase her goods for sale.  She would like to buy 100 swimsuits and women's underwear, and thereby increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy new goods  for resale to increase her family's income.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married with a 9-year-old daughter, called Angelina. He is a farming businessman from Dneprovka, south-eastern Ukraine. Andrei sells polyethylene film, seeds, and other agricultural supplies in one of the local markets called “Stroika.” He is the only entrepreneur who offers polyethylene film for farmers in his town, which gives his business a boost every spring when greenhouse owners come to him for supplies. 

Andrei has been in this business for 6 years. He has 80,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory and his income amounts to around 10,000 Grivnyas per month. Andrei is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of seeds and additional polyethylene film for sale in his home town.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seeds and polyethylene film for sale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced and is raising her son, Edward. She is an entrepreneur from Kahovka, Ukraine, where she runs her women's clothing business in the city market. Valentina started her business four years ago because need forced her to support her family and find ways to provide for her son and herself. Today her turnover capital is about 25,000 UAH. Net profit is about 5,000 UAH each month.

Valentina is a determined entrepreneur. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Today, she is requesting a loan for 10,000 Grivnas to purchase women’s T-shirts, blouses and pants to generate additional profit which will allow her to feel more financially secure.

loans.use: to purchase women’s t-shirts, blouses and pants for retail sale

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 44-year-old mother who has three children. After her children grew up, the family’s expenses increased so Fayza wanted to add another income source for her family (besides her husband’s salary) to support the family financially.

Using her creativity and her skills, Fayza started a year ago designing plastic flowers and trees as inside plant decorations, as shown in the picture. She basically takes orders and creates them at her house.

Having a pretty good space in her house garden, Fayza wants to add decorating with naturA. flowers to what she does, including making bouquets from naturA. flowers. In order to do that, she has applied for this loan to buy some seeds, plants and the tools she needs for the garden.

loans.use: To buy seeds, plants and the tools she needs for the garden.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 40-year-old housewife. Her husband Mo’taz was a water distribution manager for one of the local companies. Three years ago, they started a freelance distributing business. 

Using his connections at his previous job helped him get a good price when ordering a big quantity for distributing, therefore making good profit. Now Iman wanted to help her husband to order more bottles of water to sell, so she applied for this loan. In the future, Iman wants to be able to buy another distributing bus to increase their income.

Iman is a conservative person who requested that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more bottles of water to sell

loans.name: Raneen

texts.en:
Raneen is a young woman from Tulkarem. She is married and a housewife. Raneen's husband is a construction worker who managed to save money to build his own house. Now that the house is almost ready, Raneen took out a loan from FATEN so that her husband can purchase the materials needed to plaster and paint the walls.

Raneen is pregnant and expecting her first baby soon. Raneen, who appears in the picture, wants to have the house ready to move in to before the baby is born.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 35 años de edad, el es casado. cuenta con casa propia,  la cual está ubicada en la campiña Solecape , es un sector rural del distrito de Mochumi.

Julio  se dedica a la  comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado caprino (cabritos), entre otros  los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio. Julio  se dedica a esta labor desde hace 5 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Julio desea comprar más animales con sus respectivos alimentos, pues para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que el titular cuenta con clientela ya establecida, con esta seguridad de querer ampliar sus negocio, Julio está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr dichos objetivos.

Julio es un cliente antiguo  para Edpyme Alternativa, y en todo momento a demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad,  Julio también cuenta con buenas referencia por parte de las personas que lo conocen, lo describen como una persona tranquila y honesta.
texts.en:
Julio is 35 years old, married and has a house of his own located in Solecape, a rural sector of Mochumí District.

Julio is an animal merchant, mainly little goats, among others which he raises in his back yard and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to dealers who always frequent the zone where he lives.  He works from home.  Julio’s been in this line of work for 5 years which is to say he knows it to perfection.

Julio wants to buy more animals with their respective feed because in this zone he does not have any competition in this line of work and he has an established clientele.  With this safety net in place he wants to expand his business.  Julio is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to reach said objectives.

Julio is a longstanding client of Edpyme Alternativa and has shown responsibility and punctuality at all times.  Julio also has good references from people who know him; they describe him as a calm, honest person.

loans.use: to buy more animals with their respective feed.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María Raquel tiene  21 años de edad, ella es soltera, vive en casa propia,  La cual está ubicada en el distrito de Catacaos, María vive en Catacaos en la parte rural del distrito de y cuenta con los servicios básicos.

María Raquel se dedica a la venta cerveza y la elaboración y venta de chicha (bebida oriunda del Perú, hecha en base a maíz y jora), ella a instalado su negocio en su domicilio donde ella atiende personalmente a sus familiares, clientes  y amigos que frecuentan su negocio. 

María Raquel está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para poder compra de una congeladora la cual es necesaria para la venta y conservación de las bebidas anteriormente mencionadas.

María Raquel cuenta con buenas referencias, por parte de las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona, tranquila y trabajadora.
texts.en:
María Raquel, 21, is single living in her own house which is located in Catacaos District.  María lives in Catacaos in the rural part of the district and she has basic utilities.

María Raquel sells beer and she makes and sells chicha (a Peruvian beverage made from corn and jora).  Her business is home-based and that’s where she personally takes care of her relatives, customers and friends that frequent her business.

María Raquel is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy a freezer that’s necessary for the sale and storage of the aforementioned beverages.

María Raquel has good references from people who know her that describe her as being a calm, hard working person.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 33, cuenta con casa propia en la cual reside con sus espsa y sus 2 hijos , sus casa está ubicada en el caserío Jesús Del Valle en el distrito de Tambogrande, este  caserío es  mediano con deseos de superación.

Ernesto se dedica a realizar labores agrícolas, el cuenta  con 1 hectárea  de terreno agrícola que sus padre le han dado como herencia en donde tiene limón en producción el cual lo cosecha semanalmente con lo cual asume sus obligaciones familiares y crediticias, además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado  ovino los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral.

 Ernesto está solicitando un  préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y realizar labores de poda y deshierbo, además de compra de  alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales  y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su actividad. 

Ernesto es un hombre  bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.


.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 33 years old.  He owns his house where he lives with his wife and two children.  The house is located in the Jesús Del Valle hamlet in Tambogrande District.  This is a medium hamlet wishing to improve.

Ernesto is a farmer.  He has one hectare of farmland that his parents have given him as an inheritance.  He produces lemons that are harvested weekly and with which he’s able to cover family and credit obligations.  In addition, he also raises sheep that he later sells at the local market.  His wife raises barnyard fowl.

Ernesto is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy fertilizer for the lemons and to carry out pruning and weeding chores.  He will also buy feed for his animals so that he can sell them for a better price and continue growing in this business.

Ernesto is quite a hard working person who strives daily to get ahead and to have a better quality of life.  People who know him consider him to be a kind person who is always willing to help others.


.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, carry out pruning chores and to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José Mercedes tiene 37  años de edad, el es soltero, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos menores de edad.  El vive en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Morrope  cuenta con servicios de agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

José Mercedes se dedica a la  comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado caprino (cabritos), entre otros  los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio. José Mercedes se dedica a esta labor desde hace 5 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el negocio.

José Mercedes desea comprar más animales con sus respectivos alimentos, pues desea ampliar su negocio en la zona ya que el, cuenta con clientela ya establecida,Jose Mercedes está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr dichos objetivos.

José Mercedes es un cliente antiguo  para Edpyme Alternativa, y en todo momento a demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad,  José Mercedes también cuenta con buenas referencia por parte de las personas que lo conocen, lo describen como una persona tranquila y honesta.
texts.en:
José Mercedes is 37 years old, single, and lives in his own home together with his two dependent children.  He lives in a poor, urban area in Mórrope district and his home has piped water.  The place in which he lives is a small community which houses approximately 100 families.

José Mercedes sells animals - mainly kids (baby goats) but also other animals.  He keeps them in an area behind his home.  When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who always visit his area.  He carries out his business from home.  José Mercedes has been in this business for five years and so he knows his work really well.

José Mercedes would like to buy more animals and the appropriate feed for them as he would like to expand his business in the area.  He already has an established customer base.  He is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve his goals.

José Mercedes is an existing client of Edpyme Alternativa and he has always shown himself to be responsible and punctual.  He also has good references from people who know him.  They describe him as a calm and honest person.

loans.use: to buy more animals and the appropriate balanced feed

loans.name: Angela María

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 14 y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian  en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es bodeguero de una empresa en la ciudad de Manta.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de esto también se dedica a realizar trabajos de bordados, nos cuenta que estos trabajos los hace a base de pedidos ya que una señora de la ciudad de Chone cada quince días llega a hasta su casa a comprarle lo que ella ha elaborado hasta la fecha y le deja más modelos y encargos para la próxima quincena, lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que este es un trabajo que lo hace en los momentos que está desocupa, las ventas de los productos Yanbal y Esika lo hace dos días a la semana y estas ventas son puerta a puerta.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería, y materia prima para los bordados como telas e hilos. Esta en el banco comunal desde el inicio y es la presidenta del mismo.
 
Su sueño es tener una microempresa de tejido.
texts.en:
The members of the Damas Emprendedoras de Pachinche Communal Bank meet every fifteen days in the town of Pachinche in the parish of Colon, city of Portoviejo.  The town is known for its hard-working people who are dedicated to agriculture and livestock farming.   

In this town, we meet Angela.  She is 32 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, ages 15, 14 and 8.  The two oldest are high school students and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a winemaker in a company in the city of Manta.  

She is a housewife and, in order to earn her own income, she sells Yanbal and Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories).  In addition, she does embroidery.  She tells us that she does these jobs on order as a woman from the city of Chone comes to her house every fifteen days to buy what she has made to date.  She leaves her more models and orders for the next fifteen days.  She has been involved in this activity for 3 years and it is going very well as she can do this work during her free time.  She sells her Yanbal and Esika products door to door two days a week.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry, and raw materials for the embroidery such as fabric and thread.  She has been a member of this bank since the start and she is the president.  Her dream is to have a micro-business selling fabric.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry, fabric, and thread.

loans.name: Maribel Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maribel, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 12 y 6 años de edad, el mayor este año termino el colegio y espera poder ingresar en la Universidad y sus otros hijos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y productos de Yanbal y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de esto también se dedica a realizar trabajos de bordados, nos cuenta que estos trabajos los hace a base de pedidos ya que una señora de la ciudad de Chone cada quince días llega a hasta su casa a comprarle lo que ella ha elaborado hasta la fecha y le deja mas modelos y encargos para la próxima quincena,  lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Las ventas de las zapatillas y de los productos Yanbal y Esika lo hace dos días a la semana y estas ventas son puerta a puerta.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería, y materia prima para los bordados como telas e hilos. Está en el banco comunal hace cinco ciclos y le gusta la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the “Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche” (Enterprising Ladies of Pachinche) Communal Bank meet every two weeks at the place known as Pachinche, which is in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for its hard-working people who are devoted to agriculture and to raising livestock.

This is where we met Maribel, age 37.  She is married and has three children; ages 17, 12, and 6.  The oldest finished school this year and hopes to be able to enroll in the University.  Her other children are in elementary school and high school.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a housewife.  In order to get her own resources she sells sneakers and Yanbal and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  

She also does embroidery work.  She tells us that she does the embroidery work by orders.  Every two weeks a woman from the city of Chone comes to Maribel's house to buy what she has made so far.  She leaves Maribel with more patterns and orders for the next two weeks.  Maribel has been doing this for three years, and it is going very well for her.  She sells the sneakers and Yanbal and Esika products door to door two days a week.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry, and supplies like fabric and thread for the embroideries.  She has been in the communal bank for five cycles.  She likes the help she receives with the loans.

Her dreams are for her children to become professionals and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry, and supplies like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ramona Magdalena

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ramona, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3 años y seis meses el cual es lo más bello de su vida. El marido es controlador de  un autobús. Está en el banco comunal cinco ciclos y le gusta porque se lleva muy bien con todas sus compañeras del grupo.

Ella junto a su familia viven en una casa muy pequeña y nos cuenta que ahora que su hijo está un poco más grande están algo incómodos porque solo tiene un cuarto, necesita hacer unas mejoras en su casa, ella quiere construir un cuarto para su hijo y una cocina y así su casa va a ser  más confortable para toda su familia.
 
Con su crédito va a comprar material de construcción como: arena, cemento, ripio, ladrillos, etc.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa más grande y bien acabada.
texts.en:
The members of the “Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche” (Enterprising Ladies of Pachinche) Communal Bank meet every two weeks at the place known as Pachinche, which is in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for its hard-working people who are devoted to agriculture and to raising livestock.

This is where we met Ramona, age 21.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has a child who is three years and six months old.  He is the most beautiful thing in her life.  Her husband is a bus driver.  

She has been in the communal bank for five cycles.  She likes it because she gets along very well with all of her colleagues in the group.

She lives with her family in a very small house.  She tells us that now that her son is a little bigger, it is a bit uncomfortable because they only have one room.  She needs to make improvements on her house.  She wants to build a room for her son and a kitchen.  That way her house will be more comfortable for the whole family.

She will use her loan to buy construction materials like sand, cement, gravel, and bricks, etc.

Her dream is to have a large, well-finished house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement, gravel, and bricks.

loans.name: Monserrate Amalia

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Monserrate, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 15 y de 12 años los mismos que estudian la mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar y de uso personal como: planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, zapatos, perfumes, etc. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella ofrece sus productos a sus clientes, realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, nos cuenta que lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y que le dedica dos días a la semana.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, zapatos, planchas, tostadoras, licuadoras, etc. Está en el banco comunal hace cinco ciclos y le gusta por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras y de la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un restaurante ya que le encanta la cocina.
texts.en:
The members of the “Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche” (Enterprising Ladies of Pachinche) Communal Bank meet every two weeks at the place known as Pachinche, which is in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for its hard-working people who are devoted to agriculture and to raising livestock.

This is where we met Monserrate, age 39.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children.  The oldest is 15 and is in high school.  The youngest, age 12, is in elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a very good mother and housewife.  In order to get her own income and to help her husband with the household expenses, she has a business.  She sells household items and personal use items like irons, blenders, fans, shoes, and perfume, etc.  She sells door to door.  She offers her products to her customers, takes their orders, and delivers the products.  She takes the orders on credit, and she collects each week.  She tells us that she has been doing this two days a week for five years.

This loan is to buy perfume, shoes, irons, toasters, and blenders, etc.  She has been in the communal bank for five cycles, and she likes it because of the responsibility of her colleagues and the institution. 

Her dream is to have a restaurant because she loves to cook.

loans.use: to buy perfume, shoes, irons, toasters, and blenders, etc.

loans.name: Shirley Leticia

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Shirley, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 12 y 9 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es ebanista.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos realiza trabajos de bordados, nos cuenta que estos trabajos los hace a base de pedidos ya que una señora de la ciudad de Chone cada quince días llega a hasta su casa a comprarle lo que ella ha elaborado hasta la fecha y dejar mas modelos y encargos para la próxima quincena.  Con este crédito ella quiere empezar con la cría de animales de granja, quiere comenzar cerdos para lo cual esta construyendo un pequeño corral.
  
Este crédito es para comprar cerdos pequeños, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un buen crecimiento. Está en el banco comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan tanto a ella como a todas sus compañeras para sacar adelante sus sueños de ser microempresarias.

Su sueño es tener su propia microempresa.
texts.en:
In a place with the name of Pachinche in the city of Portoviejo’s Colon Parish, a place known for its hard working people dedicated to farming and raising livestock, the “Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche” (Enterprising Ladies of Pachinche) communal bank meets every two weeks.

We met Shirley, 37, in this place.  She’s in a relationship and has three children who are 15, 12 and 9 years old.  The two oldest are in secondary school and the youngest goes to elementary school.  Her husband’s a cabinet maker.

She is a housewife.  In order to earn her own income she does embroidery.  She does these items based on orders that a woman from the city of Chone places with her and comes by her house every two weeks to buy what she’s made to date and to leave behind other designs and orders for the next two weeks.  She wants to use this loan to start raising farm animals.  She wants to start with pigs and has built a small corral for this purpose.

The loan is to buy piglets, feed and medicine so that they will develop properly.  She’s been in the communal bank since its inception and she’s the bank Treasurer.  She likes it because of the help both she and her fellow members get to make their dreams of becoming micro businesswomen a reality.  Her dream is to own a micro business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and medicine.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María ella tiene 65 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado 4 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos estudia el primer año de Universidad. Su marido es taxista. Hace varios años estudió corte y confección en una Academia en la ciudad de Bahía.
 
Es una mujer muy luchadora que busca la forma de conseguir sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos. Tiene un pequeño taller de corte y confección en su casa donde realiza diversidad de trabajos a personas particulares que les confecciona sus prendas de vestir, además de coser también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas) y agua en bidón. En la actualidad ha empezado también con un negocio de venta de bombonas de gas de uso domestico, nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que no hay otro lugar para comprar este producto. Trabaja todos los días en sus diversas actividades desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00.

Este crédito es para comprar bombonas de gas para aumentar su negocio. Ella es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta los beneficios que le brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich cuisine and the warmth of its people, the members of the “Los Laureles”         (The Laurels) communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met María, 65, here.  She’s in a relationship and has had four children all of whom are now adults.  The youngest of them is in first year of university.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  Several years ago she studied fashion design and dressmaking at an academy in the city of Bahía.

She is a tenacious woman who seeks ways of earning her own income to help her husband and children.  She has a small dressmaking workshop at home where she does various jobs for individuals making clothes for them.  In addition, she also sells Yanbal brand products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She also sells large bottles of water.

In addition, she’s recently gone into the sale of gas cylinders for domestic use.  She tells us that she’s doing very well because there is no other place to buy this product. She works every day at her various activities from 8am until 7pm.

This loan is to buy gas tanks to increase her business.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits the institution provides her.  Her dream is to continue growing in business.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Fuerza Del Mañana (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza del Mañana está formado por 8 mujeres y un hombre, son personas muy trabajadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades con un fin común, que es mejorar la economía de sus hogares y un mejor futuro a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, se caracteriza por su belleza colonial y natural, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es calida y amable.

Para la Señora. Marcia este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue  invitada por su vecina. Tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad y en la actualidad está en el octavo mes de embarazo de su tercer hijo, su hijo mayor estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servios en una empresa privada, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Marcia hace 5 meses ha iniciado al negocio de venta de cosméticos Yanbal se dedica a la venta de domingo a domingo sin horarios ya que también cuida de sus hijos que aun son pequeños.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos de Yanbal como  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Fuerza del Mañana” (Tomorrow’s Strength) communal bank is composed of 8 women and 1 man.  They are very hard working people who are in a variety of activities with a common purpose which is to improve the economy of their homes and provide a better future for their families.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important.  It is notable for its colonial and natural beauty.  It has a varied cuisine which excites the taste buds of both locals and foreigners alike.  Its people are warm and kind.

This is the first loan Marcia has had in the communal bank which she was invited to join by her neighbor.  She’s 25 years old, married and has two children who are 6 and 2 years of age.  She is currently 8 months pregnant with her third child.  Her oldest son goes to a little local school in the city.  Her husband’s a driver and works for a private firm.  They do not have a house of their own; they are renters.

Marcia started selling Yanbal brand cosmetics five months ago.  She sells Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule since she also cares for her children who are still little.

She is going to use the money from her loan to buy more Yanbal products like perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

The small inserted photo is of one of the members who because of work wasn’t able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal products.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.en:
Porfiria is married and is 59 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of groceries such as canned goods, biscuits, oils, sugar, coffee and other basic needs. Porfiria has had this business for three years.

Porfiria is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy coffee, sugar, noodles and rice to sell. Each month, Porfiria earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Porfiria hopes to improve her business through buying additional groceries for her retail shop. She hopes that she could use this loan amount to increase the profit she generates and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, noodles and rice to sell.

loans.name: Tsagaantsooj

texts.en: Tsagaantsooj is a 46-year-old widow who lives with her four children in a house in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student and the younger three attend a local secondary school. She manages a grocery trading business in her town. She started her business in 1998 and is planning to continue her business in the future. With her earnings, she has been able to expand her house and to pay her older daughter's tuition fee. She is also saving money for her younger three children in order for them to study at a college. Now her savings has reached 1,200,000 MNT. She is a hardworking woman who attributes her success to her good accounting skill. She says, "I want to buy a car and to pay my children's education cost." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery items for her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet, 37 years old, is a married man with one child. He is a motor taxi driver and his wife is a vegetable seller. His mother and his uncle are also staying with him, so he has five family members and only his wife and he are supporting the family.

Their income is $3.5 per day. Every month, he has to spend $37 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees for his child and $10 for other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $500 to buy seed rice to do farming. He is very eager to do farming and expects that this loan will help his family to live better than before and enable him to send his child to school until he reaches university.

loans.use: To buy seed rice to plant.

loans.name: Prek

texts.en:
Prek is a 55-year-old married man with four children. He is a construction worker and his wife is raising cattle at home. 

Their income is $10 per day, and two of his sons also work as construction workers. None of his children were in school because they needed to help their mother at home in raising the cattle. 

Every month, he has to spend $90 on food and $10 for electricity. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. Without a motorbike, he has to spend a lot money for traveling, and sometimes he is not on time at work because it is hard to find a motor taxi.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Annebeth

texts.en:
Annebeth is 39 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different goods, especially daily basic commodities. Annebeth has had this business for 20 years.

Annebeth is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products such as soft drinks, sugar, milk, canned goods and noodles to sell. Each month, Annebeth earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Annebeth hopes to maintain her business so that she can send her children to a higher level of education. She prays that she will receive the loan amount she requested to sustain the needs of her family and to improve her retail store.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as soft drinks, sugar, milk, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 27 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Annie has had this business for three years.

Annie is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional groceries and rice to sell. Each month, Annie earns about PHP 8,000 from her business.

In the future, Annie hopes that she can maintain her business and make it more productive to provide her with more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and rice to sell

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a married woman with three children. She is 42 years old and has had a food selling business for three years. Lily sells fruits such as mango and banana and also some vegetables to the people in her community. She is grateful that her business is improving because she obtains many customers.

Lily is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell.

In the future, Lily hopes to maintain her buy and sell business to supply the needs of her college students. Lily is doing everything to increase her profit so that she can send her other children to a higher level of education and to pay her obligation to the Microfinance Institution.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is working for state government as a village consultant and she also sells cow horns. She lives with her mother, one brother and one sister. Her income is $5 per day, and she has to spend $124 on food, and $13 on electricity per month.  

Because the income is not enough to support the family, she would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy land to plant corn so that she can get the benefit from that planting.

She learned a lot about the career she is doing now (selling cow’s horn) from her mother but this career can earn only a small amount of money, so she needs to find other ways to get more income as now she is in charge of supporting the family. 

With this loan, she expects to buy more planting land so she can plant more corn to get more profit to buy a better house.

loans.use: To buy land to plant corn.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en: Lito, 30 years old, is married and blessed with one child. He has been growing corn for almost 15 years. At the last cropping, he earns 30,000 PHP. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional corn seedlings for his farm. He hopes that lenders will continue to assist him in the business so that he can improve it and provide his family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: To purchase additional corn seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en: Reymundo, 39 years old, is married and blessed with four children. He has been growing corn for almost 20 years. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. At the last cropping, his net income is 30,000 PHP. He hopes to continue taking loans to be able to achieve his dreams for his children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato, 49 years old, is married and blessed with seven children. He has been growing corn for almost 25 years. At the last cropping, his net income is 35,000 PHP. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional farm inputs for his corn farm such as seedlings and fertilizers. He would like to continue taking loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to him in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a forty year old single female with three children who owns a house in Kasese Uganda.  She has been dealing in second hand clothes for six years.  She started with capital of 150,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings. 

Her hardships are the supply of poor quality clothes and limited capital and her vision is owning a boutique, building a house plus educating her children.  Margret needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Alislam

texts.en:
Alislam is 47 years old.  He lives in Absheron region with his family.  He is married and has 2 children. 

For the last five years, Alislam has been working in animal farming.  He raises cattle.  Now he needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy more cows to improve his business.  He also makes cheese to sell.  He learned this business from his father who also worked in animal farming.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Bayani

texts.en:
Bayani, 21 years of age, is still single.  He has been growing corn for almost 4 years.  Last season his net income was 35,000 PHP. 

He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional seedling and fertilizer for his farm.  He would like to maintain his good relationship with KIVA and ASKI to request larger loans so that he can have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional seedling and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Taivanbat

texts.en:
Mr.Taivanbat is 23 years old, lives with his wife, son and parents in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia.  Taivanbat has been running a taxi business since 2009.  They own a plot of land and the house on it. 

His wife looks after the baby at the moment.  In addition to his taxi business, Taivanbat runs a farming business.  He has 8 horses and 2 cows.  Taivanbat is planning to buy 3 more cows with babies.  One cow together with a baby costs around 800 USD.  His parents are experienced farmers and they help to raise the livestock. 

Taivanbat’s family milks the cows and use the dairy products for their own needs.  They also sell the milk to their neighbors.  Taivanbat is asking for a loan to raise his daily output of milk by buying three more cows together with their babies.

loans.use: To raise his daily output of milk by buying three more cows together with their babies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kacerere Women's Group A

texts.en:
Monic is 32 years old and the happily married mother of four. For the past decade, she has operated a bicycle-repair business. Prior to that she was engaged in agriculture, but a close friend prevailed on her to try a hand at this business. Monic’s business is in Ntungamo town where there are many commercial bicycle riders commonly known as boda boda. These are her daily clients. She earns 240,000 UGX a week in profits. 

Monic is requesting a loan to purchase more bicycle spare parts. She figures this will give her an advantage over her competition.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 38 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He has been growing corn for almost 15 years. Last harvest season his net income was 30,000 PHP. Ruben believes that his farming has been a great help in improving his family’s living conditions.

Ruben is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He would like to continue availing himself of loans and he hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to extend their assistance to him in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Khishigdelger

texts.en:
Khishigdelger is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local kindergarten. Khishigdelger’s family owns a plot of land and small family house. Khishigdelger works as salesperson at one of the indoor markets selling sunglasses and spectacles. Her husband used to work at a taxi company as a driver but lost his job due to reorganization in the company. 

Khishigdelger is requesting a loan to buy a family car and use it to start a taxi business for her husband to give him a chance to earn money. Her loan will be used for 40 percent of the payment for the car and she will provide the other 60 percent from her savings. The car will be used by her husband to taxi passengers and provide extra income to the family.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to start a taxi business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and has been farming for the last ten years. Irene sells her produce locally.

Irene is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into the poultry business as well as construct a dairy. She notes that Juhudi loans have been of great help to farmers but laments the high costs of animal disease.

In the future, Irene hopes to use her income from her two new businesses to construct rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and construct a dairy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more poultry birds

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a a Palestinian National Authority employee. He is a husband and father of three daughters and four sons.  Mazen's mother lives with him as she is a very old woman. Mazen's mother is critically ill and needs urgent surgery.

Mazen who is photographed above in FATEN's branch in Jenin, took out a loan from FATEN to pay for his mother's surgery expenses. As a Palestinian National Authority employee with a meager salary, Mazen needed a loan to cover the surgery expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's surgery expenses.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 47 years old. She sell lotus fruit with her husband, and they get $4 per day. They have three children, 14, 12, and 8 years old. Two are working as construction workers and one is studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $85 on food, $5 on electricity and $20 on the school fees of her child. 

She explains that growing lotus fruit requires water to support it, but it is hard for her to carry the water to fill in her lotus farm, so a pump machine is the only way to help her. Because she doesn’t have enough money, she would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a pump machine to make this career run well. She plans to enlarge her career if she can get it to run successfully.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs.Tuya is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in her grandparents' house together with her grandparents. Tuya runs a fast food snack bar at the railway station.  She has been running this business since 2009. She opens her snack bar at 5:00 in the morning and closes at 9:00 in the evening. She sells different snacks like burgers, hotdogs, sandwiches and dumplings to clients who are waiting for the trains. Tuya’s husband is a freelance carpenter.

Tuya and her husband have decided to build a family house beside her grandparents' house. The loan she is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials in order to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials to build a family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Elkanah

texts.en:
Elkanah  is a 27 year-old single man who is a baker. He supports his parents at the moment. He has been running his bakery for a period of about 2 years, with an income of approximately KES. 9,000 a month. 

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he wants to use the loan to buy cooking fat and wheat flour to increase production. He hopes to grow his business and become the leading baker shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat and wheat flour

loans.name: Heom

texts.en:
Heom, 48 years old, is a humble father who has five children. Three of them are single and attend school and the other two are married. His is a garment factory worker in the Reussey Keo commune. 

Heom is a cow trader. He buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. As the selling-animal business is the main source of revenue for this family, Heom requested a loan of $1,100 as capital to purchase an additional cow for selling.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow for selling.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a forty-five year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been dealing in dried fish for two and a half years.  His vision is to own a big fish stall, and to educate his children.  Julius needs fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothes and enlarge the exhibiting space for goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee tosell

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a fifty-one year-old married man with four children.  He owns a house in Kasese . He has been in the bar-and-lodging business for twenty years.   He started with capital of 300,000 shillings and now has a house and  has educated his children. His challenge is bad debtors.  His dream is to own a depot.  William needs a loan to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: To buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 48, has been working in crop-planting since 2000 in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. From this work, she can generate an average income of US $2.5 each day. 

She was married but she is divorced from her husband and currently lives with her two married children. One of her children sells many kinds of goods in a kiosk store. 

Besides the farming business, Sok also assists her daughter in the same business and the photo shows her in front of this store. Sok would like to apply for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and other farming materials in order to start to plant her crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and other farming materials in order to start to plant her crop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He has owned a blacksmith shop since 2009. He is specialized in repairing auto bodies. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. His business income is very important because he is the main income provider of the family. 

Today he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his shop inventory. He estimates that the loan will help him meet his business needs and increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she is raising three daughters and a son. The two older daughters study at school and the other children are preschool age (under seven).  In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, Ainura cultivates agricultural products and also breeds livestock.

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock in order to resell it at a higher price after being fattened. In the near future, with money gained from reselling livestock, Ainura wants to start repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 38 year-old businessman. He is married to Agnes.  John has been in the quarrying business (stones for construction) for the past three years in Murera, in the central part of Kenya. His monthly income is KES. 6,000.  He is applying for his first loan of Ksh.10,000. He will use it to buy quarrying tools.

John plans to use the anticipated profit to sustain his family and to improve their living conditions. His hopes and dreams are to own a mining factory and at the moment he is looking for a Kiva lender to help him realize this dream.

loans.use: to buy quarrying tools
